Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Seeing Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: val-mn
Reviews.Content: Confriming what others have said that Villa Emilia is a perfect place to stay to enjoy a visit to Barcelona. The location is very convenient to the bus from the airport, the metro and just walking on Gran Via. The staff are all very helpful and friendly. Make sure to enjoy the terrace in the afternoon. I would highly recommend the restaurant for those evenings when you want to quiet dinner with some nice jazz. Because of the weather, I ate at the restaurant two or the three nights I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Declan6319
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Hotel Villa Emilia and were delighted. Excellent location a block from Rocafort metro station, and walking distance to las Ramblas and the Gothic quarter. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with great recommendations for dinner. Comfortable bed and very nice interior design in the rooms and common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dots75
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with easy access to the metro. The staff is very helpful and friendly. There is a lovely scent to the hotel lobby when you walk in from a long day of seeing the sights of Barcelona, you feel at home. The rooms are a good size and very clean. The breakfast that they offer at the hotel is a great way to start off your day. I highly recommended it. And on some evenings they have live music in the bar area. Its a great place to just unwind from the day and listen to some great music. We absolutely loved the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “City value”
Reviews.Author: PETAL9
Reviews.Content: Great hotel 3 metro stops from more expensive las rambles area. Around 4€ for glass wine in bar good value. Spar across road for water ect. Do breakfast at old bull ring downstairs 5€ for 2 coffees and pastry and slice quiche / pie. Don't eat las rambles go side streets we tried sinatras. Avoid orio as I have never been treat so rudely in a restaurant and didn't get a table as tourist and couldn't speak much Spanish. 25€ taxi to airport nice not to carry cases up and down metro and train stairs walkways on way home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in great spot...”
Reviews.Author: Reachforthesky
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights in Barcelona staying at Villa Emilia and were delighted with this little gem of a hotel. Location-wise, as others have said, it is in a more residential area of Barcelona which is great if you want to integrate with the locals. Very handy for Rocafort metro, although we didn't use the metro as most amenities walkable. Placa Catalunya was a 15 min stroll and Placa Espanya about half that. The rooms were stylish and comfortable; although we overlooked the front of the hotel, we asked for a room higher up and found it was quiet. The staff are pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was really lovely with a selection of continental items - pastries, cold cuts, cheese, bread, eggs and cereals. The roof terrace was a lovely spot to lounge, though we were unable to make much use due to the inclement weather. I would imagine it is a brilliant addition when the weather is sunny and warm. I would recommend Villa Emilia if you want a base in a lovely part of the city with good links for getting around. Don't miss Escriba on Grand Via for beautiful cakes and chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItalianChefEssex
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a nice roof terrace..really friendly all the staff.Unique atmosphere,really elegant and sophisticate.I would aspect more from the food..poor presented and basic quality..didn't impressed me at all..let's compare it to our English country side pub...that's not bad at all..but miles away from the London standard..again I would suggest some training to Paris or London.But I loved this hotel as overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Fellwalker57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Emilia for 4 nights in mid-March. It certainly deserves the high rating given on this site. While no hotel can maintain a high standard without occasional slips, Villa Emilia rarely disappointed us. The staff, especially in the restaurant, are friendly, eager to please, and efficient. We asked the receptionists to suggest restaurants of different styles and their suggestions were perfect. We highly recommend Lolita Taperia, a few minutes’ walk from the hotel. Our room was well equipped and a comfortable size although in some aspects comfort was sacrificed to elegance, for example, the square bed pillows and a shortage of surface area in the bathroom. The location is excellent: close to major sights and a Metro station but not in the noisy center. The hotel restaurant was better than we expected with delightful service, good food, and reasonable prices -- we chose to have breakfast here each day. Details distinguish great places from good ones. For example, sturdy umbrellas are available which were very welcome on a windy, rainy day; guests are given a bottle of wine; and there is tea and coffee (and tasty pastries) every afternoon in the mezzanine. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Victor L
Reviews.Content: Victor Lyness. Spent a wonderful 4 nights at this hotel. As soon as we stepped into the lobby we were impressed with the modern decor, aromatic smells and the helpfullness of the staff. Our room was quite large and had most of the amenities you would expect with the exception of tea or coffee making facilities. Breakfast in the the morning was varied and delivered with good natured aplomb by a very efficent staff. Location of the hotel is superb being far enough out of the city to be quite quit yet very close to the Metro to allow you to explore fascinating Barcelona. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a non touristy area”
Reviews.Author: noodlesue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa Emilia for 4 nights on our first trip to Barcelona. It is a pretty good location right in between 2 major metro stops. Rocafort is the closest. Also handy to the airport bus - definitely take the bus to and from the airport. Extremely well connected to public transport. We caught the metro everywhere. After walking through other areas of Barcelona, appreciated the non touristy location of Villa Emilia but would try other locations in the future just for variety. The hotel itself is very clean & modern. Wooden floors, beech furniture, sliding doors, grayish modern tiled bathroom with nice toiletries. We had a room facing the street which could have been quite noisy if the windows were open but as it was still cool, we kept them closed. I liked that the windows could be open so we could have a look out on the street. Liked the firm bed and had good night's sleep. The breakfasts were lovely - enjoyed the pastries, boiled eggs and exemplary friendly service. Best of all, really loved the rooftop area. The afternoon sunshine made it a fantastic place to chill out after a long day of touristing. Overall a pleasant stay! would recommend to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trustedreview
Reviews.Content: I will keep this review short and sweet! The hotel is superb! Great staff, good rooms, descent location, good food and excellent breakfast and I mean excellent! Top tip as advised elsewhere on here book you breakfast when you get there and save 4 euros per person. In summary if you want all the above in a boutique style hotel in Barcelona that isn't going to break the bank, you have found it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jørgen K
Reviews.Content: I have been there twice; through my job and as a private visitor. They are professional both ways and I as well as my colleagues and family were very pleased. The hotel is nice, the staff polite and helpful(i.e.finding good suggestions for restaurants near by). The breakfast was very popular for my son(pata negra ham) and for the adults( cava and/or white wine for breakfast) !!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbo037
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying at the hotel for just one night and it was fantastic- it was for my husbands birthday. Great location, the breakfast was amazing only cold but loads of it ie crossisants, toast, cereal, ham and cheese i also had a glass of cava with my breakfast made my day !!! The roof top terrace is a must watching the sun set with a goldfish bowl G & T... The bar in the evening was very relaxing with a guy playing the piano. Our room was very clean and quiet and lovely comfy bed- i would defiantly stay at this hotel again and recommend it to everybody i know.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodations for Couples”
Reviews.Author: charles a
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on other TripAdvisor reviews. We weren't disappointed! Good corner location; a block from the Rocafort Metro station. We had a quiet room, away from the elevator, on level 4. (Please note that quiet is achieved by keeping the window closed; an open window is cooler, but noisy.) We asked for a room with a tub in the bathroom. Our room had the bathroom next to the room's entrance. Bathroom has a large wood sliding door for privacy, but this floor plan may not appeal to all. (Some rooms have the bathroom in a more private location in the room.) The king bed was comfortable, firm but cushioned. The bed pillows are square, a bit unusual, but still comfortable. The staff was very helpful and welcoming (reception desk and bar/restaurant). Maps were provided and highlights for first-time visitors were noted with a personal touch. They were helpful with ordering a taxi for our departure and printed our boarding tickets, too. The (free) afternoon coffee/tea time was always welcome (on days when we returned before 7PM). Cool bottled water, hot water for tea, hot coffee and hot milk were enjoyed with a croissant, or other bread/pastry item as we cooled our heels from lots of sightseeing. The bar and restaurant service was good and always friendly. We hadn't pre-booked breakfast but added that when we arrived and found how good it was. Coffee was always great from the machine, but thermal carafes of hot water, coffee and hot milk were also available. The food and drink were always of a high standard. We had 2 dinners and a night or 2 of tapas and drinks. Two nights they had live music in the bar/restaurant (a singer with pianist, a cellist and pianist played jazz another night). Who needs to seek out entertainment when we have all this in our hotel?! English was spoken well, but we did have one occasion where a tonic water order came as a gin-and-tonic. No big problem as my husband enjoyed it so much that he specifically ordered such the next day! Restaurant suggestion: Little Italy near the Barri Gotic (Picaso Museo) was great! Went there twice for a midday meal that was wonderful. They also have live jazz at nite, but we were kept entertained with the live music at our hotel instead. Address: REC 30. PG. DEL BORN

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: catchuptraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in March 2012 on an B&B basis booked as an Easyjet holiday - we chose this hotel based on its Tripadvisor reviews. This is a really attractive hotel that feels more expensive than it actually was. Staff are friendly and helpful; rooms are modern, smart and absolutely spotless and there is a free safe - our room (32) had a view of the street below, but the double glazing meant that street noise wasn't a problem; full continental buffet breakfast had everything we could have wanted and was excellent. The hotel is in what appears to be quite a nice area a pleasant 15 minute walk along Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes from La Rambla or a 5 minute walk from Placa d'Espanya. Nice atmosphere in the bar / reception / lobby especially when the pianist was playing. I would have given this hotel 5 stars if there hadn't been a little noise from other rooms - we're light sleepers and it wasn't bad and on our stay as it hardly disturbed our sleep at all but it could be irritating at times. It would not prevent us coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelmgibson
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is a lovely hotel in Barcelona. It's slightly off the beaten track but is in an excellent location for getting to / from the airport. The reception / lobby / bar / restaurant is a lovely place to spend an evening. The pianist provides a good atmosphere and the food and drinks are reasonably priced. Loved the smell of the hotel - great! Room was large, and the only teeny complaint I have is about the bed being hard. Aside from that the staff are friendly, the roof terrace is fab - and the free coffee between 5-7 is a bonus. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great location amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: terret60
Reviews.Content: The Staff of Villa Emilia were friendly and accomodating, arriving on the early flight was no issue, our room was ready. We were asked what the occasion of our stay was for, saying "Birthday" resulted in recieving a voucher for drinks at the bar during our stay. we asked for recommendations on restaurants and all 3 were fantastic and reasonably priced. We paid for breakfast on arrival for the 3 mornings with a discount and it was well worth it. we will return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TRELISKA
Reviews.Content: Great scent when you walk in and the staff are friendly. There is a nice bar and a great terrace on the roof top. The room we had was well furnished and clean. It was nice! As another reviewer said "for my taste the beds and cushions were too hard, I did not sleep so well for this reason". The location is good, About 8 minutes walk from Plaza de Espana, about 15-20 minutes to Las Ramblas. The train is 50m from it so getting around is simple. We did not have breakfast there as we found a great cafe 2 doors away. The bread in cafe's is to die for! I would recommend this hotel for your Barcelona break.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Emilia and Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Lyn2150
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip to Barcelona & stayed at the Villa Emilia, had a great time, stayed in room 61 at the back with no view (which is what we asked for ) don't be persuaded by the fact they tell you the windows are soundproof we needed our window open all the time as it was hot in the room and the air conditioning is not yet in seasonal use. Sleep on top of your quilt as the beds are like rocks & either use the blankets or ask for another quilt. The shower is the most stupid design ever seen and you DO get water all over the bathroom so the 2nd one to use shower needs to put down the wet towels from the 1st, that said the safe is free, the mini bar quite cheap and they do meals in your room is you should wish for and the terrace on the 7th floor is wonderful although its in the shade at teatime so a bit chilly but in the summer when it will be hot it will be brilliant to sit up there in the shade. Top Tip don't fall for the breakfast offer of 10 euros its only continental, turn right towards the metro station as you come out of the hotel & just 3/4 doors down is fab bar/cafe where you get fresh cooked bacon & egg, fresh squeezed orange juice & great coffee for 5.75 euros you can also get a nice cake on way back as didn't bother with free ones on offer in hotel as heard were dried up ones from breakfast. Also take a corkscrew with you as there is a spar across road from hotel selling wine 6/7/8 euros a bottle, in hotel its 6 euros a glass & you can take bottle up to sun terrace as bar not manned at this time of year (glasses in room). Another tip buy a 2 day pass on the bus it only costs an extra 6 euro for the extra day & its impossible to see everything in one day as Barcelona is so big, if you want to see la rambles, gothic area, olympic stadium beach & harbour its on the red route which will take you a day, if you want to see la sagrada familia (pay extra 3.5 euros & take lift to top its fantastic), gaudi park & Barcelona football club its on the blue route, to get to the nearest bus stop turn right as come out of hotel, right again at metro stop & continue until get to bullring & massive roundabout, cross over roads to the left & get the bus where you will see the two big columns, (you will also see Moutjuic and the national art gallery from here) this is the red route bus, & starts with a trip up to the olympic stadium, do go up the cable cars & look around the castle at the top, the views of Barcelona are fantastic, the fenecular railway is also up there, dont get off at the national art gallery as you can walk from the hotel & do that when you have used up your 2 day bus pass, if you get off the bus after the full day off hopping on & off at the same place as you got on, walk down the opposite side of street where you will come to a fab chinese which offers a 3 course menu with wine or beer for 10 euro and its delicious. Also if you turn left as come out of hotel door and cross road there is a great pizza place that does 2 freshly made pizza's & a bottle of wine for 25 euros. If you go down the ramblas don't eat on the main street one couple we met had been charged 53 euros for a coffee & a pitta there are plenty of restaurants off main street offering a 3 course meal with wine & coffee for 12.50 euros each, also if you go down the ramblas go in the market & check out the fruit & veg HUGE!! and buy some strawberrys & chocolates they are fantastic & cheap & you can put the strawberrys in the mini bar in your room to chill before eating. If you go to the gothic area and get off by the Cathedral there is a fab sandwhich shop on the corner where you can get coffee & delic chicken baggette for 6 euros and down road (same side as got off bus) are some open air seats also another market but not as good as the one on the ramblas. Toilets are hard to find in Barcelona except in bars & restaurants until we notice a WC sign on what we thought was a bus shelter, you go down some steps as usually in underground car parks you get a key from the attendant but don't recommend doing this on a night. If your wondering where the escalators are they are on the way up to the national art gallery at the top of the moutjuic (big hill) the exhibition starts with artwork found in the pyrenees & removed & exhibited here & its out of this world & well worth going to see, the building itself is also wonderful well worth the walk up the hill. Couldn't find anywhere except airport to buy ciggies except machines in restaurants and make sure (unlike us) you go to terminal 2 if returning to UK

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - no complaints but no "amazing" factor”
Reviews.Author: northern76
Reviews.Content: Think the title sums it up. The hotel is in a very nice residential area of Barcelona, very safe and close to a good metro line station which connects nicely to most of the tourist spots in the city. The Hotel is clean and the look they have is very cool and welcoming. The rooms are small, clean and well maintained - all the rooms are the same size and there was no chance for us to upgrade, however there is so much to see and do in Barcelona, the room is really just somewhere to wash and crash which this room did perfectly for us. I guess the thing Villa Emilia lacked was a "wow" factor - they are trying to squeeze a lot of hotel into a very small space, the breakfast/restaurant/chill out/ receltion area is small, and whilst Breakfast is pleasant (and continental) enough it is basically the only space they could squeeze two tables next to each other to put bread and cold meats on. The reception area is small and never felt like there were enough people/space to help out however the staff are very friendly and helpful every time we needed. If the hotel had more space to play with then this could have been a hotel I kept coming back to, the problem is however, Barcelona has numerous achingly beautiful "boutique" hotels of which this is trying to be one - If you have booked, you wont be disappointed especially if you are exploring Barcelona, but if you are looking for a hotel where you can spend more time chilling out, then there are better options in Barcelona in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Location And Staff”
Reviews.Author: Barman90210
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel located just around the corner from the center of Barcelona (Plaza Catalunya and the Ramblas region). The rooms are spotlessly clean and modern with nice large opening balcony doors to the street. the bathroom is really classy, with the focal point being a large open backed shower with all black slate tiles surrounding the walls. The rooms themselves have a large comfortable bed, flat screen tv's with spanish and english speaking channels. There is a safe in the room which is of great piece of mind for cash, passports etc. There is also a mini bar which is very reasonable at €2 for a 500ml bottle of water and €2.50 for coke, orange etc. The roof top bar and seating area is really nice to just chill out after a long day out and about. I'd imagine it would be a fantastic place to be on a lovely summers evening. The Zinc bar is located just left of the front entrance and a really nice looking bar with a large piano situated in the center of the room. The price of beverages in the bar is a bit expensive, for example a mojito is €10 and a regular bacardi at €9. The hotels location is fantastic, its literally only twenty paces from the rocafort metro stop which in turn is only three stops from Plaza Catalunya and the Rambles area. And one stop from Espanya metro stop which is where the Airport express bus stop is located.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamburger_Deern
Reviews.Content: The general impression is positive! Staff is friendly. There is a nice bar and a great terrace on the roof top. They serve a good breakfast with fresh orange juice and good coffee. The room we had was well furnished, not so small and clean. I liked it! For my taste the beds and cushions were too hard, I did not sleep so well for this reason. But this is personal taste and the reason why I only give 4 points instead of 5. The location is good, About 8 minutes walk from Plaza de Espana, about 15-20 minutes to Las Ramblas. The hotel is located on a crossing/street so there is some traffice outside the window (we kept the windows closed at night). I liked the hotel and I would therefore recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of luxury in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: sajidgidda
Reviews.Content: First of all, I've sometimes had trouble getting taxi drivers to locate my hotel, but there was no trouble here. The hotel also has a useful map on their site. Travel time from Terminal 1 was less than 20 minutes and cost 21 Euros Check in was handled fairly well, the girl behind the counter kept us waiting for 3 or 4 minutes with no acknowledgement as she made several phone calls. Once she got to us it was handled fairly quickly and she apologised twice for keeping us waiting. Her English was superb, as is the case with many employees at this hotel We were in room 29, luckily the floral aromas ended at the door. As others have noted, the hotel has a very strong and permeating floral aroma, some might find it a bit too much. The room was free of this though and was immaculately clean and set up well. The air conditioning never worked during our stay, however, though we opened the window when needed. Our view was of a roof and a wall, so the curtains stayed closed. The bed setup is two single beds pressed together, so there can be an annoying separation between the two. The pillows are comfortable, as was the mattress. The bathroom is classy although there is no door to the shower, so you can have a lot of water going on the floor if you're not careful Service was prompt, well handled and everybody I spoke to had a much better level of English than I have of Spanish. Room service was handled promptly in a 10am-2pm window. We opted for the pre-paid breakfast which is 10 Euros instead of 14. Breakfast selection is high in quality if not in quantity. There are 3 or 4 cold cuts, salmon, cheese, cereals, a few types of bread, fruit, cakes and a DIY egg water bath. FYI, 8 minutes plus resting time for a fully cooked boiled egg.... Where the hotel really shines is the location. It's less than 100m from Rocafort Metro station which is on the most useful line, Line 1. It's only 3 stops (5 minutes) to Catalunya, the main square and Las Ramblas. Urquinaona is only one station further and that is the most convenient stop for the Palau de la Musica Catalunya. I really loved the location, on the first night we walked to Las Ramblas and it took 25 minutes, encountering a lot of bars, cafes and restaurants on the way. There is a small mini-marker across the street from the hotel but it is useful only for basics, we stocked up on water and diet coke The Zinc bar on the ground floor was always fairly lively, with a coffee presentation from 5-7pm and live music some nights. There is also a lovely roof terrace where you can drink, although there is no actual bar up there. They have an intercom to place orders etc I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody and everybody, and would look to stay again on my next visit to Barcelona. I often travel over to watch Barcelona play (got to watch Messi score 5, which is priceless) and used to stay at Le Meridian because it was actually on Las Ramblas. I'm pleased I tried this hotel out, it's a much better overall package

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atamel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and enjoyed it very much. Positives: It's centrally located, only 2 min walking distance from the metro and in a safe (but busy) neighborhood. Hotel and rooms are stylishly decorated. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are comfortable and decent size. Good WiFi in the room and in common areas. Free tea/coffee and snacks between 5-7pm at the business center. Its Zinc bar and the piano night seem to be quite popular. Negatives: Hotel was very hot for most of the time we were there (between 25-30C) so we had to open the windows but it's in a somewhat busy street, so opening the windows makes the room quite noisy. TV had barely any English channels. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: JenningsFeock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Emilia at the beginning of February for 5 days. The hotel is small & personal & has been upgraded [or rebuilt?] to a very high standard. Centrally located - all the sights are within walking distance or the metro station is only 100m away! The staff were extremely helpful - nothing was too much trouble, The breakfast buffet was an added bonus. The evening meal menu was limited but the food was excellent & good value. There's a lovely bar on ground floor & a roof terrace - I'm afraid it was a bit cold to use the latter during our stay but i'm sure it would be a great place to end the day when it gets warmer. When we go back to Barcelona we will certainly be staying at the Villa Emilia!

Reviews.Title: “I heart Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: VegasChica911
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Barcelona was fantastic! Villa Emilia was great. Very conveniently located, within walking distance to most things. Stylish rooms. Really clean. Kind staff (their English was great). Delicious breakfasts. And the lobby smells amazing! (sounds weird to say...but just wait until you walk thru the doors!) My only complaint: my bed wasn't comfortable. Overall, I'd recommend it. It's a great place to stay while in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: lovetraveling83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and enjoyed every aspect of it. The staff new English well, were friendly and helpful. It was clean, very comfortable bed and nice size room. Buffet breakfast was always fresh, and good varieties of meats, cheeses, breads, fresh fruits, juices and pastries, and yogurts. Fairly central location, many restaurants, bakeries, fruit markets nearby. Near metro stations. We did not eat lunch or supper in the nicely decorated restaurant. Mixed area, although we never felt unsafe. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “stylish comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: amcswain
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 4 nights at Villa Emilia and from check in to departure, our stay exceeded our expectations. First of all, we alerted them to our early arrival and they didn't just store our luggage for us upon our 9am arrival- they let us check in. That allowed us to take a nap and get cleaned up and enjoy the full day. The front desk was friendly and gave great city recos. The subway is one block away, which makes the hotel accessible from anywhere in the city. Located 2 or 3 stop away from the main dining and shopping district, everything was close by, but far enough that the hotel felt like a peaceful retreat. The rooms were simple, stylish and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona who is looking for both style and a low-key location.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SoTravelHappy
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very helpful and the rooms are clean. Could not ask for a better hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: VicWSurrey
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a great 4-night stay at the Hotel Villa Emilia. Staff were very friendly on arrival and gave us lots of information/maps etc. of Barcelona. Room was very clean, bed was firm but comfortable and the bathroom was very modern with great walk-in shower. Housekeeping services were top notch. Hotel is in a good position, as mentioned, a couple of minutes walk from Rocafort Metro station, so it’s very easy to get wherever you want in the city. Breakfast is rather expensive in the hotel, but there is a good variety of food so you can certainly set yourself up for a long day’s sightseeing! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely return on future trips to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fab modern contempory hotel”
Reviews.Author: jakmal
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 days in total pre & post cruise. The hotel is a little walk away from las ramblas but tube station which was easy and convenient was on corner. Walk to las ramblas and plaza catalunya also enabled us to explore nearby areas. The hotel is spotless and very friendly,we had 2 different good quality rooms (55 &66)during our split stay and i really couldnt fault them (for some the low lighting might not appeal and there is a very slight privacy issue re bathroom door as someone else previously mentioned-for me neither an issue) At checkin they offer you discount on breakfast but only if you take offer there and then (saves you €2 a day per person)-a good few breakfast places nearby too of you dont want to pay €10 a day,but we liked the relaxed feel in hotel. The bar was well used by residents and some locals,drinks were nice quality, bar staff friendly and efficient. breakfast good quality continental,check in staff gave us loads of info wothout asking,free wifi efficient. Rooms were a little warm so would hope aircon was good in summer,it didnt seem to have any effect when we tried it but wasnt even sure if it was working,im sure if we asked staff they would have sorted it but as it was cold outside we didnt mind room being warm (we opened windows anyway to cool down) We would have no hesitation in staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic City Break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Silgrim54
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa Emilia for 4 nights with my husband for a Valentine's Break. What a wonderful hotel. The staff were excellent. Rooms very modern and stylish. Breakfast was very good, plenty of choice for a continental breakfast. Free tea, coffee and cakes on the balcony (first floor) from 5 - 7pm each evening was a lovely touch. Easy to get to from the Airport. Got the Aerobus (9.15 euros return) got off at Urgell and is 5 - 10 minute walk to the hotel. return journey you have to walk to carrera Urgell again then one street back on Sepulveda very easy to find. About half an hour's walk to main sites - Las Ramblas/ Placa Catalunya etc. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: EastKent
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous reviewers that this is an excellent place to stay . Outstanding features were the friendliness of the staff and good value and quality food. We had some difficulty locating restaurants that were open or served before 9pm to eat at in the locality so chose to eat at the hotel restaurant on 3/4 nights . The Argentine steak was particularly good.Breakfast is ample but expensive if you only want a croissant and coffee- these are readily obtainable nearby. The decor is contemporary . Only down sides were the shower leaks all over the floor as it is open ended. Also it was too heated on the first floor where tea is served in the afternoon. Parking is readily available nearby in underground car parks but relatively expensive at 19 euro/day or even part day. Visted Montserrat which is a beautiful location but rather touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel with a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: JHBingham
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa Emilia is a beautiful hotel located just outside the tourist zone of Barcelona. It is, however, extremely convenient to any location because of it's proximity to the Rocafort metro stop. The hotel is literally on the same block. Additionally, there's a bank/ATM immediately across the street. If you want to save some money coming to/from the airport, you can take the Aerobus, since the hotel is directly between two of the bus' stops. Besides the convenient location, the hotel is extremely stylish. The rooms are very modern & have very nice bathroom facilities. I loved sitting in the comfortable chair. The TV had lots of channels, but just a couple in English. My room had a great view & seemed to be very quiet. My only complaints about the room are the lack of electrical outlets & the somewhat firm bed. Besides that, the room was very nice. The breakfast buffet had lots of delicious options & the coffee was amazingly good. I didn't eat or drink at the hotel bar, but it was very busy each night. The Villa Emilia was a great place to stay while in Barcelona. If you want a hotel that's not in the middle of the touristic insanity, this is certainly your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, trendy hotel, smells delicious”
Reviews.Author: dazandem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find from rocafort station and in a good location close to restaurants and shops. Chic and modern style. There is a definite effort to create a comforting atmosphere as the whole hotel smells like a radox advert. Smooth Check in and helpful staff who gave us a pack of local information complete with map. Our room was immaculate and welcoming with a swish bathroom. The only downside was that there were no tea and coffee facilities in the room and the view could have been better but I'm guessing most would be out all day as there is so much to do. we didn't opt for breakfast but found some close by. Tip... The cocktail bar is nice but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Schwabbie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in October. The weather in Barcelona around this time was about 26 degrees. We arrived at this hotel around the middle of the day and were greeted by professional and pleasant english speaking staff. We were shown to our room on the 6th floor. The room was large, modern and very comfortable. It overlooked the road, which was a pleasant outlook. I was a little apprehensive as our room was opposite the lift and facing the road and I am a light sleeper. The outdoor rooftop bar is also on the floor, above our room. I needn't have worried as I slept like a baby. I didn't hear a thing. The following morning my husband and I made our way downstairs for breakfast, which was a feast. All fresh produce, including juices and fantastic coffee. My husband and I walked to La Ramba from the hotel which took about 10-15 mins doing an easy walk. I would rate this hotel as 4 star and highly recommend it. It was very comfortable and the staff couldn't do enough to help us with our sightseeing requirements. Barcelona was a surprise city. I had no pre-conceived notions - but fell in love with the city immediately on arrival. Choosing to stay at Villa Emilia definitely added to our fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: JMK90
Reviews.Content: A bit late adding the review, but me and my girlfriend stayed at Villa Emilia for 4 nights in August and it was genuinely fantastic. The hotel is stylish, elegant and modern, whilst remaining very comfortable. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Our room was on the corner of the hotel and overlooked the junction outside. This was good for watching the world go by, but the floor to ceiling windows cut out all of the noise when we wanted quiet. The room itself was spacious, clean and decorated in a tasteful and contemporary fashion, with plenty of places to sit and relax. The bathroom was fantastic, with smart black tiles and a stylish, powerful shower The highlight of Villa Emilia is the roof terrace, which is a brilliant place to relax on the comfortable sofas after a busy day. A good range of drinks is available at reasonable prices, a personal favourite being the 'Hang Loose' cocktail. The hotel is well located, about a minutes walk from Rocafort Metro station and around a 5-10 minute metro journey to Placa Catalunya (in the dead centre of Barcelona) from there. The small Spar shop diagonally across the junction from the hotel has a range of drinks, snacks and ice creams, although the hotel does not charge excessively for these items. I would highly recommend Villa Emilia and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: Synon
Reviews.Content: stay here and you will get great rooms, great beds, friendly attentive service, fantastice bar and amazing value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to holiday”
Reviews.Author: 8HappyCamper
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and good value. Very friendly staff. Location is not central but can be walked in about 30min. The tube station is close. Free wi fi is excellent as many of the hotels we stayed in this was an extra cost. I would stay here again but staying closer to the centre would be even better

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant winter stay”
Reviews.Author: naughtydevil
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days. Pros: location near metro good stylish ambience in lobby and bar speedy wi fi clean efficient housekeeping spacious rooms for a euro hotel no hassles with wait or reception staff liked the floor to celing windows facing street hearty, delicious breakfast Cons: Iffy air conditioner, seems weak to me. booking again in August, hope its not too hot during summer no daily variation in breakfast menu, stayed 3 days and had the same menu

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Break in Barca!”
Reviews.Author: Wilko1982
Reviews.Content: We had three nights in beautiful Barcelona for my husband's 30th birthday and stayed at Villa Emilia. Before the trip the staff had been helpful in replying to my emails and the welcome when we arrived was just as warm. The hotel was easy to find after getting off the aerobus at Placa Espanya. We checked into our room, very impressed and pleased to find a propery king size bed not two singles pushed together. We did not have dinner in the hotel but did stay for a drink the lovely bar area all three nights, especially enjoyed the pianist playing in the evenings. The afternoon tea (1700 to 1900) was a nice touch and very welcome after busy days sightseeing. Breakfast was also extremely good, continental only, but a wide choice of croissants or eggs, toast, fruit, ham, smoked salmon, muffins, tea, coffee or cava! (a bit early for that even by my standards!) Hotel was very well located to the metro but also walking distance from placa catalunya (we got lost but there is always a metro stop nearby to help get back on track!) Rooms in the hotel were clean and warm, I agree with previous comments about the rather odd pillows but to be honest we were so tired after our busy days we slept well anyway! Oh and the hotel had a lovely fragrance to it! A top hotel, I would stay here again and would highly recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal contempory hotel, ideal for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: triplebagger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after our cruise and were very pleasantly surprised at this hotel. Spotlessly clean, friendly helpful staff, all modern conveniences, excellent dining facilities both in the downstairs restaurant open both to hotel residents and public and the terrace bar located on the roof top terrace. Quality of food was excellent, and unlike other dining venues in the area, quite reasonble. Although on the corner of a fairly busy thoroughfare we had no noise pollution. Ideally placed, located 100 metres from underground for visiting other areas of the city. We chose this location as it was close to Sants and Espanya stations, and their links to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, useful location, lovely bar area”
Reviews.Author: kerry0411
Reviews.Content: Don't be afraid of the metro system - it's super easy and very cheap. The hotel is only a minute or so walk from a stop on the red line. Alternatively it's a short walk to an alternative stop where the airport bus drops off/picks up. We stayed for 2 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary and lucked out by getting a room on the 6th floor. We were at the front of the building and if you opened the windows, you could hear noise, but it's a city hotel so what do you expect to some extent. They have a terrific roofterrace bar option - obviously not for us in Jan but as soon as Spring comes I imagine it's a cracking place to chill out... I did wonder if that made the 6th floor noisey for people.. but I couldn't say for sure. We had a welcome free drink on arrival and there was a bottle of wine in our room. Minibar water wasn't too costly - about 2 euros but there are loads of little markets/shops about where you can pick it up cheaper. Bed was really comfortable but for me, the pillows were dreadful. More like oversized squishy cushions - but each to their own. The staff are really kind and helpful and even put up with my truly dreadful attempts at Spanish - not necessary though as they all speak perfect english. The bar is great and good value and we had music on both the friday and sat night (piano and double base) which was a great touch. OOh and there's free coffee and cake between 5 and 7 - happy days. Also free wifi and there's a couple of free computers to use in the lounge area as well. Bad things? Well as it was January, the heating was on full blast in the hotel and it was unbelievably warm. I completely understand that the Spanish would feel the cold but it was seriously hot. We turned off the heating in our room and had to open the windows. It was too noisey for me to sleep with them open so the room was really hot. Hmm anything else... no bath only a shower but that's a minor thing for only a weekend and again, totally down to personal preference. I'd say go, it's cool, friendly, useful location, lovely staff and if you can get a deal, then so much the better. To the hotel - thanks for a great trip and your kindness. Your bar and reception staff are brilliant and I love the style of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: sanjay t
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my fiancee for a romantic weekend in January. The hotel staff were very friendly and eager to please. They were happy to sort out my request for flowers and bubbly in the room. The rooftop bar is fantastic, we had the place to ourselves during our stay, as is the Zinc bar. The set menu dinner was great value and very tasty, as was the breakfast which is well worth having. Complimentary tea with muffins and biscuits at 5pm which a nice touch. Location is close to the metro and about 20mins walk into the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room & Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: elara829
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to Villa Emilia - Our room was not set up yet - but the cleaning staff and concierge did the best they could to accomodate - wasnt a big deal bc we just dropped off our luggage and went out. The room was beautiful - smelled great - very clean. The breakfast in the mornings were no less than amazing - there was always a wonderful atmosphere - always events in the evenings. Very close to the metro and the staff was helpful when one in our group became ill - we had to get medication late at night - the conceirge found open pharmacies and called them to let them know to have medication available and that we were coming. This hotel was wonderful and I would most definetly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: Really fabulous boutique hotel in a great location just far enough away from the main hub of Barcelona to be quieter.Everything was in walking distance but metro and buses close by if you needed them. The staff were really friendly and attentive,the breakfast was extensive and excellent quality.The rooms were compact,but plenty big enough for what you need and spotlessly clean. Had an evening meal one night in their restaurant.Menu of the day was excellent value with entertainment happening in the bar area. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply, a gem”
Reviews.Author: Janeca14
Reviews.Content: The food, service, food, location, breakfast, roof top terrace - all fantastic. As bubba786 says, a definite Soho (London) vibe. I heartily recommend Villa Emilia. A tip: the nearby Esportiou Rocafort gym & pool gave me temporary membership: 4 days for 27 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: bubba786
Reviews.Content: Felt like a soho hotel in NYC!! Pros: - very swanky - afternoon tea and muffins - jazz often playing in the lobby - bar and restaurant on site - rooftop bar - wifi and computers - great rooms very comfy not huge but do the job - located in a somewhat residential area so it's cool not to be Ina very touristy area - there's a convenience store around the corner for water and what not - trains nearby as well to get wherever u need to go - the bus from the airport drops u off walking distance from the hotel - service is amazing - we got there at about 11am and even tho Checkin was at 3 they got us in our room within 20 minutes!! Cons: not in the heart of the city but great location to get around by train. We had no issues and loved it. Breakfast woulda been nice but we saved money by buying coffee and a croissant next door. They do give u a deal on bkfst when u get there if u are so inclined

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fair value, great style”
Reviews.Author: Shay Y
Reviews.Content: nice room with very comfort twin bed. the breakfest is very good. the resturant - ZincBAR is stylish and tasty. we enjoy the Jazz and drinks on the bar. we stayd for 5 nights and be happy to come back again. our room had shower and not a bath. the room was very quit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Letsgoblues1
Reviews.Content: The room was bigger than the usual European hotel. The front desk staff helpful and ready to answer any question. Breakfast for Eu 10 (a promotion upon arrival), very complete, excellent food. Fairly good restaurants nearby. Hotel at walking distance from the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn’t go anywhere else in Barcelona!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hamb0
Reviews.Content: Pros: • Super clean hotel!!!! Both in the rooms and all other areas (lobby, restaurant, bar,...). • Super convenient location (50 meters from metro’s Rocafort station). • Great hosting and exceptional personnel’s behavior!!! (My travel agent did not pay the room before my arrival as promised, and the receptionist steel kept my room!!! Moreover, she gave me the time to arrange the mater myself, when in the meantime I was also given the keys to the room!!!!!!). • Very nice and atmospheric bar and restaurant in the hotel’s lobby!!! (Nice food and live piano nights, multilingual and extremely gentle personnel). • Great room’s architecture and room’s view! • Super high Value for money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Cons: Hard to find any cons at all, but if I had to right one: • The bathroom’s door lives an open space to see through even when it is closed. Moreover, the bathroom is not soundproof at all.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londoners43
Reviews.Content: Great small design hotel. It is modern but very cosy, it even has a fire place in the winter. We stayed as a family with our cat and had a great stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast and lunch were great with a lot of attention to detail. Very good price-quality rate. Strongly recommended, we'll stay at Emilia again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sim1ny
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Very chic, clean and modern with friendly staff. Nice location, though not in City Center. 1 block from the metro stop that will take you wherever you need to go within and outside of the city. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: tomasso49
Reviews.Content: We were eleven people in four rooms and all of them were very nice and clean. All the staff was very friendly and helpful and the whole atmosphere is family-like. I can recommend it very much!

Reviews.Title: “Small and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Vartanu
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for only 2 nights. The hotel is very small and cozy, you feel almost like home. The only downside I can think of are the pilows wich could be softer, but this is no brainer. Very good breakfast withe the best quality stuff, not cheap continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Gem”
Reviews.Author: MalcWalker
Reviews.Content: If you like a quirky blend of old and new that gives you that relaxed feeling of something comfortable blended with some very modern design then this is the place for you. The staff are very friendly, you almost feel as if you have been here before and nothing seems too much trouble. We had the in house breakfast which was very good with top quality produce and also ate in the restaurant on one evening which we also enjoyed. If we ever returned to Barcelona we would also return to this hotel. The hotel is situated about 100 yards from the Metro making it very easy to get around to all the main tourist spots in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pxtb
Reviews.Content: Very modern reception area and a very pleasant smell. Nice size bed but mattress was a bit hard. I had back ache everyday. Breakfast was continental. There was no hot food so if you're looking for full English you wouldn't get it. Breakfast is served till 11 am which was handy. They serve cava and wine on breakfast too. The hotel is 2 minutes from rocafort station of the metro. To the airport the aerobus was very handy. Cpst less than 6 euro each. There was no coffee making facility in the room but they serve coffee and cake on the first floor from 5 to 7 pm. Wifi is free everywhere in the hotel just ask for the username and password for how many device you will use. The user expires midday on your checkout day.

Reviews.Title: “This is worth 6 stars”
Reviews.Author: GandTi
Reviews.Content: Weekend in Barcelona stayed at this marvellous hotel. Great position, simply wonderful staff friendly and very helpful. The ambiance was relaxing, the decor was eye catching the bedroom was first class. Well equipped beautifully presented and a real pleasure to stay in. Had the breakfast which wa son offer 10euros pp - great decisionj. Dined in on first night and the food was excellent, super presentation and very reasonable. All in all a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Hike_bike_and_like
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived at the hotel around 9:30 a.m. after our overnight flight, and the busy front desk staff were very efficient in helping us. They arranged for the storage of our bags and offered us the first available room. They also printed the wi-fi code for us to use while we waited. We did have to wait about 45 minutes in the comfortable lobby. As with most European hotels, common areas are small at the hotel, but they are well-arranged, comfortable, and stylish. Our room was fairly large (by European standards) and beautifully appointed. The bathroom was very large, and I loved the instantly hot shower with excellent water pressure. The "king" bed was actually two twins pushed together, the linens were high quality, the drapes were heavy and could be used to block all light, and the room was quiet. Over our 5-night stay, I had several interactions with the front desk. Each person with whom I spoke was efficient and very helpful, and they all were able to communicate well in English. I also utilized the excellent (but costly) laundry service. Each afternoon (around 4pm, as I recall), there was a complementary "afternoon break" with very good coffee and some nondescript pastries. The break area was on the 2nd floor, which had a balcony overlooking the 1st floor and comfortable chairs. I also had Sunday brunch at the small restaurant one morning, and the offering was good, including a great selection of fresh fruit, some nice breads and cheeses, and ham (of course). Each morning, I walked approximately 1 km to my conference near the Placa Espana, and I felt perfectly safe walking by myself in this area. In the evenings, my boyfriend and I walked or took the subway to restaurants, and we also felt safe in this city. One does have to be alert at all times for pickpockets though. (My bag was partially unzipped by a thief on the crowded metro one time, but nothing was taken. I noticed that someone was too close to me and stepped away, but did not notice that the bag (which I carried tightly under my arm) was unzipped until after I got off. The thieves are skilled.) Restaurant recommendation - TAPAC 24 -- excellent and fun! Don't be scared by the line -- it is worth the wait, and as you get close, you can order wine while you wait.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in the Eixample area of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: TheVeggieNomad
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with clean rooms and plush atmosphere. We enjoyed the nearby restaurants and bars and were just a block from the metro to connect us with Barcelona's main attractions. The only negative thing about this hotel was that it was a pain to get our laundry done, we had to request it two days in a row before it was picked up.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a reasonable”
Reviews.Author: frankcutronijr
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel at a reasonable price. The food in the restaurant was good. The roof top view was nice. I liked the idea of the room plastic room key could power the lights and outlets in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: animlluvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our whirlwind trip around Spain. At first glance, one might see this place as a little too posh, upscale, nose in the air kind of place. However, once inside the staff was professional, helpful and courteous. The rooms are decorated in a crisp, modern style and were spacious and quiet. The rooftop had comfy couches in chic black and white decor and a phone to order your favorite cocktails with delivery up to your lounging area. The location is very close to the metro stop in a nice area of town outside of the busy streets but close enough to the action. This was our first time in Barcelona so I have no other hotels to compare it to in the city. However, out of the many hotels we stayed at throughout our journey of Spain, this was the finest.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Decompression Hotel Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Patrick853
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona a couple of days after a Mediterranean cruise. This hotel was well located to be near to sites, hop on and off bus, metro, etc. so that touring the local area was without complications. Staff was extremely friendly and accomodating, and were most informative of what could be seen and enjoyed in the time frame. Taxi to airport was called timely and without any complication. Coffee hours in the afternoon were a nice way to relax after a busy day. It was nice to stay in a quiet, relaxing (bed was great), and friendly local hotel. Friends had recommended this hotel, and they were absolutely correct. Great benefit at a very fair price for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There are better 4-star hotels in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SurfColorado78
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is a 4-star hotel located in a quieter neighborhood of Barcelona. The lobby was funky, the bar/restaurant was consistently busy at night and the rooms were clean but otherwise unimpressive. We have stayed in several other 4-Star Hotels in Barcelona, including U232 and Barcelona Universal Hotel and found this one to be our least favorite. We didn't quite get the hotel's general "vibe" in terms of their target client audience: - The entrance is dominated by the bar/restaurant which creates a consistently busy atmosphere, but the check-in/reception area is sort of tucked off to the side and not particularly inviting for questions. - The rooms are clean, well furnished and quiet in terms of not hearing neighbors but otherwise the decor didn't match the theme of the rest of the property. - The bathroom is a combination of black granite a weird shower (I double-dare you to keep the water inside the shower pan). - Free wifi is a nice touch (something still not offered by all hotels in Europe). Here's where Villa Emilia gets demerits: - The hotel isn't really close to anything: tourist attractions, good/notable local restaurants, etc. It is, however a block from the Roquefort stop on the L3 line, so you can get around this with a multi-day subway ticket, but we still would have preferred closer proximity to things. - We found the front desk staff to be mediocre in service level. With the exception of checking in, and reserving a 5:00 am taxi, they really weren't notably helpful. "Tatiana" in particular should find another job - she was simply snotty. - Twice in 6 nights we were woken up by drunk people in the hallway - usually around 3:30 to 4:00 in the morning. This goes back to what clientele Villa Emilia is seeking out: in a 4-star hotel, I expect to be paying to be "above" this sort of behavior. Overall, there are worse things to complain about on a vacation. However, there are plenty of centrally located, 4-Star hotels in Barcelona with a better overall ambiance, more mature clientele, and better front-desk staff. Any of the top-10 hotels on Tripadvisor will do the trick (including U232 and Barcelona Universal), but I would pass on Villa Emilia in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close enough to walk and far enough away to be quiet”
Reviews.Author: AMJ5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break after a week's conference in Barcelona. Hotel reception very welcoming and helpful. Room was perhaps a bit smaller than many newer hotels, but was still great for couples. No coffee/tea facilities in the room, but we just wandered down to the bar with our room card and they'd provide free coffee or tea. They don't advertise this so not sure if it's part of the service or we just got lucky. Roof top terrace bar is great especially after dark sitting above the street level, there were fleece wraps to use in case it was cold which look like they are laundered and cleaned after each use. Although the terrace area wasn't staffed whenever we used it, there's an intercom to the bar downstairs to order drinks and snacks which worked well only having to wait a few minutes before drinks arrived. Took advantage of 5pm to 7pm free cakes and tea/coffee on the mezzanine floor overlooking the piano bar - nice touch. Only problem we had was the room aircon stopped working, which this time of year wasn't a big issue. As it's a popular hotel I'm not sure they have any spare rooms if this happened in summer and they didn't appear to be any hurry to fix it. We walked to the restaurant on the edge of the old town in the evening 10-15 minutes away, and had plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexacasper
Reviews.Content: Tastefully decorated hotel with not too many rooms. Spacious and clean rooms, great beds and also well insulated. Free wifi. Nice and cool rooftop bar. Friendly and perfect English speaking staff. Breakfast wasn't included, but in the neighborhood are several bakeries or cafes where you can have an excellent breakfast. Metro station is just around the corner or walk to Plaça de Catalunya in 20 minutes and in 10 minutes to Plaça d'Espanya. This hotel is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevie-hudds
Reviews.Content: There 9th to 12th November. wast access to it from airport using A2 Airobus, then an easy 10mins walk from Placa Espana. Lovely boutique hotel, away from the main hustle & bustle of Las Ramblas, but well positioned for most things, very friendly staff, very clean, always had lovely smell about it !! Didn't actually eat there, as we were so busy out sight seeing, but did have a look at the roof top terrace which, although wasn't staffed at the time, was very nice, and would guess it would be very popular in summer. Qould certainly recommend it to anyone wanting to be slightly out from the main hub hub.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but safety is of concern at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Austen824
Reviews.Content: We liked the design and location of the hotel but we had money stolen from us at the bar INSIDE the hotel and feel the ownership should consider hiring a security guard at the entrance to at least deter local vandals. Staff was not very helpful although there are signs posted everywhere to look after belongings we did not expect this to mean pick pockets are present.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem tucked away in the midst of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingFoodies
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent located this wonderful property for us and I can not rave enough about it. We found the location, while not in the "center" of all of the activity, to be extremely convenient. There was a metro stop within a block and only 2 stops to the heart and crossroads of the city. Our cab fare from the airport was less than 25 euros ($37). This little boutique hotel is compact but efficient and very well designed. The small reception area to the right of the entrance boasts a caring & helpful staff both day and night. They accommodated our early arrival and got us into a room within 20 min (when we could have been asked to wait for hours for regular check-in). We just had enough time to sit at a lobby table to order drinks and a snack from the classy bar to the left of entrance. (Try the artichoke tapa.) Just past & behind the bar is the sitting area where a lovely breakfast buffet is served in the AM w/wide variety of options. Our breakfast was included in the price of our room, but confirm this upon check-in. Our room was extremely clean and well appointed and the bathroom was quite modern. Try to angle the shower toward the drain so as not to get water out onto the main floor. There is free WiFi with a password provided at the reception desk. There is a large "bonus" of a rooftop lounge with comfortable seating and panoramic views. Even at the end of Oct it was mild enough for us to enjoy an outdoor drink in this setting before a late dinner. You can call for service to come up from the bar or stop at the bar and take the drinks/food up with you. The evening receptionist was helpful also in calling for dinner reservations and a cab. He can also recommend restaurants close by. We felt very safe in this entire area, but the receptionist asked us not to leave our luggage in the doorway unattended either upon our arrival or departure. Lastly, we were granted a little later check-out,even though the hotel was full the next day. I must mention that as we were headed off on a cruise, we only stayed ONE night. We were very impressed by the level of service and attention we received. You could see that the two day-time receptionists really ran the show!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: shelbyparker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 for a grown up weekend without the children. villa emilia was perfect for us. hotel was clean, stylish and the roof top terrace meant we could relax in style and take in the surroundings. all the staff were very helpful and courteous, and the breakfast was fabulous. highly recommended and nothing not to like. I loved the bathroom styling so much that our bathroom at home is now a replica!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkG43london
Reviews.Content: nice hotel near the center of Barcelona, the service was great and very clean, with quality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graham T
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a first time trip to Barcelona, my girlfriend found this hotel online and booked and we got a very good price. While we did not enjoy our overall stay in the city due to a robbery, this hotel is excellent and I would recommend it to everyone whether a first time visitor or a seasoned traveller to Barcelona, the hotel is very modern and stylish, the staff are VERY friendly and helpful, we arrived really early in the morning and they had a room ready for us then, the rooms are really nice and very comfortable especially the beds also safety deposit box is free as is WIFI. There is a bar on the roof which we didnt use but seemed really nice and also a well stocked bar on the ground floor which has a lovely tranquil atmosphere at night! We never went for food in the hotel but any snacks we had were very nice. As a previous reviewer has said it is more like 15-20 min walk from La Rambla which is not a bad thing at all as there is lots of cafes on the Gran Via and also there are numerous ATM machines which are indoors and is a lot safer here than La Rambla. The only issue we had was taxi drivers didnt seem to be familiar with the hotel and you often need to direct them, so make sure you keep the hotel address on you at all times. As I say this is the only (minor) issue and otherwise this is close to the best hotel I've ever stayed in and would highly recommend it to anyone!! P.S. Nothing at all to do with the hotel but I cant stress enough..Never drop your guard in Barcelona please, we were robbed on our last night an hour before we went to the airport in the Hard Rock Cafe even though they had numerous burly bouncer-like security guards which put us at ease, a bag was pinched from under our table in the middle of the restaurant, so please always be careful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous ambient hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clairep679
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Barcelona where we stayed for 3 nights at Villa Emilia. It was the perfect spot from which to explore Barcelona. 10 minute walk to La Rambla, La Pedrera and a minute walk away from the Metro station which takes you to the beach in 15 mins. The aerobus from the airport also stopped almost at the end of the road which was so convenient! The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, including the cleaning staff, who showed us to our room. The hotel is small but beautifully decorated and in a nice quiet location. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a gorgeous bathroom. A very good standard for the price. The breakfast was lovely and we also enjoyed the free coffee and croisants in the afternoon. Bar had a good atmosphere and served excellent cocktails - would definitely had made more use of the roof terrace if visiting in the summer as looked the perfect place to unwind. Only downside was two single beds pushed together to make a double but they were so comforable it made up for it. Would definitely recommend to couples on a break to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CJNSalisburyUK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a weekend stay in Barcelona. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The room was smart and modern, with clean uncluttered lines. Batroom was neat, and functional, with a shower that was easy to use. The hotel serevd an excellent cold buffet for breakfast with a small choice of ceral, fruit, yoghurt, cheese, meat and bread, plus pastries. The hotel is located in a quiet section of the city, a little out of the centre, but very clsoe to the station. Trains were every 5 minutes and took about 10 minutes into the main area. Staff were helpful and curtious. A pleasure to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: magelhaes
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is conveniently situated about a 15-20 minute walk to La Rambla. If you don't fancy a stroll or if it is raining, the Rocafort Metro station is just a couple of minutes away and can transport you to anywhere in the city, in air conditioned comfort and with full mobile network availability on trains. The hotel has a hip and modern feel, from the Vibe bar next to the reception serving cocktails and snacks to the outdoor patio on the seventh floor, where you can sip a beer, read a book or just chill out. The rooms look freshly decorated and are minimal, with straight lines and solid colours giving a clean and spacious feel - from the wooden flooring to the very comfortable bed, every detail is well considered. Given that my main requirements for any accomodation are cleanliness, fresh towels and linen daily and a powerful hot shower, this hotel surpassed in every area. If you are going to Barcelona this is a superb place to stay. The breakfast is a bit on the pricey side, but check out the cafe Diamantini on the opposite side of the Carrer Calabria, serving excellent cappucino's and fresh cakes or cheese and ham croissants, by very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaO
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful boutique hotel situated in a great place making access to anywhere in barcelona easy. it is very close to the metro which makes it easy to get around. The hotel is very friendly but at the same time feels very up market. The roof terrace is marvellous. the breakfast is great and you should leave yourself plenty of time to enjoy the delights offered including a glass of cava or wine if you feel like it. we never tried the restaurant but many others did and said the food was very good. the rooms were very nice and the beds nice and comfortable. we didnt have any problems with noise which i was worried about as we had a room with a balcony onto the street. Cant say anything bad about this hotel and will stay again if we return to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ritabix
Reviews.Content: A smallish boutique hotel with really friendly staff with excellent english. We arrived early but had emailed them to advise and so within 20 minutes we could move in. There is a nice coffee bar adjoining reception area that has scented candles burning during the evening - a nice touch. Room was just big enough and cool bathroom with walk in shower. A business centre/library/reading area on the mezz floor is another nice facilitity. There are 2 computers for use by guests however both had problem with an internet connection at various times during our 2 day stay. We didnt eat here but had excellent wine in the bar area on returning back from city centre. About 3 minutes walk from the nearest metro station (Rochfort) and 10 mins either way to city centre area. This was probably the first hotel I have ever stayed in that the air conditioning actually worked properly. There was a safe and minibar in the room and good supply of toiletries in the bathroom. The roof terrace is another great asset of this hotel and during the day you can just go and sit in the sun (bring up your own drink from the bar) and in the evening food and drinks served by another friendly member of staff. Can't wait to go back!.

Reviews.Title: “Post cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: umtigerfan1
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after our cruise. The hotel is nice and clean. I booked to be away from the hustle of the La Rambla, would not suggest if you want to be in the middle of the action. Thought the service was very lacking and not interested in helping. We walked after struggling with our luggage while the two folks at the desk just stared at us. We did arrive early and the room was not ready, the lady seemed to be annoyed that we needed to store our luggage. The room was ready when we came back after noon as promised. The rooms are small but adequate for the one night. If I had to sleep on the hard bed with the square pillows for more than the night I would be very annoyed. No English channels on the TV except one animated one. Booked the bed and breakfast rate, but breakfast was not until 7am and we had a taxi for 6:30. So no comment on that. Overall, this hotel was not my cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: turist_from_NYC
Reviews.Content: Pros: This is very nice hotel. The staff was courteous and responsive to us. Room and bathroom were very clean. Room was small (typical European room size), but cozy. Hotel has a free wi-fi, which was very handy. Roof terrace is good (but small). It is one block away from metro station (m. Rocafort) and approximately 4 blocks (or one stop on metro) away from Plaza Espanya. The area itself isn’t close to Rambala, but it is less touristy. Cons: Don’t expect to see any major tourist attractions from the roof terrace. It is on the same level as other residential buildings in the area. Terrace was packed at 8pm, and it had only one table available around 12 am. Moreover, it had only one waiter between 12am-1am (terrace closes at 1am). In addition, receptionist mentioned that we were entitled to a complementary drink (because we had some troubles with our itinerary). However, when we approached the waiter, he didn’t have a clue about it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - definately a place to stay when in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ESCZ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, trendy, clean, good location, only 15 minute walk from the shopping district. Friendly staff and great food. The roof terrace is a great benefit and lovely at any time of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Knock Out Spot!”
Reviews.Author: david_caruana
Reviews.Content: This is a small but cool hotel with excellent accommodations, fabulous breakfast, terrific roof-top bar and polite and helpful staff. We even thought the bathroom was neat. The location is a short walk to Las Ramblas which is the centre of Barcelona's tourism. It was our first destination of our 10 city tour of Spain and set the standard for a wonderful time in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TheFyfes
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Emilia - "a good place to stay in Barcelona" We found this hotel on Tripadvisor and it proved to be an excellent choice. The rooms were very well finished and even though we had an outside room, we didn't find the traffic noise obtrusive as the double glazing was excellent and the air conditioning was very effective. Some of the best bits of the hotel were: the roof terrace was a gorgeous place to sit and relax with a drink; the free coffee and pastries from 5-7pm each day were very welcoming after a hard days sightseeing; free wi-fi in the bedroom as well as 2 free computers for guest use; very close to Rocafort Metro station which meant getting around was very straightforward; friendly and helpful hotel staff. The only downside of the hotel was their food prices which we didn't find to be good value and we ended up eating out every night. Also, great wee bar and cafe across the square called Cafe Diamanté where the staff were some of the nicest people you could wish to meet and the prices were very reasonable. Overall, a lovely hotel which we would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: andythescot
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Barcelona, thanks largely to this fantastic hotel. Situated in a great location between place de catalyuna and place de espana. Really nice, modern decorated rooms with a cracking shower. The main plus for us, was the beautiful roof terrace. Although quite expensive ( much the same as most of barcelona), the relaxed atmosphere was a god send for our getaway weekend. We really enjoyed chilling at the end of the evening up there. Also, big thanks to the very helpful, friendly staff, who made our stay that much better. Breakfast was excellent also. One downside for us was the lack of noise insulation. When we fancied a lie-in, we were woken as soon as the cleaners began.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: beemac53
Reviews.Content: The Vila Emilia in Barcelona provides a quiet, stylish stay in an area which is easily accessible to most tourist attractions. The room I stayed in was modern and comfortable with everything I needed. The rooftop terrace is a good place for a drink in the evening and the barman provides good tips about local restaurants. There is a business centre on the mezzanine floor if you want to catch up on work and the internet service throughout the hotel was good. The staff are helpful and went a long way to ensure a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: daisydiddle
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is located in a more residential area than many of the other hotels, which makes for a quiet and safe location. The reception, bar and restaurant are all very attractively decorated and so are the rooms We just had a standard double, but it was more than adequate. The bathroom was plenty big enough, with a large walk-in shower and toiletries from Rituals. There is breakfast available, but apart from boiled eggs, it's continental only. There is a great terrace bar on the seventh floor which is open from 08:00 to 24:00 daily. We definitely plan to go back to Villa Emilia.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location, luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: A very beautifully designed hotel. The clean and comfortable beds - though be advised the twin beds are really just like one king bed. The bathrooms are very modern and nice. The staff are really helpful. Excellent rooftop terrace to have a glass of wine in the evening. The location is nice, in a more quite neighborhood but, within walking distance to "downtown". Also a metro station is just steps away and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: PierreTT
