Reviews.Content: As in the title... Good vibrations there, the roof terasse is very interesting as well. The only down side: noise. This is not a 5 star building and you can here what is going on the corridor and other rooms. Other than this, pretty clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “.....”
Reviews.Author: missylee28
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights on Sept 2011. check-in was quick n the staffs friendly . i find the room slightly small other than that it was cozy and the bed was comfortable. on the contrary the bathroom is spacious , with a standing shower separated from the toilet by a glass partition. however, i wished there is curtain shower as the floor tends to get wet when we shower. Rocafort metro is just a short walk from the hotel , Placa Espanya is 15-20 min walk n cabs from Las Ramblas cost about 10euros.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, comfort and friendly”
Reviews.Author: j_dyok
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. The staff are simply the best. We really appreciated the afternoon coffee and internet access availability. We had a credit card problem which was not known until the last minute which creates a ton of anxiety when trying to keep a reservation. To the hotel's credit, they honoured their commitment. Hotel is away from it all so you do have to be prepared to either walk or metro to the center. Great place. Stayed four nights which in our opinion was one night too long for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “quiet modern hotel with ready access to tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: SusanManlyNSW
Reviews.Content: Villa Emelia lived up to all the positive reviews we had read on trip advisor. It was a modern exceptionally comfortable hotel with easy access to transport- metro station at the end of the block. there were also a number of deli type shops in the block for those who prefer to breakfast or snack out. The room was a good size with excellent bed and linen. bathroom well fitted and spotless. Breakfast which was part of our deal was a continental and well stocked. There was the capacity to boil eggs too. The dining room food was a bit on the ordinary side but the tapas on te roof top bar excellent. Hotel reception very helpful and made our room available early as we had arrived on a cruise. In all a very comfortable stay in a safe area .

Reviews.Title: “Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: DimeStoreSaint
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. From the extremely friendly staff to the cozy atmosphere, I couldn't be happier with the booking. The staff was always saying hello and goodbye and never had a problem with out lack of Spanish/Catalan. The room service was pretty tasty and always delivered quickly. The roof top terrace was a nice touch too. My girlfriend and I had a glass of Cava there on our last night and it was a good way to cap off our trip. The hotel is a little removed from the hustle and bustle of the city center, but it was a short walk (or subway ride). I actually preferred this because it was quieter and it allowed us to enjoy more areas of the city we probably would've skipped at another hotel. The stylish look and the large rooms made this hotel a nice find and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Bretagtravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and found the staff to be so lovely and helpful. The rooms were also clean, comfortable and tidy. The bathroom was fantastic with great towels and products. We didnt have a chance to visit the bar at the top of the hotel for long but it had a good view and had a great feel and the drinks we had were good. If we ever go back to Barcelona we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel nice location”
Reviews.Author: Willem999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre cruising for 1 night. The receptionist was very friendly and provided us, wihout asking, with a map of Barcelona. Next she gave us detailed information on several aspects. Nice boutique style hotel with clean rooms. Our room on the second floor at the street side gave only a slight traffic noise in the morning. The beds a little bit on the hard side but good. For € 120 a fair price. The terrace on the 7th floor is lovely for sipping a wine. We had breakfast in a local place 200 meters from the hotel. For € 7 fresh orange jus and croissants for 2 people!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaztic
Reviews.Content: forgot to provide this review earlier (oops) - actually stayed in June 2010 - great little property - staff were reserved but very efficient and professional - which works well for me anyway the photos on this site accurately depict the hotel - which was stylish and modern - i can't respond to any of the less-than-positive comments other than to say - our shower was fine and there were enough toiletries that i still had some in my travel bag a month or so ago i particularly appreciated the way in which they dealt with my lost booking (my fault - lost credit card - payment failed - mobile phone not roaming etc etc) and took the time to confirm all my other forward bookings throughout Spain which could otherwise have ended in the same 'lost' bucket and a very bad holiday experience great location wthin a block of a metro station - didn't eat or drink in the hotel so can't cfomment on the service there - but did find a couple of nice little places very nearby which bodes well for the neighbourhood in general

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Okifurbi
Reviews.Content: For one hundred ten euros per night in August there is not much to complaint about. Rooms smallish but modern and clean, hotel deco very nice, great location, FO manager and reception just average (not too much friendliness in their service) If I had paid 200 euros my rating would be just average I would definitely recommend this hotel as long as you are paying the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel on the outskirts of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: happytrails2uall
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Travelocity and stayed there for 3 nts in Sept 2011. Paid about $188USD a night and felt it was well worth it. The hotel itself is very clean and modern with a nice bar / restaurant in the lobby area. Check -in was fast and friendly while the elevators were small and slow. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet even though we were facing a busy street. The bed was firm and I wish they had normal sized pillows instead of the two small square ones. We loved having a drink on the upstairs terrace at night. They have a full bar and waiters up there to give you what you need. Even though the hotel is situated away from the major tour sites we found the metro very easy to use and there were two metro stops just a short walk from the hotel. We loved everything about BCN and would not hesitate to stay at Villa Emilia again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review - roof top employees warm and friendly, others were a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average in my opinion because only some of the front desk staff were warm and helpful, not all. On our first day we returned to our room about 12 midnight and our room had not been cleaned. When I called the front desk, the man was indifferent at best and when I asked for clean towels he said we had to come downstairs to pick them up - which was not hardship, but his tone was completely unapologetic. The hotel was fine, but nothing special and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: oceanauthor
Reviews.Content: This was our third attempt at finding a good place to stay in Barcelona and finally I can say that we are set for all our future visits! The Villa Emilia is a modern, classy, delightful little hotel, within walking distance to most of Barcelona's sights and close to a subway line and airport buses. We arrived tired and loaded down with camping gear after a kayaking trip in France and we were greeted with a warm welcome from the front desk. Our room was superb! It was airy and light, with a number of large windows that looked out at the busy intersection, even as the soundproofing kept traffic noise out. The bathroom was equally modern, the entire place felt crisp and fresh. We didn't want to go far for dinner and the front desk recommendation of a place just around the corner was perfect -- our last meal in Europe could not have been better. Again, this is a great hotel find!

Reviews.Title: “Simple yet posh trendy Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: NohaQ
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, kind of small rooms but very clean and comfortable.Very nice breakfast but lacks variability for food lovers, tea was very aromatic and perfectly served in small black china pots. And don't forget to pay a visit to the Salon Roja (the bathroom downstairs) very trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel, location could be better”
Reviews.Author: macca_kent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights pre cruise. We had two rooms, which were adequate but rather small. They were clean and comfortable, the bathrooms had showers and were stylish The staff were excellent - very friendly and helpful On arrival, which was quite late, we decided to go to the roof bar as they were having a BBQ evening - The menu had a set price which included BBQ meats and a glass of wine, on the whole this was a relaxing and enjoyable experience. The hotel is a litlle out of the way, there are better locations in Barcelona, but because of this it provides comparative excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly, aggressive owner”
Reviews.Author: Eli978
Reviews.Content: Friendly service personal, but the owner is very unfriendly and aggressive. Stay far away from the Hotel or if needed far away from the elevator. Sounds like sleeping in a machine hall. If you say it to the owner he screams at you, very aggressive, tells you " go to Switzerland" and other unfriendly remarks.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Flora K
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very impressed with the room, cleanliness and decor. Reception area is elegant and we loved the roof terrace, it's perfect for having a few drinks at the end of the day. Room was lovely and comfortable. Great location, just 2 mins walk to the train station, and shops around the corner. Very modern hotel. Would come back here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Villa Emilia is a delight!”
Reviews.Author: MiniCoop
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at Hotel Villa Emilia. We were so pleased with this friendly boutique hotel. We loved the fact that it is located away from the tourist areas and noise. The hotel is so close to the metro which is extremely easy to use, and gets you anywhere you want in Barcelona in minutes. We bought a three day pass. The staff is lovely and accommodating. They even packed a box breakfast for us when we left, as we had a very early morning flight out. The terrace bar is a beautiful spot to end your day and relax after sightseeing....As we loved visiting Barcelona, we know we will return to this little gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Girl0741”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0741
Reviews.Content: After reading about this hotel on this site, we booked for a 3 night stay. The hotel was very clean and close to transport. The staff, especially, Tatiana, were very helpful and friendly. We even managed to ride the Metro, alone, not bad for a couple of 70 year olds in a strange city.! The roof top bar was relaxing and friendly with great cocktails. The tapas luncheon was fabulous and the breakfast delicious, especially the egg cooker.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Janet186470
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel - room modern and good bathroom with Ritual toiletries. Saff very helpful. Very quiet at night. Lovely roof top bar where we had cocktails on the last night. Ate in Zinc bar the first night and food was excellent. We had breakfast the last day and it was good but 14 euros is too expensive. There are a lot of little cafes nearby to have breakfast. Saw the Magic Fountains the first night and loved these and ate at a pizza restaurant on the rooftop of the Arena shopping centre. Took the bus tour for two days which was excellent. Discovered that if you turn right at the end of the street rather than left to the Rambla that area with the magic fountains is good for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Zinc-bar- a spot for a midnight glass of wine”
Reviews.Author: littleplant
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a hotel near by Villa Emilia but I just couldn't miss the great looking Zinc bar when walking down the street to the Rocafort metro station (red line L1). I gased through the window every time i passed next to this bar and one night deciced to pick up my friends and go inside (there is a street terrase also). The interior is nicely decorated, big black tables and chairs, huge lamp, a piano, a big wooden cabinet, a good selection of spanish wine and great service. It was midnight when we arrived and there was nobody inside except the great waiters- they were more than helpful and when they heard that one of us has birthday at midnight thay gathered and sang happy birthday and played some happy songs from they mobile phone, it was very funny and nice to see people at the end of the working day with so much enthusiasam. That is the thing that makes your night out special and rememberable.

Reviews.Title: “A good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: zyder9
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 4 day break in Barcelona staying at the Villa Emilia and felt we had a very good stay with great value. The position on Trip Advisor says a lot. We got a cab to the Rocafort metro as the driver didn't know where this hotel was and we knew it was close so we walked the 50 or so yards to the hotel from there. Many have mentioned just how close the underground is and because it's in a quiet area it's a massive plus. Still, we walked a few times to the main tourist area which took around 30mins. The open top bus tour is fantastic in the city as points of interest are spread around and the hotel gave us a discount for 2 days travel on it...... one stop is only 10 mins walk away so although this hotel isn't right it the busy areas, getting around is easy. Staff were excellent and friendly including the cleaners who were always smiling. It's extremely clean and would definitely recommend to any travellers.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mark E
Reviews.Content: Perfecto! The hotel always smells great - must be some special scent they use. The rooms are super clean and brand new. The reception is very unique and warm with original designs and lovely candles. The staff is super friendly and professional...The rooftop is very scenic but the food is quite limited and they only offer 1 type of beer. Great place which we highly recommend. Lives up to the standards of beautiful Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: icebug5555
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern hotel. We did not eat at the hotel since the prices were quite high. The staff although nice, were not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It has everything you neeed !”
Reviews.Author: Alain and Dania G
Reviews.Content: For a couple with a years old,Villa Emilia impressed us all. Rooms were very nicely decorated and very clean, nice smell in evey room even hallways. Location was amazing close to everything and the terrace bar very relaxing and enjoyable. Breakfast has everything you need for a healthy and balanced breakfast. Staff was very friendly and helpfull, the hotel manager was there most of the time to ensure everything was running well. Thank you for a nic stay and we would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Shmaffle
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Great location - one block from the Metro. The Metro was very easy and cheap to use. The hotel's staff were very friendly and helpful in all ways. Make the most of the wonderful terrace and have glass of wine or cava for 5 euros. We had the hotel breakfast one morning which was very nice but rather expensive for 14 euros each. Recommend heading towards the Metro station - there is a patisserie on the right where you can get pastries and coffee for two for less than 5 euros. Rooms are immaculately clean and well sized. Very quiet/well sound proofed. Overall a great experience in Barcelona - great people, food, wine, culture and weather. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: EzraA
Reviews.Content: Wasnt sure what to expect for such a cheap price in Barcelona but was so pleasantly surprised about everything. The hotel is just 3 train stops ( 5 mins ) to Rambla and perfectly situated to nice non touristic breakfast places. Hotel was extremely clean and the staff extremely helpfull when they can be. Nothing but good things to say about this hotel, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Clean & Modern, hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: Moorlander1969
Reviews.Content: Good location v close to a Rockafort metro tube station, (as soon I bought tube tickets the wife said she’s afraid of tubes!) so used as a base we walked everywhere (magic fountains/beach/ramblas/sagrada/casa mila) except for Guell park (catch a bus from Placa Espanya) Free coffee/tea/pastries every evening on 1st floor above reception every afternoon! Reception staff superb, rooms clean & modern, no noise from the street outside. We thought Breakfast was expensive, so we went around the corner to a little rustic place called El Moli Vell, if you go out of the hotel & turn left, following the road, then first right its on the corner, fresh pastries/bread/juice etc v nice & cheap! There is also a shop next door to the Hotel (turn right outside the Hotel) which looked really good but we never went in..next time! A supermarket is only a block away for anything you might need Restaurants try Attic on Les Rambles, I don’t normally try places that have people outside showing menu’s, but I can understand why as when you enter the building you have to go up to the 1st floor, anyway its a modern –style place with excellent food/service. Hotel highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kfafa
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, attentive service, rooftop bar for smokers, free afternoon tea/coffee with patisseries, cool bar/resto in lobby, minutes walk to closest metro, highly recomend

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica R
Reviews.Content: Modern, well-appointed hotel: perfectly clean; spacious, comfortable beds; beautiful 7th floor terrace bar; delicious breakfast included in room rate. Perfect location approximately 1 block from metro station and within enjoyable walking distance to Barcelona's intriquing neighborhoods and sites. Only drawbacks to our one week stay were the level of hallway noise heard in our room (elevator, doors slamming, housekeeps) and low level of bathroom privacy (glass walls, sliding door, no fan).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Rikaj77
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. A superb boutique hotel - really good value. The staff were extremely helpful, rooms v modern and high quality. The roof terrace is a great place to relax in the evenings before going out. Location good - just a few metro stops from the centre. We had a great time and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “"We shall return"”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraC16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Emilia for about two weeks and really enjoyed our stay there for many reasons as follows: The main reason for our visit to Barcelona was that our son lives in Barc. and we were visitng him on a surprise for his birthday and he was not aware that we were there till the day of his birthday. The chef Varim at ilia made a special dinner for us on the night with a complimentry bottle of champagne for our little celebratory group. They also catered for our little grandaughter who is 3 years old and has a very limited taste in food, The menu for dinner at other times ( we did eat out many times) was good although there was not a great selection to choose from ( this was to be expected as the kitchen is a little small) As for the breakfast menu it was also rather good in that it had a good selection of food available for the morning meal. The rooms were adequate not too big and not too small I liked having the safe in my room and the free internet service as well. IN other words the room was cosy, maybe could have been just a little bigger as we had a bit of difficulty in finding places to put our luggage and 'junk' as one acquires on a holiday. But overall it was quite satisfactory indeed, The bathroom was okay the only complaint i would have had is the water from the shower went over the edge of the shower recess and I had difficulty in drying some or our clothes I had to use the handle of our suitcases to hang washing on, but his was nt a great issue at all as the room was clean indeed and comfortable the bed was also good and cosy. The air conditioning seemed not to work after a certain time in the night and so we had to open the door to the outside to ger a little cooler, which was not a great problem as the fresh air sometimes is better but it would have been good to have the air conditioning on all night if possible. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous at all times especially the cleaners and bar and kitchen and dining staff and I would give them a 9 out of 10 for smiles and politeness and helpfulness. The front desk staff were okay as well but could have been a little more smiles on their faces. The terrace was just magic and indeed we spent many happy evening up there with either drinks or just relaxing and the people there were extremely wonderful and so inviting and they remembered what we liked to drink we did not have to ask for service at any time as they were so great, Thank you to them for their service they were extremely helpful in telling us where to go for reataurants when we did not want to at in the dining room every evening. They were of great assistance as was Varim downstairs. My only complaint was that there was not a small pool on the terrace as this would have been just magical as we sat in the hot sun on most days and this would have been so wonderful. We really liked this small hotel and when we come back to Barcelona we will most certainly stay there if our son has not moved into a bigger apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: PeterSummers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and were very impressed. The visual design and style of the hotel is very pleasing, the room was great and also quiet, the restaurant served modern Spanish dishes, the staff were very helpful and the rooftop bar is a terrific. The location is not great as it is away from the main tourist areas but a tube station is 2 minutes away and Barcelona's Metro is exceptionally good. Some of the tourist areas (e.g. Joan Miro's Park) are about 10 minutes walk away. There also was free wifi and breakfast was good with a choice of bread types for a change. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: JoLe48
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews before going and it was exactly what we imagined!!! Well situated, close to subway station "Rockfort", room was clean with wood floors, nice contemporary feel in entire hotel with nice terrace bar on the roof! And all that at an affordable price! What else can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Terry H
Reviews.Content: After several weeks of researching Barcelona hotels I finally booked a 1 week stay at Hotel Emilia and it turned out to be the best decision I could have made. The location was close to the subway/metro and central to every thing that we wanted to see and do. The surrounding neighborhood has a selection of casual resturants, deli's and supermarkets to choose from and we felt very safe walking the area both day and night. The hotel itself was stylish and modern with a local feel. Our queen size room (shower only) was clean and comfortable with plenty of light. We ate breakfast and dinner in restaurant and both were very good. The lobby bar and lounge area (live entertainment) is a great place is kick back and relax not to mention the roof lounge. Daniela & Maurice made us feel very welcome and made our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “We'd book there again”
Reviews.Author: Pamala S
Reviews.Content: Room was great, bathroom spotless, staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was close to Metro and other modes of transportation. The Buffet Breakfast gave us lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic four days!”
Reviews.Author: jef90
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a while hunting for the perfect hotel to stay in during our short trip to Barcelona and Villa Emilia was perfect. We're both students (20 & 21) and wanted to treat ourselves to a nice place to stay and couldn't believe how amazing this place was for the price! Our room was very spacious with a beautiful bathroom. We had everything we needed; we looked right over the the street but you would never have guessed. It was piping hot the whole of our stay but the aircon left the air at a perfect temperature. The hotel is lovely; free coffee from 5 'til 7 was a nice touch (though do remember it is on floor 1 and not in the bar area!). Although we did not eat any breakfast, we did have dinner in Zinc on our first night as we were too tired to hunt somewhere down. We went for a set menu, with salad, chicken and peppers and a chocolate brownie. This sounds normal but it was definitely one of the best meals we ate out there, really delicious and fantastic value, we really couldn't believe our luck. Drinks on the terrace afterwards was a real delight and so peaceful - ideal for any age couple and friends! One word of warning - we were planning on attending the thursday terrace BBQ but failed to book as we didn't realise and ended up trying to find food elsewhere, so remember to book beforehand, it's very popular! A few tips: we got the aerobus from the airport to Placa Espana and managed to find it by walking, so if you're ok on your feet it's not hard to find. We also stayed out late a couple of times, and the metro shut. There are ways of getting back (night buses) but we did walk and get a taxi so plenty of options. We ate alot at the marina so make sure you head there; the best tapas we ate was on a boat at the harbour. The staff were all very helpful and the area is good. We recommend getting a travel card for the metro for your entire stay as we used ours constantly, but seemed to walk far too! Barcelona is a beautiful city and has everything to keep you busy for days and days. This hotel is beautiful and a fantastic place to stay. We thoroughly recommend it! Thankyou for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Lovemybreaks
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our Silver Wedding anniversary and wanted somewhere special to stay in Barcelona. We are so glad that we stayed at Villa Emilia. On arrival, we asked for a room facing the inside as we like peace and quiet at night to sleep. The hotel gladly met our request. We don't think it would really matter if you were at the front or back as we reckon that it would be quiet anyhow. The room was superb. We loved the bathroom and especially the walk-in shower. The water was always piping hot which was ideal when you came back from the beach or after being caught in a thunderstorm!!! The roof terrace is a delight. The staff are really helpful and very friendly and were always ready to help with directions or the best way to get to certain places. The breakfast has loads of variety and even for those who would normally prefer a cooked breakfast, Villa Emilia will make you change your mind. The selection is outstanding and is continually replenished. We had breakfast at 7.30am one morning and at 10.30am another morning and both times there was no difference in the amount of food that was available. We loved the fact that we could boil our own egg in the nifty wee machine. The hotel has cracked it with the complementary coffee, tea and pastries from 5pm to 7pm. We had them every evening but one and we actually missed having what we saw as a treat as it motivates you to come back to the hotel, freshen up and then go out again at night, The one night we missed this, we came back in about 7.30pm and we couldn't be bothered to go out later. The tea and coffee is a great refreshment. Some general tips for you. At the airport terminal we were confused but we got the T10 Multiperson ticket (8.25 Euros for 10 journeys - fabulous value) and took the Renfe train into Passeig de Gracia. Be careful to get out there as another couple of tourists told us that we needed to get out at P de G otherwise we would have been at the other side of Barcelona. From P de G, you can get the Metro Green line to Catalunya and then the Metro Red line to Rocafort and once you get out, you will be close to the hotel but there are several Metro station exits and entrances for Rocafort so just look around you when you exit the station so you get your bearings. The streets have good signs. Going back to the airport was not much easier by Renfe train but to cut a long story short, I would recommend the Aerobus at 5.30Euros per person which leaves from Place Espanya which is about 10 mins walk away or one metro ride away from the hotel. It might be more expensive but a lot less confusing. The hotel seemed to recommend the Aerobus as well but we had a few journeys left on the T10 ticket and decided to use them up. If you like excitement, the train station will indulge you. Towels for the beach - on the rooftop terrace there is a rack filled with large bath towels which you can take with you to the beach. After you are finished, you can return them to a laundry rack on the terrace. Great idea!! Open top bus - must do. We had ticket for 2 days - you get a 2 Euro discount per person if you request the pack at hotel. Great for jumping off and on. Musical fountain only takes place from Wed to Sunday - we missed it as we went on Tuesday night but hey, it is worth your while walking up to the National Art Museum - the view of Barcelona is breathtaking and will be one of those memories you will treasure. Nou Camp - Excellent and fascinating even for a person generally not interested in football - that's me! Las Ramblas - great atmosphere, especially at night. At the bottom end nearest the column, as you walk down just turn to your left and you will encounter a square with loads of restaurants and also the quaintest streets imaginable in the Gothic quarter. Eating out - loads of great places - we ate our anniversary meal at the Port Olimpic in a restaurant called The Taberna Gallega - excellent selection - just beware that potatoes are actually crisps. If you want chips, ask for French Fries. Barcelona is a fabulous place. We are telling you no more - you have to go to find out for yourself. We would highly recommend the Villa Emilia as a central location for all sightseeing. Staff are great, food is fabulous, rooms are terrific - the positive adjectives just keep coming about this hotel. If we go back again to Barcelona, we will definitely stay at the Villa Emilia - thank you so much to the attentiveness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good staff & good location.”
Reviews.Author: kangarooboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before a cruise. Loved this place, free internet, coffee area etc. However rooms on the coffee area terrace can be noisy. Lovely clean, large room & modern large bathroom. Close to city & cruise terminal. Free bottle of win for booking on internet which we took to & enjoyed in their restaurant. Nice roof outdoor bar too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: SoBe_Pete
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at this hotel. It was conveniently located in Central Barcelona with easy access to the metro system. The value of the hotel for the price was great. It is a medium sized hotel in a quieter area of the city with nicely appointed common areas. Fantastic breakfast area and a nice selection of choices (no short order cooks or omelet station...but great cappuccinos). Nice service. Fantastic roof top bar to start off the evening or to unwind. Free internet access. Rooms are adequate in size and comfortable beds with modern styling. Nicely sized bathrooms with a modern shower. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heart-beat”
Reviews.Author: DiningPilgrim
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Villa Emilia. If you are arriving to Barcelona by plane, it's not a long walk from the Placa Universitat stop. The hotel itself is well-appointed, rooms modestly sized (but just right for us), clean and quiet. We selected the bed and breakfast option, and the buffet was a nice mix of items, tending to tide us over through lunch-time. While it's not right in the City Centre, we preferred the location. It's a short walk to Montjuic, and our walks to central Barcelona weren't lengthy. It was, however, a nice break from the bustle and generally naff feel of Los Ramblas. Highly recommended and we're stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints - We'd come back”
Reviews.Author: Chavetto
Reviews.Content: It was fine. Clean, sleek, modern. It was relatively close to to a metro stop that made it easy to ride to any destination but wasn't in the best location for walking. Our room special included breakfast which was nice. One morning they even brought it to our room for no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zotise
Reviews.Content: Good location. Immaculate rooms. Liked computer access. Coffee and pastries were a nice afternoon treat. The bar and piano music were also great.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in an outstanding city”
Reviews.Author: c_and_cd
Reviews.Content: We just loved Barcelona! Villa Emilia added to the enjoyment. It is quite a stylish hotel in a convenient location. We found that we could walk easily into Placa Catalunya as well as across to Placa Espanya. The room we had was a good size and the bathroom facilities were excellent - modern, stylish and most importantly scrupulously clean. Nice toilettries too. Staff on reception were very helpful not just to us but we noticed, to all guests.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, high class”
Reviews.Author: Ylvalie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet area of Barcelona, you'll have none of the la Ramla buzz outside the door. It is however closely located to the Rocafor tube station which gets you pretty much anywhere.The beds are quite hard, the room is adequately equipped and the breakfast (although a surcharge) is beautiful. The roof terrace is cool and an oasis in the summer heat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Flonaldo
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is a bit out of the way of any real sights of Barcelona. But the nearest metro station is only one block away from the hotel, and walking to most sights is possible as well. Everything is clean and in order at the hotel. The single room I stayed in was an OK size, not very big but not uncomfortably small either. No real view from the room, only to backyards of big residential buildings. No noise from outside or inside apart from some moving of furniture on the top-floor bar quite lat at night - but not enough to bother at least me. Breakfast was well presented, a good selection offered and everything was constantly replenished. The dinner menu at the hotel restaurant was affordably priced and good value for the money. Also the staff at dinner was very attentive and really pleasant. The lifts at this hotel are really small and quite slow! Would probably recommend this to my friends, but might also want to stay somewhere a bit closer to the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: 1981Wombat
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was very clean, breakfast had a good selection of food and loved the complimentary tea/coffee and pastries at 5-7. Really good location, very close to the metro which is a really great and cheap way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: GUERRA2011
Reviews.Content: We spent a short stay in Barcelona, but could have a great experience of Villa Emilia: . The bar: Friendly ambience, good choice of drinks, moderate prices . The Restaurant: Short menu with great quality of meal. Very nice decoration. Well served, driendly personnel . The room: NO NOISE AT ALL. Very comfortable bed and bathroom. Small details considered . Breakfast: Very Complete and good In General, nice atmosphere, very gentle service, good premises. All that make the customer to feel better than at home for a very reasonable price We'll come again, for sure

Reviews.Title: “Loved that roof top bar !”
Reviews.Author: Barcel0na_fan
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I stayed here on a three night break I'd booked for her birthday as she had never been to Barcelona before. Whilst the hotel initially had trouble finding our booking as my aunt's name mysteriously became the lead name, we were checked in and given a room on the corner of the hotel three floors up. This was perfect as we didn't get disturbed by the roof top bar or the ground floor bar, so we were able to sleep well in our comfy beds each night. The roof top bar in particular was a great place to sit and relax with a long drink just because it was an open air space and had that holiday atmosphere despite being surrounded by buildings. The hotel was clean, tidy and had a relaxed, but business like atmosphere, the staff were polite and helpful when asked and the breakfast was well worth taking time for before a busy day. Whilst it is a little far to walk into the centre of the city each day it was a pleasant amble which you could skip and catch the metro if in a hurry. All in all, this is a very stylish hotel which I enjoyed staying in and would definately go back to stay there again if visiting in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the reviews on Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: jmdubs
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern hotel. It is in a residential neighborhood about a 15 min walk from the gothic area though we preferred that since it was quiet and we enjoy walking. Conversely, you could take the metro which is less than a block away- the metro is clean and easy to use- reminded me of the DC metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LJWNYC2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at Emilia. We loved it - it was clean, in a great location, very comfortable (great bed), quiet and the service was great. Rooms are modern and cute - very simple, yet cozy. Breakfast every day was terrific - a nice range of Spanish and other options - and there was a lovely roof bar, too. All in all, we loved it and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a lot to offer”
Reviews.Author: jason_c_c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days in early July. Great spot in an urban neighborhood, with a nice grocery just down the street and a Metro stop a block away. Modern hotel with attentive staff. Room was very nice and large, with a complimentary bottle of wine waiting when we arrived. Bathroom was a nice size, too. Rooftop bar is a really great setting at night, if you're not in a hurry (even by more relaxed European standards, which is usually fine). Even some locals visiting the bar seemed annoyed at the pace of service, with one couple waiting close to an hour for their drinks. Free WiFi works well, although the password they issued didn't work the first time; easily corrected at front desk. Give this place a try if you don't mind being a few metro stops, or a 20-30 minute walk, from the touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a residential area”
Reviews.Author: gatordiner
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel 2 minutes walk to Rocafort Metro stop. Room is modern, small but as we didn't stay in it too much, not a big deal. Given a room with a skylight rather than windows. Stylish. Nice rooftop lounge, relaxin but not really a view of anything. Five minute walk to Plaza de Espana. If you are a tourist that wants to be where 'more action' is located, than I would not rec. this hotel. If you dont mind walking and/or metro/taxi to gothic area, beach and want a residential area that is quiet at night...this is your place. Staff is very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Our Family of 4”
Reviews.Author: tripmomPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with 2 daughters (ages 15 and 12) for 2 nights prior to embarking on a 10 day cruise. We had a great adjoining room set-up (really two seperate rooms that could be closed off from the rest of the hallway. The hotel is very conveniently located to the Metro, which we all found very easy to use and seemed much safer/cleaner than many in the U.S. I loved the breakfast, but unless you are going to take advantage of anything it has to offer, it's a bit pricey and not really good for kids. We all enjoyed the rooftop terrace. I recommend the mojito and there were non-alcoholic specialty drinks that my kids enjoyed too. The front desk staff is very helpful and attentive. They tolerated my attempts to converse with them in Spanish, most of them spoke English fluently.

Reviews.Title: “The best night sleep we've had in a hotel, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetoeat86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Villa Emilia for 7 nights after booking through booking.com. We got a cheaper rate because we paid upfront when we booked (no cancellations/no exchanges). I had requested a quiet room and was not disappointed when I checked in. Room #61 is positioned on the top floor facing the interior, and they were serious when they said it was the most quiet room. The room is not huge, but it's a fair size... really it was everything we could have asked for given the price we paid and the request for a quiet room we made. (that being said, rooms on the 1st floor I would imagine to be incredibly noisy as their doors are facing the "business centre" where people are often sitting and there is music from the lobby that could be heard (e.g. a live piano at times). Despite what some people may thing, the location of Villa Emilia is actually very good. I rather be located there than in the busy streets of Las Ramblas. The reason is that many of the Barcelona tourist sites are all over the place, so you will have to travel out at one point. Also I didn't want to be in a tourist hot zone because then I'd just be close to tourist traps... I wanted good local food... and although the immediate surroundings of Villa Emilia don't provide that, if you walk North to Hospital Clinic there are many restaurants that are delicious and at a reasonable price. Breakfast is not included, we just went out down the street to Cafe Garbi (on Les Corts), which was reasonably priced, delicious but the service was just ok. The only negative thing i can say about the hotel is that they use very strong scents in the lobby and the hallways, which I might have been allergic too (itchy eyes). If they didn't have that, I would say that everything was perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Used as our home base to explore.”
Reviews.Author: lovingtheUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2nights before our cruise and were happy with the rooms, they were quiet, nice views from 57 and 47. The rooftop bar, and acess to the subway were also good. We would come back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barweb11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Emilia for 4 nights. Arriving late the first night the computer systems were down. Still we were checked into our room within minutes, but the manager wasn't satisfied with the speed and soon came to the room with a lovely bottle of wine as an apology. That's emblematic of the service. We ate dinner in the hotel's restaurant, the Zinc Bar the first night since it was so late, and the food was delicious. Breakfasts, which came with our room, were wonderful and even included a variety of brewed loose teas--something you rarely get anywhere. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the bed linens delicious. The desk staff were always helpful and pleasant full of suggestions and helpful information. While not in the tourist area--it was only a 15 minute walk or two metro stops to the center of town and it was great to leave all the craziness behind and stay in a real neighborhood. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with lots of perks.”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousColorado2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two days before we left on a cruise. It is smaller and has many nice features to it for a reasonable price. The location is a bit off the main tourist area of La Rambla, but we actually found this to be a positive. It was quieter and you have access to the public transportation, which is easy to use in Barcelona as a whole. Our room overlooked an intersection at the front of the hotel, so we were concerned about noise, but they have installed great windows which kept traffic noise to a minimum. The rooms are pretty roomy, upscale bathrooms and have free wi-fi. Our only complaint about the room was the lack of an iron, but one was brought to us promptly when asked. Note: if you need to iron something late in the day, make sure to get your iron before housekeeping goes home! Breakfast is included and is quite extensive (meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, sandwiches, fruit, juices) and delicious. However, our favorite part of the hotel was the roof top bar/lounge area. The weather was perfect when we were here allowing us to sit outside with a gorgeous view of the city and enjoy a glass of wine. Bar prices were reasonable as well and we didn't feel like we were gouged! Staff was always helpful, knew a lot of English and the lobby was always bustling with activity. We would definitely recommend this hotel to any one traveling to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back with no hesitation!!”
Reviews.Author: Alessia_BXL
Reviews.Content: Hotel really peaceful. Clean room, impeccable service and friendly reception and in our language ! It was our 10th wedding anniversary and thanks to Villa Emilia it was perfect. I'll certainly be back !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly comfortable boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Realcoolchris
Reviews.Content: A four day stay at the end of June 2011 in this small boutique hotel was very enjoyable. Located away from the centre of town (3 stops on the Metro) with the nearest station just 60 seconds away, it was easy to get anywhere within Barcelona central or an easy walk to Pl. Espanya and Montjuic. The first night we enjoyed a festive meal on the 7th floor terrace in honour of St Joan: simple dishes made from good materials, lots of wine & Cava, fireworks all around and a DJ playing 60s & 70 music. The room was reasonably sized , well decorated and clean as was the bathroom which has a wet-room type shower. Air-conditioning was effective and silent. The beds were firm, there was a room safe & a minibar (at reasonable prices). The view from this inside room wasn't great but then we don't go to hotels to look out of the windows. The plus side was that there was no noise to be heard - we slept very soundly. Breakfast was a good array of pastries, toast, cereals, juices etc and plenty of coffee or tea but a little pricey at €14 each. All the staff were friendly & helpful from the moment we arrived through to keeping our bags in their store for 6 hours after we checked out. Bar staff are very good. A small criticism is that the lifts are small & not very fast and the staff tended to commandeer them, even when guests were waiting to use them. Taking evening drinks on the terrace was very pleasant; cocktails @ 10€; beers and wines 5€ : but the best bit was the early evening coffee, served between 17.00 & 19.00hrs. After a hot day walking round Barcelona's many attractions, I love a cool shower & a coffee. Not a Café Solo or a ristretto or other poncey offering but a proper big mug of hot coffee to quench my thirst. Villa Emilia provides free coffee, big mugs & small cakes or pastries; that's really civilised.

Reviews.Title: “Forgrt It”
Reviews.Author: jmurrayolympic
Reviews.Content: One night stay. Understaffed-only one person on the desk.. Room safe did not work. Terrible elevators-extremely slow & cramped.Breakfast meager with very poor coffee & juice. Bed very uncomfortable. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great service close to the best spots”
Reviews.Author: SandiandGlenn
Reviews.Content: we were recommended the hotel by a friend and after flying for 22 hours we arrived at 10am. the staff did their best to get the room ready for us and at 11.15 we were able to have shower and freshen up. Staff are friendly and the front desk staff were helpful with the tour buses and explaining our location and the best places to visit and enjoy all that is Barcelona. They have the best bar on the rooftop and although service during the day is a little slow the service at night was amazing. A great spot with brekkie included and a supermarket only 20 metres away meant we could stock up on wine, water and cheese and all the important parts of a holiday. There is also a coffee and cake service in the afternoon which was included with our room and the ever important wifi. A great place to stay if you want to be out of the hustle and bustle of Barcelona but still experience how the locals live.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon0402
Reviews.Content: Set in the centre of the City, the welcome that greets you as you walk inside is 1st class. We were immediately given a City map, Metro map, guidebook to Barcelona and a voucher for a free drink in the hotel. The room was very impressive, spotlessly clean, flat screen tv with very tasteful decor and full air con. There was free tea, coffee and snacks between 1700-1900 hours each day on the 1st floor where there was also free and fast broadband internet for use. The open top 7th floor terrace was spectacular with plush comfy chairs, cushions, large burning candles and very obliging staff. The views were for miles. The planes queueing to land at Barca airport could be seen in the distance over the Med. The staff at the hotel were fantastic, happily booking shows and taxis for us as well as giving guidance whenever asked. A thoroughly unforgettable holiday where the staff couldn´t do enough for you. The metro stop is only 100 yards away and is as easy to use as Londonś underground.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely. Wish we'd stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: RoamingReader
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in June but would certainly return. I booked on DHR.com, which I had never used before, and all went smoothly. Our rate included the breakfast, which is otherwise 14 Euros/pp separately. Breakfast was quite good (meat, cheese, yogurt, breads, eggs, coffee, juice), but I'm not sure I would have paid 28 Euros/ couple for it. Our room was on the second floor, overlooking the street, and I am a very light sleeper-- yet the street noise was so minimal it didn't disturb us at all. I think the windows are quite sound. The room was clean and the bathroom was very nice. Free internet on computers in the business center let us check on our flight. Staff were helpful and attentive, including the bartender at the hotel bar when we were the only patrons there at midnight-ish on a Tuesday. They held our luggage for a few hours the day of our departure. We would return, and would book on DHR again, too. Less than 2 blocks' walk to the Rocafort metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for minibreak”
Reviews.Author: DJL14
Reviews.Content: Quite expensive, but overall worth it, great room and location, v helpful and friendly desk and terrace staff, pity cant say the same about breakfast. At this price I dont expect to be ordered around by a martinet and told where to sit..... but I would definitely go back - just avoid the breakfast......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToastAloha
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is a beautiful small boutique hotel that is located in a quieter area of Barcelona. It's within a 1 minute walk to the metro (Rockafort) and surrounding stores and cafes to eat. The hotel has a wonderful ambiance and tone to it. The decor is current and chic and it has a woodsy rich pleasant scent to it (candles? aroma spray?) whatever it is it smells really good. There is a roof top bar with very comfortable furnishings and a nice view (7th floor). It's a good place to have a drink and find some calm after a day of touring. Our room was roomy with very comfortable beds for sleeping. Everything is spotlessly clean and well taken care of. There's a flat screen tv with a couple of channels in English and big towels provided for in the bath. Ask for Internet connection at reception and you're provided with a connection site and password for the duration of your stay (only having to log in once) and it's free. There is a facility on one of the floors for use of a computer if you don't have your own. Breakfast is a bit pricey but well stocked in exchange. Coffee, juices, cereal, assorted pastry/breads, egg, cheese, delicious jams/preserves, and the like. It's certainly enough until the next meal of the day and very convenient. I would definitely stay here again. Simple elegance tastefully done and and definitely the value for the rate (which I feel is very reasonable). Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: bazik_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in November 2010. It was my first time in Barcelona. To my mind the hotel is perfect for first visiting! The hotel is really nice, clean and modern. The location is good. We walked to the city center. We didn't get breakfast at the hotel. There are lots of caffes near by.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jaclyn719
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and met our budget nicely. We had to walk, cab or metro to most hot spots but that is what we were looking for. The room was very nice and clean. The hotel lobby and roof deck bars were very cool. When we got back to the hotel each night we planned to go to the room but ended up having a drink there before going to the room each evening. The roof deck is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: Eliazabeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple on a short break, the hotel was modern, clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The terrace bar was a really nice feature especially at the end of a busy day/evening! We couldn't believe how quiet it was even though there was traffic outside our window we didn't hear anything - fab double glazing!! It's in a good position with Rocafort metro at the end of the road but is also within walking distance of Place de Catalunya where you can pick up an hop on - hop off tourist bus, get a 2 day ticket which is great value and will take you to all the major sights. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel, great value and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel for the price! Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: sekamina
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all of the great modern style at an affordable price. The location was very central and perfect for doing a lot of walking (and we did A LOT of walking). -15 minute walk to Las Ramblas; 25 minute walk to Monjuic Park; 25 minute walk to Sagrada Familia. The hotel was very chic and modern and a great rooftop terrace (although it was raining when we were there so we couldn't take advantage of it. Another great plus -They had plenty of umbrellas and hats in the lobby to borrow for the rain. That helped out a lot. Great service too! I left my purse in the lobby bar one afternoon (one too many drinks will do that to you.) Needless to say, the purse contained all of my money, credit cards and passport. I didn't realize the mistake until about 30 minutes later and by that point, we got a call to our room from the hotel lobby letting us know I had left it down there and they were bringing it up. Nothing was missing. That could have been a major disaster. We stayed here for two nights of our 4 night stay in Barcelona. The other 2 nights were at a different hotel in the area. A day after we had checked out, I realized I had left behind a travel pillow in the room (it looked like a regular pillow in a white pillow case..easy mistake). I called them the next day and asked if they had found anything. The clerk at the hotel said he would look and call us at our other hotel. Later that day, I had a note from Villa Emilia saying they had my pillow. That was a huge help since I had a 12 hour flight home the next day. All in all, this place was amazing and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous comfort and so convenient to the sights of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SabbaticalProf
Reviews.Content: The Villa Emilia is one of those havens in the midst of the social paradise that is Barcelona. We had a sixth floor room with excellent black out curtains, great AC, and cosy beds (yes, beds; twins pushed together in our double room). I can honestly say that we have never slept better anywhere. Having had bad experiences with noise and crime previously on La Rambla, we were looking for a hotel out of the main tourist area but still convenient to all the sights and the shopping areas of the old town and of the new and vital center. The Rocafort subway station is steps away from the hotel and, at only Euro 1,45 per trip, the extensive metro system is a great way to get around fast. Loved this hotel, recommend it, and will return! In our car, as they provide a voucher for reduced price parking in a nearby garage.

Reviews.Title: “Right place to stay, good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Maplehawk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean & modern. Location is close to a metro, which is all you really need. Helpful staff & very accommodating. Would definitely stay there again. Asked for two beds, which were pushed together which made it a king-sized bed. Bathroom was fabulous, with a stand-up shower, great toiletries, nice big towels. Room #was 49 which was very quiet, but no view. Breakfast was great, though you don't need to include it as there are lots of cafe's around. Service was very good, the staff very helpful with whatever you needed we ate one night in the resturaunt downstairs and it was great (although the house red was marginal). We also went to the rooftop patio,which is great for an after sightseeing cava. No view from there, but very nicely furnished & serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, staff, and service.”
Reviews.Author: Viajar88
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because it was modern and somewhat removed from the busier locations. I had a pleasant 5 night stay at this establishment. The staff was friendly and provided timely service with all requests. The room was comfortable with modern decor, a very firm bed and adequate space. Enjoyed the stylish and comfortable roof top terrance with nice views as well as the daily complimentary coffee break with pasteries from 5-7 PM . I would gladly return to Villa Emilia for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “definitely would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: musti_SF
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel the moment we walked in. The music at the lobby was just great. The staff was just perfect. The check-in process was very quick and efficient. Although we arrived early our room was ready. We were given maps, tour information and wifi codes per device. The room was very comfortable. The shower was excellent. Everything was just perfect. It is right on the metro line (Rocafort) so it was convenient. For Aerobus you can either walk to Plaza Espana or take a short metro ride. Great location and just a wonderful place to stay in Barcelona. Since it was pouring rain we decided to eat at the hotel. Zinc bar food was absolutely delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel for our 10th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: amonole
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three lovely nights at Villa Emilia for our 10th anniversary, it was the perfect romantic location. The room was nice, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom nice and big :) The hotel staff speaks English, and provided us with plenty of tourism information when we arrived. They also suggested a great restaurant, Mediterraneo, just down the street. The hotel is located very close to the Rocafort Metro stop, and was so convenient for sightseeing! Breakfast is a little pricey, but worth it. I will absolutely stay here again for my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “causy and classy”
Reviews.Author: fadi
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have chosen this hotel according to its reviews on trip advisor , and we werent disappointed , location is excellent ( next to rockafort tube station ) which is only 2 stops away from ramblas , the breakfast was fantastic ...fresh and innovative , service was good , staff very friendly ... free internet ... .... my only disappointment was that some coins were missing from our room !! i know its just a small amount , and i was going to leave them anyways ....but that would be my choice ...........i filed a complaint to the front desk ...who got really disappointed specially that they outsource the house keeping to another company ............anyhow ...maybe it was my fault..who knows ....but all in all Villa Emilia is an extremely nice , boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: UncyChops
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff very friendly. Location was in a more quiet/residential part of town (but close to the Metro) which suited us fine. Only disappointing part was the terrace. There was no staff up there despite it being advertised as a terrace bar. The only way to get service was via an intercom to the staff downstairs which resulted in our order being mixed up. Apart from that, it was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “I did not want to leave this hotel. The best staff ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: SOYRAFA
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Barcelona and although i am tired the first thing i wanted to do was to write my review for this WONDERFUL hotel. I went to celebrate my birthday and this vacation and HOTEL exceeded my expectations. I have to start with the wonderful staff. The front desk were professional, knowledgeable and very warm. They went above and beyond to suggest places to see and how to get there. Cecile and Olivier were outstanding! Now to the ROCKSTARS of our stay. We first met THAIS when she knocked at our door to deliver my complimentary bottle of wine for my birthday. After asking her to wish me a happy birthday (which she did). She treated us like family when we saw her downstairs at the restaurant bar. She always made sure that we were being attended to and also suggested what to eat from the menu (the secreto was awesome). She had a great knowledge about where to go for a great night with the locals. We ended up going to club Mojito on a saturday and i can truly say i was hanging with the locals. She was PHENOMENAL!! That leads me to Vicente (Alexander as i called him) who tends the bar. He always looked happy to be there and was soooo friendly and very sweet. Although he is fairly new. He worked hard and it was just a pleasure to talk to him while we drank our wine at the bar. Sandro was our waiter at the restaurant which we ate twice in. He always had a smile on his face and made sure our "copas" were filled. I can go on and on. I told Maria who is the manager that she had a PHENOMENAL team. Our night always started at the roof top. This is where me met AMAURY who i kid you not will always greet you with a smile. I do not know what is it about this place but all of their employees looked happy to be there. He has such a great personality. The last but certainly not the least of the ROCKSTARS IS THE ONE AND ONLY MARIO!!! We met him the first night on the roof top and he served us our first drinks and there was no looking back after that. He is a charming, full of energy and just the sweetest guy we met there. We were always looking for him because he was so much charisma and made us feel like just we had known him for years. MARIO WAS OUR GO TO MAN FOR EVERYTHING. I cannot say enough about this young man. When you stay here make sure you talk to these individuals. I truly believe your stay will be outstanding. The hotel is cozy and very clean. The location is great. We were away from the craziness but close enough to everything. I originally wanted to stay near the Ramblas, but after seeing the location i am soo happy we did not. This hotel has been the best experience i have had in a long time. I really hope you stay here. Let them know the chicos from room 60 sent you..:)

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay at Villa Emilia again next time we are in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: sbrucar
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and comfortable room, immaculately clean and spacious. Villa Emilia staff were all friendly and helpful; Cecil who we talked with most often was a sweetheart, always smiling and always helpful whether it was figuring out internet service or calling for a taxi to the airport. As advised thru Trip Advisor, we asked for a room ending in 2 or 8 - the corner/larger rooms. We were given room 58 which is the one shown on the hotel web site, and it was perfect. It was also sound-proof; there was some noise outside, but once our door was closed, total silence! Breakfast was very high quality, lots of meats, cheese and fruit, variety of bread, and of course cappucino. There is also a rooftop/terrasa bar which was delightful for evening relaxation. This was a wonderful location, somewhat away from all the busy-ness of Las Ramblas, but within walking distance - and public transportation to anywhere was very easy to figure out. Yes we loved Villa Emilia and will stay there next time in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Dennis040
Reviews.Content: Very near rocafort station. Very spacious room. Good service. Room service is also good. Best hotel among all that I have stayed in my Europe holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Villa Emilia”
Reviews.Author: Twinkle26
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly located about 30 seconds from the main red line subway (Rocafort)which links to all main tourist destinations within Barcelona. This was perfect for us as we travelled Ryanair from Girona and arrived at Barcelona bus station, a 5 min walk to Arc de Triomf subway and literally 10 mins later we were at our hotel. Hotel staff are extremely friendly and provided excellent help and advice on places to visit throughout the city. Rooms were modern, comfortable, quiet and had the quietest a/conditioning system ever, so much so we weren't sure it was even on! We didn't have breakfast here but did visit a small, friendly coffee shop opposite the hotel each morning which was very reasonably priced. The roof terrace and bar were however visited and both are relaxing places to unwind after a day of sightseeing, drinks are reasonably priced (4 euros for a beer/glass of cava) If you're looking for a modern, well located hotel to explore Barcelona, visit Villa Emilia and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “They care, it shows, and it made my stay different.”
Reviews.Author: Redelefto_45
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and spend many nights a year in hotels. I spent this week-end in May at Villa Emilia, in the middle of a business trip, simply because I had not time to fly back home for the week-end. Nice, relax but elegant ambiance. As soon as you enter the Villa Emilia you can tell that this property is different. Plenty of little detail that make a difference. No “pre-formatted” chain style. No minimalist so called “designer” style. No “Return on investment” written everywhere you look. Just a good taste (well, at least for me!), good ambiance, from the small restaurant up to the roof terrace – for a good price. And then I realized that this property belong to individuals that invested their heart and soul in this hotel, and wholeheartedly want to make sure you, their guest, enjoys the stay. They care, it shows, and it made my stay different. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel Exceptional Staff Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: outdoor21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights whilst touring Spain and it was by far the best hotel we stayed in. The staff were friendly and professional. We arrived earlier than anticipated, the staff went out of their way to accommodate us. The hotel rooms were neat, clean and had modern bathroom facilities. The hotel had an excellent internet that was free and several English television channels. The rooftop bar has a delightful atmosphere, with a nice view over the local streets. The downstairs bar is wonderful with brilliant bar staff, who make brilliant cocktails and are proud of it too! We loved the free breakfast every morning and found overall this hotel to be the best value of our trip. The subway station is right across the road and its only 3 stops into the centre of town. The hotel is located in a quiet area which really gives you a lovely feel for the real Barcelona. I would recommend this hotel and urge people to stay here it is delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiaG
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short one night stay at Villa Emilia on a business trip. My room was on 4th floor of the hotel at the corner of the building with a good view down onto the crossroads below. The room was lovely, relaxing and modern. Good lighting options added to the ambience. There was a flat screen Samsung tv and a small work desk, double bed, two bedside cabinets, one armchair and double wardrobes. The bathroom was minimalist with no bath just large walk in shower. Very clean black and mirrors decor. A hairdryer, tissues and toiletries were provided. The hotel has a great rooftop terrace which could be a great space to socialise and chill with friends although on the one evening I stayed it was a little cold and windy to sit outside. The staff at the hotel were mainly very attentive. On the first day at check in the receptionist appeared to be the only person on duty. He was doing room service, bar and reception. He was very helpful and keen to please. Even printing off my boarding pass for me as I had no access to a printer. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel although my colleague did and she said there was plenty of choice and fresh fruit, meats and breads. All in all I thought the Villa Emilia a very pleasant hotel deserving of it's good reputation in a city where there are so many hotels, good and bad, from which to choose. I would go back and happily recommend this hotel to my best friend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful City, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cle0patra99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night/5 day stay at the Emilia. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. My fiancee and I have been wanting to visit Barcelona for some time, and flew with BA from Heathrow. Before booking the Villa Emilia, we spent hours on the internet trying to find "the perfect hotel" - somewhere stylish, clean, friendly, good location, reasonably priced, etc, etc.. We had several hotels earmarked, but the Villa Emilia was the cheapest and we are so very pleased we picked it. It's got a certain special vibe that i cant quite explain. We just felt so at home there. The Metro is just a hundred yards or so stroll from the hotel. The hotel is extremely clean, stylish (it appears recently refurbished), very spacious rooms, beautiful "wet room" bathrooms, excellent breakfast, friendly staff who are so helpful at helping visitors with days out and how to get there, etc. There is a lovely roof terrace where you can drink and eat, and is a real suntrap in the afternoon.... it is a beautiful and peaceful place to relax after a day's sight seeing and shopping. We did most of our travelling by foot and Metro - the Metro is so simple to use - just like the Tube, but much, much cheaper. We bought a T10 ticket which gives you 10 journeys throughout several days and can be used by multiple people. An absolute bargain for 7.85 euros. We got a taxi from El Prat airport which set us back about 25 euros - it was by far the quickest and easiest way to get to the hotel, plus we got to see a little bit extra of the beautiful city that we wouldnt have otherwise seen. The taxi drivers "dont spare the horses" so prepare for a high-speed journey! Great fun though. We were advised to write down the address of our hotel so that the taxi driver would know where to drop us off. We always try to converse in the local language whenever we travel. In our handbook it said that Catalan is the preferred language (which is a variation of spannish), but when we tried to ask for things in Catalan, no-one seemed to understand, so we reverted back to Spannish. But everyone speaks English so there is no problem whatsoever with a language barrier. There is so much to do in this city, Barceloneta, Port Vell, Las Ramblas, Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia, and the Gothic Quarter were some of our favourites - shopping is excellent. The Zara and Mango stores (i thought) were quite a bit cheaper than the UK branches. If time allows, try out La Boqueria market just off of Las Ramblas... fresh meat, fish, fruit, etc in abundance. Despite warnings of pick pockets, etc, we both felt extremely safe wandering around at night in the tourist areas. The Placa Del Reil is a great place to visit for restaurants at night time. It is located in the Gothic Quarter. Me and my fiancee can't wait to return to Barcelona very soon, and next time we go there we wont be spending hours trawling the internet for the "perfect hotel"...we've already found it in the Villa Emilia.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: helena928
Reviews.Content: Since I rely on Trip Advisor so much, I thought it was only fair to give back and to write about our fabulous stay at the Villa Emilia. My fiance and I (29 and 30 years old) stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and with each passing night, this place felt more and more like home. The hotel is modern, chic and beautifully decorated. The staff, especially the bartenders at the Zinc bar, could not be friendlier. Every night after HOURS of walking around in Barcelona, we always ended up at the bar for a glass of wine. It was perfect! We never had breafkast at the hotel, but ate dinner there one night and the food was pretty good! We had the prefix which included an appetizer, entree, dessert and a glass of wine for 25e a person, which i thought was a pretty great deal. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crockett55
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Villa Emilia. It is very modern and well located for accessing transport to main attractions in Barcelona.The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Our only issue was the bar seemed to be a bit understaffed during our stay. You could wait a rather long time for service but we soon realised that sitting at the bar and ordering your own worked well. The free coffee and cakes every afternoon were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel with good price.”
Reviews.Author: HUNG5728
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona this March for a medical meeting. And I spent four nights at the Villa Emilia. The colleagues of front desk are kind and freindly. The room is charming and well-designed. Shower room and toliet are great. The traffic is very convinnet, you can find the subway station about 250mm away. A great place to stay I think..

Reviews.Title: “Villa Emilia - the place to be. End of.”
Reviews.Author: Coco2005
Reviews.Content: Picked Villa Emilia after reading reviews here and the hotel delivered on every level, from arrival and check in to rooms, which were immaculate and the breakfast, which was great. I won't go into listing all the same things all these recent reviews seem to list, as I think they've covered it well. But I want to say that it's a great hotel, perfectly out of the hustle and bustle of the very centre but close enough to walk to centre or take metro, which is literally 200m away. I felt relaxed and comfortable there throughout - and I am picky. The only little thing was the problem with the wifi they seemed to have just this week and I would have needed access for my laptop to do some stuff for work. However, the receptionist showed me a Workcenter (public wifi work and internet place) on the map, which I found so managed to complete what I needed to. Next time I will be visiting Barcelona, I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with very few faults”
Reviews.Author: radiodog52
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because I was searching for a centrally located hotel that was smoke-free (in europe!) and a boutique hotel. I didn't want the large chain hotel. The staff spoke good English and were more than helpful. I am pretty picky when it comes to hotels. Check-in/out was a breeze. The staff helped us with our map as we descended upon the city each day. Food was very good at the hotel's restaurant. If I had to have one gripe ... it was with the central air conditioning system. Although there is an in-room temperature control, there was no control of the temperature. Apparently, the air conditioning doesn't kick in until April throughout the whole building. We were there March 22 - 25, 2011 and the outside temperatures were around 20 Celcius throughout the day. Needless to say, air conditioning would have been a great thing to have at night. All in all, a great holiday and a hotel that I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the Eixample with fabulous front desk”
Reviews.Author: mcgee_w
Reviews.Content: We came to Barcelona on a tail end of a whirlwind trip of Spain. We had lost a lot of steam on the "sightseeing" front but had plenty of energy left to explore the food of Barcelona. One of our party had a severe food allergy and Jordi at the front desk was phenomenal making us hotel reservations and explaining the allergies to all the restaurants. We had a bottle of wine waiting for us in our room - just popped down to the Zinc Bar to have it opened, and the bartender gave us some nice glasses to use up in our room. The bar was a great place to have pre-dinner drinks. The bathroom was chic and comfortable, and our room was quiet - we were able to keep our window open all night. The Eixample is a beautiful part of town and we were able to walk up to most of our restaurant choices with little problems. The metro is one block away and took us no time to get to some of the sights like Sagrada Familia, Museu Picasso, etc. There is a little deli between the hotel and the metro that makes great sandwiches - we spent 3 euro per sandwich to take with us on the plane.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on earth!”
Reviews.Author: Akviuke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a suprise! Reading loads of reviews on Tripadvisor sometimes can leave you puzzled of what to expect.
