I stayed there in January with my other half for my birthday and we couldnt stop wowing all the time! Food was divine, the room was very high standard, the services just above expectations. The roof terrace was such a lovely bonus even to enjoy some winter sun! Location is great as well as can easily walk to the main streets or just get metro as the stop is just round the corner! Really hope will be able to stay again as it was so easy to fall in love with Barcelona and Villa Emilia!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in Barcelona imo”
Reviews.Author: Awkward_Veggie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor comments - it was 5th out of 556 Barca hotels. We loved it! Discreet, friendly staff who spoke English; tasteful decor, very modern & cool. Free wi-fi. The only 'but' was the beds were hard. We like to have a bath, but the shower was very welcome after a hard day's trekking, and the toiletries are superb quality. We had a 5th floor room which I found quiet (spouse complained of shouty American females late at night, but I had earplugs in). We had a flatscreen TV, but didn't really use it. The mini bar was used late at night when I couldn't be bothered to walk to the supermarket (3 streets away). We paid £5 for water instead of 50p though. The supermarket was very useful for bread, cheese & wine suppers - we were too tired to eat out, although we did eat out at Garvi tapas bar a few nights (26 euros for two, with alcohol). The hotel is a few mins walk from Rocafort metro station. We bought a 2 day metro pass for about 11 euros and it was well used: very good value. We travelled on the Renfe train from the airport (about 3 euros each). Our favourite part of the hotel was the breakfast: very classy dining room, very quiet & polite guests, an imitation fire, lots of magazines to browse. We ate lots of patisserie, bread, cold meats, fruit & cheese with lashings of delicious coffee. The hotel was quiet (March, out of season) but the staff were very helpful, friendly but in the background. There is a fabulous roof terrace decorated with palms, banana & bird of paradise, but we were too crackered to go up there for a nightcap. There's also a piano player, but we were asleep by then It's also pet friendly, which is unusual

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique style hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CJS27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in mid-March and could not fault this hotel. It is a small hotel but stylish and very comfortable. The zinc bar and restaurant area is very enjoyable, especially on the nights when their piano player is there. Staff made you feel very welcome and were always quick to help with any question or problem. Free coffee and tea on the mezzanine is served daily and the service in both the bar and restaurant was excellent. Just a few minutes walk from the Rocafort metro station and easy to walk to other major parts of the city. Rooms are well appointed and comfortable and we hope to stay there again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: dgelbard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed at this hotel for one night but our experience was bad in almost every way. When we were checking in there was a girl in the hotel lobby screaming and hysterically crying, clearly having some kind of a panic attack. She was creating quite a disturbance and since there was a queue at the reception desk we had no choice just to awkwardly stand next to her and look at our shoes. The concierge did nothing to calm her down or to reassure us, he just rolled his eyes as wait staff brought her a cup of tea and tried to find out what the problem was. She got up and went running out of the hotel sobbing and screaming but then ten minutes later she was back, inexplicably sitting in the lobby again, moaning and hyperventilating. My husband and I looked at eachother and wondered why no one was doing anything about this. We then asked the concierge where a certain restaurant was---its a very popular one rated in the top 5 on Trip Advisor. We forgot to bring the address and needed help. Well the concierge said he never heard of it and changed the subject. He could have offered to google it for us or to look it up or to ask another employee but he didn't because it didn't matter to him. So we looked it up ourselves and mapped out a route and got lost a few times on the way, all the while wondering why the concierge didn't just help us in the first place. When we returned we asked him where we should park our car. He vaguely gestured at the road outside and said there was a car park there that had an agreement with the hotel. We asked him the name of it and he didn't know. When we came back after parking our car we showed him the ticket from the car park and said 'Is this the one you were talking about? Did we park in the right car park?' and he didn't know. We were given a room above the bar where the loud piano music and talking could easily be heard, and the wailing of the hysterical girl in the lobby was perfectly audible as well. The room itself was unremarkable in every way. It could have been an airport Marriott or any other average hotel. The toiletries were cheap and minimal, the bed was uncomfortable, and the whole experience was so disappointing. The only nice thing I have to say about this hotel is that the bath towels are big and fluffy. As we were checking out the next day another couple were checking in and we heard a different concierge inform them that there was a free happy hour in the hotel with drinks and food provided between 5pm and 7pm. The guy who checked us in never mentioned this to us so we missed it. It was the final straw and made it even harder to part with the €160 we had to pay for one night in this below-average hotel. We will not be recommending this hotel to anyone and we regret staying there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller504106
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Emilia with a couple of friends for 3 nights in early March 2011. The hotel was probably the nicest one we have stayed in. Lovely throughout from the bedrooms to the Zinc bar and especially the roof terrace which I should imagine would be even better on a warm evening. Loads of food choice at breakfast. The staff were courteous and very friendly and helpful (especially Pablo on the bar, the gentleman on Reception when we arrived/left and the young waitress who was working on our last evening/finalmorning. We would definitely recommend this as a place to stay in Barcelona. The hotel is located close to the metro and is a couple of stops from Las Ramblas. We will definitely be booking to go again. Thank you to all at Villa Emilia for making our trip so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Shantap
Reviews.Content: I also stayed in ABaC, a five star hotel at the north end of the city, so I am partly comparing Emilia to that experience. Emilia is bustling, and has a very friendly and active cafe/bar scene on the first floor which is nice for a solo traveler like me. Live piano on several evenings each week. Good drinks and food. Good socializing location. The room was smaller than the ABaC, but that was to be expected. Very clean. Comfortable bed. No bath, but good shower with adjustable head. Plenty of storage space. Small, but functional flat screen TV. The key is the location. NOT in the busy Rambla area, this is just three short stops from the Rambla area on the FREQUENT subway. It is in more of a neighborhood of Barcelona rather than in the tourist area. So the cafe and restaurants nearby are more local fare, and not "just" for tourists -- which I found very nice. It was still a little cool in March, so the patio on the rooftop was never very busy. But I used it a lot. Very comfortable seating, nice neighborhood views, clean and enjoyable. I expect that in April and May and summer, it is more heavily used, and again a good place to meet other travelers and socialize. I am a rock climber and found a nearby rock gym, which was nice. And several outdoor adventure gear stores within two blocks in various directions. The area seemed very safe at night, and although Barcelona has a reputation for pick pockets, if you are careful about your money and valuables, you should have no problems. The staff was friendly, helping make a dinner reservation, find my way, get a cab, and recommend night clubs. I was able to check in early, which was very helpful. Overall, I would strongly recommend this option UNLESS you really want to be in a big luxury hotel, or you really want to be in the city center. Remember, Emilia is close enough to the city center that I often walked in, which took about 15 or 20 minutes. No pool. No fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: davidwaller13
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel we have stayed where the rooms are exactly as shown on the web site! Excellent quality and very friendly staff. The rooms are large, exceptionally clean and well designed. Very large buffet breakfast and free tea and cakes from 5 to 7 every evening in the first floor lounge. Also free tapas and a bottle of wine were provided. We had dinner in the restaurant on the final night and it was our best meal in Barcelona - easily beat the more expensive restaurants in the city centre. Close to the metro and 10 minutes from The Rambla. An excellent city hotel, far better than could be expected from the price carged. Can't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bristolian2011
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3-night stay here and felt the need to sing the hotel's praises. Lovely room with a great walk-in shower. Very quiet, comfortable room with everything we needed. The bottle of wine in the room on arrival was most welcome (shame they don't provide you with a cork screw to open it). The cold breakfast buffet was excellent with plenty of cold meats, cheeses, fresh bread, cereal, coffee, fruit, toast, jams, freshly boiled eggs to your taste and even Cava and wine if you feel so inclined! Breakfast was served until 11 am which is great if you are not an early bird. The free coffee and pastries in the afternoons is a nice touch too, and welcome after a day exploring the city. The roof terace is lovely and is a suntrap. Cannot fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and a great value”
Reviews.Author: jenndoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before heading back home after 2 weeks in Europe. The hotel was beautiful. We got a nice bottle of wine upon check in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very nicely decorated and spacious. Breakfast buffet that was included had a good selection of items. I wish we had stayed another night. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Value!!! Just left and want to return already!”
Reviews.Author: wetravelwell_11
Reviews.Content: I spend close to 75 nights/year in hotels - Villa Emilia is now one of my favorites! Great value, boutique, modern, friendly/helpful staff, very clean. Restraurant and bar great - with great piano player Thurs - Sun while we were there - great way to cap off a wonderful evening of fabulous Catalan food and wine! Rooftop terrace area great as well. Unbelievable place for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathanas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of February. The hotel is wonderful, the boutique style decor was gorgeous and it is spotlessly clean. The reception staff were extremely helpful and were more than happy to help us in recommending the best way to get around the city. We found the location was also perfect, a ten minute walk to the Ramblas and very close the underground which we used to get to the Camp Nou. I would definitely go back and would def recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid, modern hotel, super for romantic weekend for two!”
Reviews.Author: NP-Norway
Reviews.Content: The trip-advisor score for this hotel is absolutely justified. We had a terrific weekend. The hotel is clean and stylish, with a very friendly staff. The breakfast was excellent. You can even have a glass of sparkling wine along with the delicious ham, for free. The Metro station is just 1 minute away. We absolutely recommend Villa Emilia!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Vallettka
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have been very impressed with the level of hospitality that the hotel makes its guests welcome. Awaiting in your room is a bottle of wine which sort of sets you in a celebration mood. This boutique hotel provides in a Gallery above the Lobby of the hotel tea and coffee in the late afternoon which makes a lot of sense since restaurants in Spain open so late for dinner. I can not praise enough young French waiter (Swan?) who elevates the restaurant service to new level! The hotel is a little off centre but only 2 bus stops away from the Placa Catalunya.Altogether the stay in Villa Emilia was memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SALAFI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in November. Great hotel, rooms on the small side but very clean everything you need. Staff friendly and helpful. Lovely relaxing bar, ate in the hotel a few times and food was very good and not too expensive. For us the location was great, few mins walk to the metro. Would book this hotel again for our next trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Potential to be first class”
Reviews.Author: pjwCheshire
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is a small boutique hotel furnished to a modern and very high standard. The location is reasonable. The Rocafort Metro stop just a few yards down the road. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to walk from the Hotel to the famous avenue La Rambler in the Old Town. The dining/bar area on the ground floor has a really great atmosphere and the food served is good - particularly the breakfasts. The residents lounge on the first floor mezzanine has internet access and serves complimentary tea/coffee between 5pm and 7pm. Our double bedroom was a reasonable size and decorated to a modern and very high standard. The en- suite bathroom was excellent with good facilities and exceptional power shower. The bed was very firm and the pillows very small, despite double glazing street noise could still be heard in the background. We found the Reception Staff very average - no warm welcome - never a smile. No doubt efficient but in our experience not prepared to go the extra mile. Hot Tip - The number 1 visitor attraction in Barcelona is the Sagrada Familia. Certainly fantastic but make sure you book your tickets before you travel otherwise be prepared to queue for hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: jamonita
Reviews.Content: After touring through other parts of Spain for two weeks on our honeymoon, we settled in Barcelona to ring in the new year and also celebrate my birthday. Since this was a special occasion, we chose to splurge a little. From the moment we walked through the door to the moment we left we were happy with our choice. We chose to have the special dinner at the hotel restaurant for New Year's Eve and we were blown away by the service and the food. We had a great time and really enjoyed ourselves. The neighborhood is fantastic, especially if you're like us and try to avoid lodging in busy spots such as la rambla. The Metro was very close and convenient. The room was elegant and modern - very clean and very comfortable. Free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and a very friendly and helpful staff. We also enjoyed hanging back in the Zinc Bar with a glass of cava listening to live piano music. Villa Emilia exceeded our expectations and I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...needs a few tweaks”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller75_76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after Christmas for 4 nights. I would describe it as a boutique hotel. I would recommend this hotel due to its location (is walkable to main shopping areas and is a 2-min walk to a metro station). The bar is great and the staff are very helpful. Quite a limited food menu at the bar but i guess it is not setting itself out to be a restaurant. Breakfast is fine albeit a little boring after 4 mornings of the same fare. The only main issue we had was the bed. Firstly, the 'pillows' were 2 mini cushions which caused an uncomfortable night's sleep for both my fiancé and I. Also, we had booked a double bed which turned out to be 2 single beds pushed together. This added to the overall uncomfortableness of the sleeping experience with either one of us alternatively falling into the chasm in the middle! On our first morning there, the handle of the door fell off into our hands. We informed reception but it was never fixed and the receptionist did not seem that interested. Also, to repeat what a previous reviewer mentioned, the sliding bathroom door does not close all the way so there is little privacy. It wasn't a bad hotel at all and it's ideal for short stays. For that reason, I would recommend it. But if you are fussy about your sleep quality then I would hesitate to book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: GordonR_11
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. Well designed rooms and public areas. Comfortable bedrooms. Good breakfast and nice bar area. Pleasant and helpful staff. In a nice area close to the centre of the city and v close to the subway which gets you into the heart of the city in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Off The Tourist Path”
Reviews.Author: GoMolly
Reviews.Content: It was a great location in a very walkable city. If you like to stay away from the tourist traffic, but have access to all of the good stuff this is a great location for you ... The Villa Emilia is clean, modern and a top rate boutique hotel. Without reservation I would give this hotel 5-stars!

Reviews.Title: “Central location with excellent sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: aussiewineguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed the nights at Villa Emilia on the return leg of a cruise across the Mediterranean,. Previously, we'd have been to Barcelona twice, so we had already covered off a lot of the standard tourist attractions - the location was perfect for us as the area is quiet, and the room was a good size and very clean, plenty of space to sort through luggage and just relax. There is a metro stop a few short minutes walk which connects to Espanya or Catalunya, so you can very easily get around the city in no small amount of time. The area is very beautiful and safe to walk at night. There are a large number of restaurant options close by as well as in a few blocks' walk. The hotel has a gourmet bar and cafe style restaurant with a very nice selection. On the rooftop is a wonderful terrace bar which we visited briefly one afternoon. Staff were helpful and efficient, and the room was made up each day with no hassles. The whole hotel is smoke-free, so if you like a smoke free clean environment, this one is for you. The only two drawbacks to Barcelona, in my opinion, are smoking and dog poo on the sidewalks. We can't do much about the latter as tourists, but you can certainly vote with your wallet regarding the former and choose non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “My Perfect Moment”
Reviews.Author: DonateLife
Reviews.Content: I escaped to Barcelona for less than 48 hours on my way to a conference in London. Hotel Villa Emilia proved to be exactly the place I hoped it would be. Despite the 24 hours of travel it took to get there, I found myself smiling ear to ear that first night as I sipped the delicious red wine that waited me in my simple, but very modern and stylish room with the balcony door ajar and the wind playing on the drapes. From the moment I walked in the door the place just felt right. It is small, initimate, attractive and welcoming. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast next to a lovely fire place was a good start to the day. It seems some locals come in to enjoy a drink in the evening while listening to the great music they play. Easy access to the Metro makes getting around Barcelona simple. A bank with ATM and a small marekt are just across the street. My only compalints were the bed was too hard for me and despite being November it was stuffy on my fourth floor room. The room was quiet, but with only one chair might feel crowded for 2 who spend lots of time in the room. But why would you in beautiful Barcelona?

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: tahoejones
Reviews.Content: This review is just a tad outdated but I thought I would throw my 2 cents in. We had a great 6 nights at Villa Emilia. Staff is super friendly and will happily guide you to where you need to go. Hotel is on the boutique side of things so rooms are not super big, but comfortable enough for a queen bed and a small desk/tv. Contemporary vibe for sure. Bar is a nice place to have a drink and some snacks and listen to the piano player or whatever musician they have that night. The breakfast is awesome as are the tapas. The only complaint I had is the beds are super-hard. This is not your signature Westin heavenly bed. This may be the norm in Europe though. I don't know. We were so exhausted every evening and didn't notice till we woke up with stiff backs. The other thing I could see as a negative for some (not us b/c we love to walk everywhere) is that it isn't super-close to all the major attractions/restaurants. We got a great deal through expedia though, so it was all worth it!

Reviews.Title: ““Great fun hotel with a cool hip atmosphere!!! Wonderful service too!”
Reviews.Author: lauriepetok
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Hotel Villa Emilia. The staff was fantstastic and the rooms are very very nice and clean. It is a smaller boutique type hotel close to everything. It is walking distance to the Plaza de Espana. The staff is very very friendly and speak english. They are very helpful with whatever you need. The roof top bar is a wonderful hangout with excellent drinks. The locals seem to come there too. The decor of the hotel is mondern and stylish. We would stay there again and recommend it to others!!! Good price too!

Reviews.Title: “Tried so hard to be modern it forgot to be comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: RooNRasMum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for six nights and slept maybe one. The hotel is clean and it is centrally located, but those are the only two good things I can say for it. Here were the problems. 1: The beds were extremely uncomfortable. Though the mattress was fine, the pillows were little square fru-fru things whose sole purpose was to be decorative. They were terribly useless and caused us both to have massive headaches. 2: The rooms were adequately sized, but the bathroom doors were designed very poorly. They did not close all the way- ON PURPOSE! There was no privacy whatsoever. 3: The hotel had very poor noise control. The windows did not block out street noise at all and the walls were very thin. We could hear any and all hall noise. This became an especially big problem during the early mornings when the staff would set up to clean the halls. They would prop the elevators open, causing a Beep Beep Beep noise that would continue uninterrupted for about a half an hour. What a miserable way to be awakened! 4: The staff was incredibly rude. When we asked if there was a fan for the room, as it was both very hot and noisy, both of which could be alleviated by a fan, the staff person said "I don't know what your problem is. It's cold outside. Why are you hot?" The staff's rudeness was not a language issue, either, as I speak Spanish fluently. They simply were unkind and unhelpful. 5: The restaurant was terrible and overpriced. The food was not good, poorly cooked and very expensive. 6: They charged us twice. We prepaid for our stay when we booked. However, the hotel had no record of this. Rather than trying to work with us to resolve the problem, the staff was rude and wasn't willing to work with us. We were more than willing to pay again, with the understanding that we would resolve the issue with our credit card company. The staff simply said "there's nothing to resolve. You haven't paid yet. You must pay." For us, the issue wasn't whether we were willing to pay, rather, we were treated like criminals for a clerical error on their part. Overall, we were very disappointed. We'd recommend taking your business elsewhere. This is my 7th trip to Barcelona. I know what good service is and I can state with certainty that this hotel does not provide it!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great roof terrace, bad pillows and stuffy hot room.”
Reviews.Author: wolfent
Reviews.Content: A nice new clean hotel with good food and service. My room was small and the air-conditioning didn't work. The pillows were really uncomfortable so I didn't sleep well. The service, staff and public areas were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debsen1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 4 nights in November with a friend. The hotel is beautiful. Rooms were spacious which was nice for a 4-night stay. Didn't use the terrace, but it was pretty. There are two computers on the first floor, and it was very nice to use them. They also had free croissants, coffee, tea and water from 5-7PM each nice. Very close to the metro stop Rocafort- one small block. And it was actually nice not to be by the Ramblas and its craziness. I think it's only a 20 minute walk there. But the Barcelona metro is great, so there were no problems getting everywhere quickly. Not a lot of restaurants in the vicinity but they are easily accessible by the metro as mentioned. Piano bar with music Thursday to Sunday, and there are tapas at the bar. We also got a free bottle of wine for booking on the internet. The only slight complaint was that one of the staff members was a little aloof and not as helpful as I would have liked (not great directions to Parque Guell) and seemed a little short to work with us, but maybe that was my perception. But I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice boutique style property - worth a try!!”
Reviews.Author: mont990
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice boutique style propertyand we would definitely recommend it. The rooms were average in size although the design, style and fit out etc do make up for this as it is of a pretty high standard. The staff were friendly and helpful although a little more local knowledge on places to eat nearby would have been good. We never got a chance to use the great roof terrace as it was a little cold in November but the downstairs piano bar is a very pleasant area to chill out in after a busy day exploring the city. The hotel itself is a little out of the hustle and bustle but for us this was no problem at all. All the places you need to see are very accessible both by the Metro which is a block away or accessible on foot within a half hour’s stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Best value/find in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ss4leung
Reviews.Content: Wonderful chic boutique hotel. Price for room was amazing for what its worth. Rooms are spacious and big especially for European standard. Nicely decorated rooms with plush duvet, big pillows and comfy bed. Staff is extremely friendly and informative. We had breakfast there and the pastries, assortment of ham was superb! Lovely lobby and great location...Would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel off the beaten bath”
Reviews.Author: guyute999
Reviews.Content: A little away from the central action, this is a little gem of a hotel. With modern, clean rooms, this hotel makes for a great stay in Barcelona. The neighborhood is residential and pretty quiet, but the Rocafort metro stop is only a short block away. Needless to stay, the metro system in Barcelona is amazing and you can be in the old town in less than 10 minutes. But there are also great food options nearby. We found a great tapas place a few blocks away (Lolita) and a pizza place even closer. The internet is super. I had to work from the hotel for a couple of days and it was fine. Friendly staff. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Joben180910
Reviews.Content: We stayed there before and after our cruise leaving from Barcelona. It is a boutique hotel, very chic, very nice and friendly. The bar section was quite nice as well but rather small. We would have like to check out the terrasse but it was closed on the first night for floor re-staining and on our last night, it was a little cold. If we ever go back, we will stay there again as it was a 40 minute walk to the Port, and a 30 minute walk to the Rambla. We also walked to the Montjuic from the hotel and it was quite pleasurable. The only down side is that we sent postcards from the hotel and they were never mailed by them or received by our friends. First class choice, we really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A dream place to stay”
Reviews.Author: paavali
Reviews.Content: We had about a month travelling through Spain and stayed in some nice places but this would have to be the best hotel we experienced. Nothing to complain about. Rooms were spacious which was nice for a 4-night stay. Staff were friendly and helpful and happy to print email tickets for me. Great terrace and nice lounges to chill out on after walking around all day. So close to the metro - one small block. Great cafes nearby. Not a lot of restaurants in the vicinity but they are easily accessible by the metro. Free cakes & fresh coffee each afternoon. Piano bar with music Thursday to Sunday - and the pianist was superb. If you are happy to be a few stops away from the buzz around The Ramblas this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Your own luxery home in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: gaseubert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Emilia and we can certainly recommend it. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpfull. Also the rooms were clean and comfortable. And the location is great, some great restaurants nearby. Some not so nearby, but the metro is clean and there is always one every 3 minutes. Very much enjoyed the bar. Entering the hotel, you'll find the reception on the right and the bar located comfortable on the left. Enjoyed the tapas and some fine wines, served by the glass, of course. Attention was given to details. Small things like candle lights, nice carpets, fine music and cozy chairs. Plus a piano, with yes, a pianist. In short, It felt like we owned our own luxery home (with staff) in Barcelona. You should certainly stay here when you visit Barcelona. By the way, another tip, we did a bike tour and enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, but beware”
Reviews.Author: eady56
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Villa Emilia, the hotel was fantastic in every way. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It was spotlessly clean and the rooms were very modern and comfortable. Breakfast was everything you need to start your day and the afternoon complimentary tea, coffee and pastries were just what was needed after a busy day sightseeing. The only thing we would like to point out is that we had been warned about pickpockets in Barcelona, but my sister who we were travelling with had her purse stolen in the lift of the hotel within ten minutes of arriving there. Not a good start to the holiday!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole_Tod
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Villa Emilia for 3 nights to celebrate my birthday and our wedding anniversary. We had a fantastic time! The hotel only has 50 or so rooms and is what I would describe as a boutique hotel - tastefully decorated, comfortable and with just the right amount of luxury and intrigue. We had a room on the 6th floor and it was spotlessly clean, tasteful decor, and an en-suite with luxurious towels and baths products. My husband had secretly arranged for some flowers and a card to be put in the room for when we arrived and then that evening the hotel brought us up a free bottle of wine to drink in the room. The metro is about 2 minutes walk so perfect for getting around Barcelona and the hotel were great at recommending places to eat. We had breakfast the first morning in the hotel but that is quite expensive at 13 euros/person so the other mornings we went to a small cafe/boulangerie just round the corner from the hotel. The bar in the lobby is great especially in the evening when we would come back after our dinner and have a coffee which was the cheapest in town. For 1.10 euros we had a coffee served with glass of fresh orange juice and a chocolate and for an extra euro we got a shot of brandy in the coffee as well! Another lovely treat was the free tea/coffee/cakes in the hotel lobby between 5-7pm - great after a hard days shopping/sight seeing. We brought our car and were able to park it at a secure car park 1 minutes walk from the hotel and plus we got a discount by saying we were staying at Villa Emilia. So all in all I would definitely recommend this hotel. The only minor thing I would have liked would have been coffee/tea making facilities in the room as I do love a cup of tea in bed in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Love Barca, loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Babnye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Emilia for three nights with our two children. We were very impressed. The hotel staff always responded promptly and courteously to emails before our arrival, providing information about transport to and from the airport and football tickets! They were also happy to confirm our room number in writing, something which some hotels find very difficult. We had two room which were facing each other on the sixth floor and there was an outside door in the hallway which could be shut, allowing the two rooms to be kept as one (although one minor niggle was that there was no way to keep the room doors opened). The rooms were spotless and cleaned thoroughly every day – and I am VERY fussy! They were comfortable and had a good selection of tv channels. Breakfast was great and the staff friendly and helpful. The afternoon coffee, with pastries, was a nice treat and a welcome break after sightseeing. There were limited smaller size meals (or tapas) which was a little disappointing as it would have made it easier for us to eat with children. But the terrace was beautiful and the mojitos very good. I really liked the location. Close enough to everything, but far enough away for peace in the evening. You can get to Placa Catalunya in 5-10 mins on the very regular buses (metro tickets can be used on the buses too – just punch ticket in slot as you get on). If you get a T-10 (from the ticket machines in the Metro stations –which have a language selecetion) you can share it and use it for 10 journeys. Children don’t pay. You can jump on the Metro at the end of road and get anywhere too. It took us, with a 4 and a 7 year old, 40 minutes to get to Camp Nou by tube – also note you do not have to pay for children to have tickets for a game if they are young and are prepared to share a seat (although seats were available for them too when we got there). You can also buy tickets on the day from the ground at Club rather than agency prices (unless it is a Madrid game or another really big match I guess). LOVED Barca, and would definitely use this hotel again. They

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but Location not great”
Reviews.Author: WTCS
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel and is located a couple of Metro stops west of the heart of the city (a one minute walk from the Rocafort station on Line 1). It is a fairly convenient location, but not great from the point of view of walking to restaurants in the evening – there are a couple nearby, but this is very much a residential area. The rooms are small, but well equipped (could have done with coffee making facilities) and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast, although relatively expensive at €13 each, was generous, but probably not worth the additional expense as there are cafes on virtually every corner. There is a nice roof terrace and we had a bottle of wine and a light supper up there on our first night. There was an enthusiastic DJ playing and the food and wine were both great and reasonably priced. The DJ could have kept the volume down a wee bit, as it was more of a bar than a nightclub atmosphere, but he seemed to be enjoying himself and it was only a minor issue! The staff on the whole is perhaps a little aloof. They weren’t actually rude, but I got the impression that occasionally the guests are considered to be a bit of a nuisance. I travel frequently on business in Asia and perhaps I am spoiled by the attitude of staff in this part of the world – nevertheless, when paying over €150 for a room (not including breakfast!) I would appreciate less ‘attitude’ and a little bit more friendliness. In summary, we enjoyed our stay and I can see why it is rated so highly on Tripadvisor, but I probably wouldn’t stay here again simply due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel,friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jamabeki
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a friend to Barcelona and was expecting the hotel to be good after reading all the great reviews on trip advisor.We weren't disappointed,the hotel lived up to and beyond our expectations.Clean spacious rooms,comfortable beds and extremely friendly and helpful staff.The lovely relaxing rooftop bar and downstairs zinc bar with live piano music were great places to have cocktails before venturing out for the evening. The city centre is a walkable distance though taxis were very easy to locate and reasonably priced if a 20 - 30 minute walk isn't for you. Didn't see much in the way of nightlife around the hotel though that was fine as it makes for a nice quiet area at night and getting taxis to/from the marina where there are lots of bars and restaurants was no trouble.Will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A HORRIBLE welcome leads to a so-so stay.”
Reviews.Author: dathrilla
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 people including myself stayed here in the beginning of October. Here is what I experienced. 1) WELCOME/CHECK-IN I reserved my room the same day from Montpellier, France. The Gentleman named "FERNANDO" took down my name, credit card number and phone number. I told him my group would arrive around 4 PM. Arriving around 5:30, a young, Argentinian lady named "JULIA" "welcomed" us with the following sentence: "...name? ohh, I was about to cancel your reservation...wrong phone number, wrong credit card number, nothing was right." Can't you at least say HI??? I mean even if you walk in a supermarket you receive a Hello! This is a hotel, a business. If you have a staff so impolite, trust me, your business will not last for long. Apparently, I was the person who made a mistake when "FERNANDO" took down my information wrong (he was in a rush when talking with me on the phone!!!). I asked for her manager after the rooms were--unwillingly, i should say--sorted out. All of a sudden, a mature lady to the right of "JULIA" said in an arrogant manner "I'm the proprietor." That is when I had nothing to say... 2) COMPLIMENTARY COFFEE AT FIRST FLOOR What a joke! An embarrassment! Imagine a group of 8 businessmen going to the first floor and encountering empty trays and no coffee or tea! I mean, sometimes its better not to offer something. 3) AVOID ROOMS ON THE FIRST FLOOR They are really inconvenient. No privacy at all. 4) GOOD BREAKFAST However, the staff in the kitchen doesn't speak ENGLISH!!! *** I talked to the manager at the front desk at my departure...I informed him that i would be writing this review...He kindly asked me not to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Horseeye
Reviews.Content: Really nice staff friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel is attractive and pleasant , our room (34) was a reasonable size, clean and bright. The roof terrace was an enjoyable additional facility. Location was good, only 100 yds from the Mero.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but avoid the rooms on the first floor”
Reviews.Author: bearadvisor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a long week end based on TA reviews. It has easy access to pretty much everything and is far from the busy touristy and noisy Rambla. It's a few blocks from Joan Miro park, not far from market San Antoni, Place Catalunya, and Monjuic park. There are a few shops around in case you need to bring back some culinary delicacies, and even one next to the hotel. Otherwise Jamonisimo is just a few blocks away (see http://www.jamonisimo.com/ ) Room was large, it was made of 2 beds which really wasn't ideal. Mattress is pretty hard and I'm used to hard one. I was having a room on the first floor which is actually a small terrace overlooking the lounge. Problem even if there wasn't that many people when I was there...it gets very noisy and you hear it a lot from your room. They attempted to minimize the issue by having a sliding door hiding 2 rooms in the corner...you may want to be aware of that. I wasn't told and came back around 2am the first night after a few drinks to wonder during a good 2 mins where on earth did my room disappear (fringe event ?) until I realized there was a wall which looked slightly out of place near the location of where I remembered my room supposedly was. Otherwise nothing to fault the hotel, staff was extremely courteous and helpful, room was good albeit the bed and noise issue, bathroom was good and everything was perfectly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service at Villa Emilia”
Reviews.Author: Sandy30029
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Villa Emilia before boarding our cruise ship. We spent three days in Barcelona and the staff could not have been more helpful. they assisted with dinner reservations, tours and taxis. The accomodations are roomy, well maintained and modern. There was a lovely bar and cafe on the first level. Best of all free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: dunsmoreman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend in September, ( 2 mature couples). all agreed that this hotel was one of the nicer places we have stayed. Helpful & friendly staff, good selection at breakfast ( for a continental type) & plenty of places to sit, relax & have a drink while the peolple rush by. Both our rooms were comfortable & of a good size, quiet too, always important. Central ish for exploring the city, we walked to most of the usual tourist sights. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As an overall exprience this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: AcerLeeds
Reviews.Content: It is very hard to find anything negative to say about this hotel. The service is very friendly, the rooms are large for European standards and spotlessly clean. The roof terrace is amazing and as we were lucky with the weather we went up every night for a nightcap. We didn't mind the location as I'm a light sleeper so prefer to stay somewhere quiet. You could actually walk it into town but after a long day you may prefer to catch the metro which is 2minutes walk from the hotel. The only (very minor) issues I had was the bed was slightly hard for my liking but then again my wife liked it. And the other thing is that sliding bathroom door... ours had a gap in it so you feel a bit exposed although you can't see in if you are on the bed. Other than that the bathrooms are gorgeous. We ate at the restaurant one evening and the food was of good quality and the piano music was a nice bonus to create a romantic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for visiting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Piekie
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is a great hotel in a very good location. Close to Place d'Espanya, very close to the metro station Rocafort, close to some local shops etc. We arrived at ten in the morning, just to drop our luggage, but a room was immediately available. Top service! It has only one minor minus and those are the hard beds. When used to a soft matress, the beds are not very comfortable. We knew beforehand hard beds are usual in Spain. We loved our stay in Barcelona and would stay again at the Villa Emilia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: AKFL
Reviews.Content: Booked Villa emilia after I read the reviews on tripadvisor - and almost everything met my expectations. Nice, very clean rooms, tasty breakfast, staff very friendly and nice! Located close to metro station Rocafort, and in walking distance to Placa espanya (stop for the aerobus). Located in a side road of Gran Via, not too noisy, and windows do a good job regarding sound insulation. Only thing that was disappointing was the barbecue (every thursday on the roof terrace), although the wine (included) was very nice, the food was almost cold (and for 21 Euros you´ll find other places which offer better food). Nevertheless, would book that hotel again when in barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Creamegg
Reviews.Content: The Villa Emilia is an excellent base for a visit to Barcelona. It is one of the nicest hotels that we stayed in, with immaculately clean, spacious rooms, quality furnishings, very friendly, helpful staff and a very convenient location just a couple of minutes walk from the Rocafort metro station. We booked at a very good price through Otel.com and half expected the hotel to be disappointing, but far from it. Our room was very quiet, despite overlooking a major road, and the air conditioning ran silently, allowing us to get an excellent night’s sleep. Breakfast was first class, with a good selection of high quality food available, and sipping mojito’s beneath the stars at the rooftop bar was a lovely experience. As others have mentioned, the design of the shower is a bit of a problem, requiring strategically placed towels to be used to prevent the bathroom floor flooding and we felt that the barbeque meal on the roof top was a bit expensive at 22 euro’s for a bowl of lettuce and a handful of kebabs, especially as the drinks are also expensive (10 euros for a vodka). We used the free wifi connection which worked very well in our room, and the mini fridge and safe in our room were also useful. We would defiantly stay at the Villa Emilia again and can recommend an evening stroll to the Magic Fountains of Montjuic which are only a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: jeany22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Villa Emilia on a city break, two couples, and we were absolutey delighted with our choice. The hotel is SPOTLESS! and the staff very friendly without being obtrusive. The Zinc Bar is a lovely place to people watch and the roof top terrace is wonderful! Its a short 15 minute walk into town and the metro is just around the corner. Taxis are readily available and quite inexpensive. The beds are very comfortable and grat shower - I just don't have anything negative to say!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely neighborhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrjNU
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is a wonderful retreat in Barcelona. It is near enough to the city center and old town to be convenient, but far enough away from The Ramblas to have a neighborhood charm. The room was spacious, comfortable, and quiet. Plus, the Metro stop was right around the corner. I spent hours trying to find the right hotel for our stay in Barcelona, and I can't be more pleased that we ended up with Villa Emilia. It has the feel of a boutique hotel, but was still a value considering how expensive other hotels were during our travel dates.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service ruined the trip”
Reviews.Author: jaki_85
Reviews.Content: We took the advise of TA and booked 3 nights and 2 rooms stay at Villa Emilia. While the hotel rooms and location were consistent with the feedback from TA readers, the unexpected poor service we received there was abysmally disappointing. Upon check-in, we asked for very explicit verification whether breakfast would be complimentary, since we were unsure, and were happy to find it out as stated by the hotel staff as it was, or so we thought. At the end of the meal the following day, we were shocked to find a 16 euro charge per person. When asked to speak to hotel front desk regarding this discrepancy, that's when the finger pointing started. I don't know if this is the European manner of dealing with things, but we demanded to speak to the hotel manager, but the waiter forced us to sign the bill for the meal first. Inappropriate. The availability of the hotel manager's time to speak with us was also outrageous. He worked 3 hours of our 3 day's stay. We spoke with several hotel front desk staff who made no attempts to take responsibility of what was clearly their mistake. If in fact, the meal was additional, it was completely their fault for stating otherwise; the customer should not take the burden of their mistake. Additionally, the staff kept on stating how if they waived the meal, it was their heads on the line. That is irrelevant to the customer. What happened to making the customer happy? The dispute was never resolved; we never even received an apology. I left the hotel and city with a sense of the complete lack of professionalism. Take ownership of your mistake, at least! Villa Emilia left a bad taste in my mouth. If by chance the management responds to this, I will ask you readers to not be clouded by their argument as I am a very well-traveled working professional who has never had any problems dealing with hotel management in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant base in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ruth+andy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! We walked to the hotel from the aerobus stop in 10 minutes and to the city centre in 20 so the location was ideal. The hotel itself has beautiful modern decor and a relaxing feel, and the rooms were spacious with all the amenities you'd expect including lovely toiletries and excellent air conditioning. The attention to detail is impressive, even down to the aroma in the corridors. As others have mentioned, we also found the roof top bar to be a great place to relax in the early evening, it really made our trip to have somewhere nice to chill out after a busy day sightseeing. And the free drinks and snacks between 5 and 7pm were lovely too (especially the tea selection). We wouldn't hestitate to recommend this hotel and hope to come back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very clean, friendly...”
Reviews.Author: LeilaLA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very clean, friendly staff (Sebastian was great!). The breakfast is NOT TO BE MISSED!

Reviews.Title: “perfect, stylish, clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: dszczepa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night after a week at Costa Brava. Perfect location between Plaza de Espana (three blocks) and Barri Gothic (8 blocks). Very nice staff. Rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An Amaizing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OlgaBrosh
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel the moment I stepped through the door. Very nice modern design, friendly and helpful staff, and great location. The room was pretty spacious, clean, with nice floor to ceiling windows that opened and became a "balcony" and a nice fresh smell! The bathroom was pretty big as well with a big shower. All the furnishings seemed new and the bed was very comfy! All the essentials were in the room, including free internet. I loved the location because the area seemed not very touristy and quiet, it was seconds away from the subway but also walkable distance to major sites of interest if you like to discover the city (which we certainly did). The rooftop patio of the hotel deserves a separate review! It is very cozy, with a nice view of the city and the best cocktails I ever had (mojitos there are a MUST)! The food in the hotel is also one of the best we had in Barcelona, although a bit pricey. I would defenetly come back to this hotel and would recommend it any day!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: eaglebayCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: VA is a very nice hotel - nice design, music and a very cozy bar on the roof top! We stayed for 4 nights and it was a very pleasant stay. Free wi-fi, breakfast included and a very helpful staff! The rooms are large, clean and modern flatscreen (and on top of that a nice minibar)! The only minor thing was that the bed was too hard for my taste .... The breakfast buffet was also a nice surprize - almost everything you could desire and Cava (spanish champagne) as well! Would definately come back - if value for money is right as it sure was this time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LemonEric
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 7 Nights so I've had a lot of time to check everything out.. the hotel is nicely situated, I took an Aerobus service straight from the airport that takes you directly to Pl. Espanya which is about 15 minutes walk away from the hotel. Rocafort station (red line) is right around the corner as well if you'd prefer to take the Metro. Since everything was booked and paid for before hand it was just a matter of collecting the room keycard and getting checked in which took no less then 10minutes. The staff were very friendly and helped with any queries we had. Make sure you ask for a Wifi User and password if your bringing a laptop etc as they will have it printed out for you, wifi access is free and available throughout the buliding (even the terrace on the top floor). Funnily enough we were put in a Queen bedroom suite (room 66 on the 6th floor) which was right in front of the elevator, initially i was worried about noise of people coming in and out the lift but soon realized it actually benefited us in reaching our room quicker. Upon entering the room I had a look around to see if any of tripadvisor reviews were accurate and to my surprise most of them were. The room was extremely clean and very welcoming.. in the bathroom there were about 4 large towels and one floor towel, complementary soap and shampoo, fresh rolls of tissue and even a hair dryer! most importantly it was extremely clean. In the main room there was a safe (big enough to fit my laptop, passports, phones, glasses etc) built in a cupboard and out of site which was good. Just underneath that was a mini fridge, keep in mind that these drinks cost extra. Lighting could have been better as there's no ceiling light but the lights smartly placed around the room were more then sufficient to our needs. There was a single chair which was comfy and this bench type chair on the side which was cool. View from the balcony was top notch. The bed was one big double bed with 1 mattress which I was very happy about as I've been in many hotels before hand which just use 2 singles pushed together. The tv had a few channels showing quite a few american programs such as House and Bones etc. I have to say that service here is extremely good with staff being very friendly, an example is when my gf accidentally locked our safe and forgot the code. One call to reception, a staff came and assisted us and solved our problem all within 5minutes. The terrace upstairs was very nicely designed with a great view and a bar, great place to lay around being lazy. The Included breakfast was good with fresh food and a good selection to choose from but for those who decide not to have breakfast here can easily walk around and find little bakery shops at nearly every corner which provide a cheaper alternative. There's free tea and coffee every afternoon with rolls and croissants which was perfect for winding down after a long day out. Dinner here was pretty good with different daily special 4 course meals available at a set price although very pricey. (btw there's an awesome little kebab shop across the street that must be tried). Overall this hotel simply put is awesome with a lot of attention put into details. Definitely recommended. If your visiting for the first time you should get a Tour bus as its very good. If your staying for longer a T10 metro ticket should be enough. Glad i didnt get a barcelona card as i dont think i would have used it at all. The discount aint worth it and you wont have enough time to visit all the museum's unless u stay longer then 7days, tour bus ad t10 should take you to all the places you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Service and Rooftop Bar”
Reviews.Author: MMCPT
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at hotel on the 6th floor. Rooms are decent size for European hotel and modern with nice bathrooms. Also has great roof top bar on 7th with nice view of city. Could not hear any noise from roof bar in evenings. Also, could not hear neighbors which are not always achievable in European hotels. Overall great value for money and staff are friendly and helpful (Fernando and Julia provided us with good recommendations for dinner and places to visit). Hotel located close to metro and bus stops and walking distance (15 min) from Plaza de Cataluña. Only minor notable item is that if you are a late sleeper might be difficult to sleep past 9am as cleaning team must work part time as part of demolition crew as they were quite noisy. In summary would stay there again especially given price and service.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better....”
Reviews.Author: SMPR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for three nights in August 2010 and it could not have been better. Friendly staff, helpful, engaged, to make the stay authentic. Rooms are great even if you are on lower floor you dont hear the traffic. The restaurant kitchen is execellent...even if the chef like to go home at straight 11pm....but his dishes were great. Thank you for making our stay so super.

Reviews.Title: “What a great boutique hotel to discover Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Orlando2011
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at Villa Emilia last September pre cruise from Barcelona. We arrived at the hotel from the airport by using the Aerobus that dropped us off at the Gran Via a couple blocks from the Hotel. We arrived without our luggage because late connections had our luggage stuck in Madrid. The lobby of the hotel is very beautifully decorated with a modern touch, staff was comprised of mainly young people ready to greet us and take care of our reservation. We received our double bedroom as soon as we arrived and it was all I hoped it would be, modern, spotless clean, comfy, with free wi-fi, flat screen tv and overlooking the street corner which was quite a quiet one because we slept very well. We didn't get our luggage until the next 24hs and all the time the staff was eager to help us in any way..lending us their phone to call the airline with no charge to our room. Hotel didn't include breakfast so can't comment on their food although we did stop by the mezzanine for a coffee and biscuits placed next to their computer center. The hotel has a very nice top floor with a balcony lounge area where you can sit and relax enjoying a nice cocktail at night. The location is actually quite good to visit Barcelona. You can practically walk to the magic fountain and discover Montjuic or just take the Metro which is less than two blocks away and use it to go anywhere in the city as it is so easy and convenient. I would definitely return to Villa Emilia in my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Adrina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient, just 2mins away from Rockafort metro station (metro line L1 (red line)). The hotel is about 10mins walk away from Plaça España Aerobus stop. The Aerobus (A1) takes approx 25mins to reach Plaça España stop from Barcelona El Prat Airport and costs EUR 5.05 per ticket (roundtrip ticket costs EUR 8.75 and it's valid for 9 days). Per email from the hotel, a taxi from El Prat airport will cost approx EUR 30 - 35 depending on traffic and which day of the week (taxi rates differ between weekdays and weekends). Taxi will take approx 20-30mins. Or the hotel can arrange for a luxury car for you, which will cost EUR 75 - 85. The hotel is located in a quieter area of Barcelona, away from the hustle and bustle of La Ramblas (but only few metro stops away). There is a small grocery shop diagonally opposite the hotel which you can purchase water/drinks/snacks. The room is cosy but not claustrophobic. The room was also very clean. The bathroom tiles are all black, but it's brightly lit so it's not a problem. They use ~H2O+ brand (http://www.h2oplus.com) amenities but only offer shower gel, shampoo and body lotion. They do not provide other essential amenities (e.g. toothbrush, toothpaste, cotton pads, shower cap, etc) so best to pack them with you or maybe they will be provided upon request. The water pressure is good. The only complaint is that while the shower looks cool and modern, it floods 1/3 of the bathroom floor after a shower. I know these boutique hotels often have modern and sleek designs, but it also should be functional. They should have better designs for the shower. We requested for a double bed, but they gave us two single beds pushed together and the beds tend to separate during the course of the night. Not very comfortable if someone is sleeping near the middle. Not sure if they have proper double beds at the hotel. The beds are quite hard, so if anyone prefers a soft bed, beware! As the air-conditioner is quite cool (you cannot turn the temp higher than 25°C) I requested for an extra blanket, but they told me they do not have any spare blankets. Normally they will take one from another room, but since the hotel was operating at full capacity, they could not offer me another blanket. I think this is quite ridiculous, how could a hotel not have spare blankets? They also do not have coffee/tea making facilities in the room. There were not many English channels on TV, so if you like relaxing and watching TV in the room, best to bring your laptop and download some movies. The reception staff were courteous and helpful. They helped to make restaurant bookings, print maps of places we wanted to visit and suggested areas to go for dinner if you did not have a specific restaurant in mind. They all spoke good English. We had dinner at the hotel one night and the food was really good. The prices were not too expensive and if you are too tired to go out after a day of sightseeing and shopping, it would be a good idea to stay in and enjoy dinner at Zinc. As there are usually only a few tables occupied, the ambience is very relaxing. If you like to chill out, they also have a roof-top terrace upstairs with lounge music. I chose this hotel after extensive research on Trip Advisor and apart from several minor faults, this is a good choice for Barcelona at this price (£99 on Sat in Aug 2010 and £79 on Sun & Mon in Aug 2010 + £7 taxes & service fees per night - booked via Expedia). If you are looking for a more centrally located hotel, try looking at Murmuri (also mentioned in the Luxe City Guides - http://www.luxecityguides.com), I was deciding between Murmuri and Villa Emilia. I chose Villa Emilia in the end as there seemed to be more positive comments on Trip Advisor and also because they provided free wi-fi (this should be standard in all hotels!).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: EJH79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in August 2010. Hotel and staff were very good and would not hesitate in recommending this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent food!!!!”
Reviews.Author: knorita
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is well designed hotel near plaza Espanya and next to a metro station (Rocafort). So even if it is not in the center of the city you can catch the metro train and be there in 2 minutes. The neighborhood is really quiet and safe. The room, hotel and elevator smelled really nice and were very clean. There is a bar on the room with great decoration and pleasant music. The breakfast is really good and the the food in the restaurant (even though is a little bit expensive) is really tasty!!! They changed the towels every day and people in the reception were very friendly. We recommend this hotel for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fodda
Reviews.Content: Spent a great week here in August. Couldn't think of anywhere else I'd have rather stayed. The hotel is situated about 100m from Rocafort Metro station which will get you wherever you want any time. 20 mins walk will get you to the Placa de Catalunya one way and 15 mins walk to Placa de Espanya the other way. Hotel is in a quiet part of the town as well. Traffic noise was of no concern at all in our front facing room. Speaking of which, the room we had was fantastic, clean and large. The only caveat I'd say about staying here is tat the batroom door is a slide-open type. It has no lock, and no way of masking any noises made in there... Ahem... Fine for us as we've been married over 20 years, but bear in mind if you're shy about toilet noises... The downstairs bar is a nice place to relax after an evening out, but far and away the rooftop terrace bar is superb! Mojitos up there are a must! Reception staff were excellent as well, couldn't be more helpful. All in all, I'd recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful place!!”
Reviews.Author: kokolakisk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best value/price hotel i 've ever been. The best point is the architecture of the whole building... When you get in you can smell the best aromatics! The bar, the reception and the restaurant area attracts the attention once you go inside.. All the people working are very polite and hospitable.. The room we stayed was fantastic also.. Very clean,fantastic architecture..Breakfast and restaurant were fantastic..We ate the best dishes in Villa Emilia during our stay to Barcelona. And the price of the menu was very reasonable. Another positive is that there is a metro station 50m from the hotel so you can go anywhere in the fastest way... Everything was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AmericaineAParis
Reviews.Content: Located in the Eixample neighborhood just off the Gran via, the hotel is on a quiet street just one block from the L1 of the metro and just off the Aerobus route, so is very easy to get to without the noise you could get in other neighborhoods, while still being fairly central. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and check-in, check-out and brief key issue were handled quickly and professionally. Unfortunately, the terrace bar/restaurant was closed when we went to have brunch, but we were able to buy a drink in the downstairs bar and bring it up. The terrace has lots of couches and comfy chairs (and parasols), so you can lounge after a day of walking. The views aren't spectacular, but you can see a bit of the Sagrat Cor on Mount Tibidabo. We did not have the breakfast at the hotel, but did have coffee a few times; it was perfect and not very expensive (3€ for a cappuccino). Our room was on the first floor, just over the bar and next to the room where tea/coffee are served in the afternoon and did not have a view.. Since we weren't in the room long enough , it didn't really matter and we were never disturbed by any noise. The beds are comfortable, the A/C extremely effective and the bathroom was great (adjustable and removable shower head - warm water straight away - perfect water pressure). I will definitely go back to the hotel for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cab514
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights before heading off on a cruise and I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The staff were fabulous, friendly and spoke beautiful English and were very tolerant of my very broken Spanish. The breakfast - we had it included with our room - was fabulous. Especially when you see how much food costs in Barcelona. The buffet had an assortment of meats, yogurt (unbelievably good), fruit, baked goods. The best croissants I have ever had. They even served Cava - although I didn't think drinking before sightseeing was a good idea, lots of other guests took advantage of it. The room had a king-sized bed for my husband and me and a separate bed for my 15 year old daughter. We had plenty of room and storage space for all our gear and loved the funky mod furnishing and bathroom. Had barbecue up on the rooftop terrace one night. Pricey (21 euro) but really, really good. One of the best meals we had in Barcelona. Would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well-appointed rooms, great service and location ---- highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jsoell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here toward the end of our year in Spain, when we wanted to splurge a bit and be at a boutique place. You never really know what you're going to get when you get into the "boutique hotel" segment, since some of them decide that they can convert a rickety old house or apartment complex into a rickety new hotel and call it "boutique" . Villa Emilia is not that; it is beautiful, with lots of open space in the lobby, very helpful staff, well-designed and laid out rooms that feel spacious and are in fact larger than some of the other places we stayed in Barcelona. All in all, it was a great experience, and I highly recommend Villa Emilia to anyone looking for a wonderful place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel--”
Reviews.Author: Seattlecruzgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for one night prior to our cruise. It is in Eixample, not far from Plaza Espana and Montjuic also. It is located on a side street but easy to get everywhere from Metro station nearby. If you like modern, small, boutique hotels, this is an excellent place to stay. Rooms were modern, comfortable, and had a rooftop terrace that was fantastic for drinks and tapas. Lobby was chic and modern, more on the art-tech "W" side of the coin as far as design. Eclectic art and features, etc. a small gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a must-stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: eg-wv
Reviews.Content: * Neighbourhood: 100m from M-station Rocafort, safe area * Reception desk: friendly and helpful * Room (6th floor): very clean, free internet, nice bathroom, nice decorated, airco * Terrace Bar (7th floor): excellent * Breakfast: everything you need (toast, bread, salmon, cava, tea, coffee, cornflakes, youghurt,...and last but not least, the excellent marmelade) and plenty! * Between 5 and 7pm: free coffee/tea/milk and water with snacks * Lounge Bar (ground floor): didn't spend time in that bar, the terrace was more tempting. But it looked ok and cousy. * We didn't have our meals in the hotel, so we don't know if that was ok

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilly985
Reviews.Content: what a gorgeous hotel, hidden gem, 10 min walk from the ramblas or 2 mins on the metro. Staff were very friendly and welcoming, music in the bars were lovely and terrace bar was my favourite. Rooms very clean, bed very comfortable and no noise can be heard from the streets. Could not recommend this hotel more and will definitely at at emilia when we return to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with fantastic coffee break!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4always
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 6 nights at Villa Emilia in July and really enjoyed our experience. I selected this hotel based on the Tripadvisor ratings, and we were not disappointed. Upon arrival, the receptionist gave us a map and a great guide book. The staff was also very helpful with our questions (and we had quite a few!) Although it is a 15-20 minute walk to Place Catalunya (still walkable), it is still very well located in the city. The metro (Rocafort) is at the corner of the hotel's street, and it is only 3 stops away from the city centre. I was not sure how far the hotel would be upon booking, but you can rest assured, that it is well located. We loved the trendy decor of the hotel, and the rooftop terrasse was amazing. If you are a light sleeper, it is best to request a room on a high floor. However, we had a room on the 6th floor, and it was noisy at night as it was right under the rooftop terrasse... therefore, I recommend staying anywhere between the 2nd - 5th floors. The free coffee and pastries from 5 to 7 was one of the highlights of our stay. The coffee was delicious, and the pastries were amazing! Try the sugar coated churros, which are filled with custard - amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel. One of the best stays we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Beckythebean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had 4 days in Barcelona and chose to book Villa Emilia based on the trip advisor reviews. I have to say that we were really impressed, the hotel delivering above our expectations. The staff could not be more helpful and courteous. Our room immaculate, incredibly comfortable, spacious and with the quiet unobtrusive air conditioning system allowed for an undisturbed nights sleep. The breakfast buffet was included in the price which is rare for Barcelona, the selection available was fantastic with my husband dining on smoked salmon and boiled egg most mornings. We also dined in the restaurant one evening, the waiter went out of his way to assist, there was a great selection on the menu and we both very much enjoyed the food and the ambiance. The hotel was situated on a quiet attractive square within easy walking distance of Placa Espana and Catalunya and about 100 yards away from the nearest metro. We did dine down at the marina one evening and chose to walk back to the hotel. It is a long way but there were plenty of taxis or the metro to chose from had we wished and if I can manage it at 5 weeks pregnant i think it would be achievable for most. The hotel were happy to store our luggage for us on the day of departure and we were issued with plastic numbers for pick up to ensure that there was no confusion. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, especially for couples looking for a relaxing and romantic break such as ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KBoston22
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is about a 30 Euro taxi ride from the airport and situated in a more quiet residential area. The lobby has a modern feel with a bar and restaurant where you can get some tapas. After a long flight we were not thrilled to find out our room wouldn’t be ready until 2 but that is the norm here so you have to go with the flow ( just be prepared). This was one of the few hotels that allow you to book a room for three people which was ideal for my group.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Babadoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in July and cannot fault the hotel one bit. The location in my view is great as the tube station is meters from the hotel and 3 stops into the centre. Giving you a quiter location away from the hustle and bustle yet close enough to see the sights. I did not book directly with the hotel as their prices can out way more than non direct. We paid £86 a night for bed and breakfast which was excellent considering its a 4* hotel. Breakfast was lovely as it had more than the european cheese and ham you tent to get in other places. They had a egg boiler which I had never seem before which was nice as you could cook your boiled eggs fresh to your liking. The rooms were adequate, clean and lovely decorated. No see through glass walls in ours so must only apply to certain rooms where some people have made n issue of. The hotel itself had a very lovely ambiance about the place expecially in the bar and restaurant and I loved the roof top bar although only visited it once. This place definately deserves its ranking and would deffinately stay here again when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..location good only if you want to use the subway..better for second time or extended vacations”
Reviews.Author: Kris69Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Great hotel..clean, well appointed, helpful staff...full marks to the owners!! Reasonable price point as well. we arrived late night after hellish flight delays from Greece and were pleasantly surprised by the size and quality of the hotel. with only 2 days left thanks a to AEGEAN airways (from a original 3 days trip) using the subway limited our movements in exploring the Rambla and surroundings..for first timers would recommend a hotel closer to the ramblas so you can enjoy the free flowing late nights (vs. risking a late night subway ride). Barcelona is a great city to enjoy walking..wish Villa emilia was closer to Ramblas..would have been perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: J_Byars
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Emilia for three nights at the beginning and two nights at the end of a two week trip to Spain. We arrived early and exhausted, and they managed to give us a room anyway. Basically, they took care of us. We had to leave for our flight in the middle of the night, and they suggested a wake-up call and made it. They made sure a taxi was there for us. The staff are all extremely competent and helpful. In addition to that, the building and rooms are clean, comfortable, and nicely designed. AND they have free wifi!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: texcarmi
Reviews.Content: We love the staff! If I could rate the staff higher than 5 stars then I would. This is a great hotel with an excellent staff that made our stay in Barcelona more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, modern, clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: sdludlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June and loved this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is in a handy location right near the metro station and also fairly close to the airport bus stop. It is not right in the centre of the city, but we didn't mind the walk into town or the beach and if you don't want to walk the metro is very reliable and quick. We also found taxi's to be really cheap for getting home late at night. The rooms are excellent, very clean, modern decor and a terrific shower. The bed was really comfortable and the room is quiet so we slept well. We did not notice any bad smells at all, as others have reported. There is also free wifi in the rooms, which is very handy when you are travelling for an extended time. And the breakfast was yummy with good variety. Overall we loved Barcelona and this hotel was one of our favourites in our 2 months of travel around Europe. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: css201
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is just great! I found it through Trip Advisor and for once found somewhere that lived up to the reviews. I stayed here with my mum for 4 days and we really had a fantastic time. One evening we ate in the restaurant and the meal was delicious. Our room was lovely - large and airy and at the back of the hotel so very quiet as well. We loved the roof top terrace bar and on our last evening came back to our room to find a scroll tied with ribbon inviting us to watch the world cup semi-final at the roof bar. Which we did so with some cava, delicious nibbles and lots of very very happy Spaniards - a perfect end to a great holiday!! I can't recommend Villa Emilia enough - its certainly one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Looks and feels good, smells bad”
