Reviews.Author: hobo_ent
Reviews.Content: I'm typing this from my bed at Villa Emilia with the sheets over my nose so I can't smell the VERY strong sewage smell that comes and goes via the air conditioning here. I'm not sure if it a Barcelona thing or hotel thing, but it is not an enjoyable thing. Aside from the perhaps uncontrollable smell, Villa Emilia is a winner with nice bars on the ground floor and terrace, average European sized, but well appointed rooms, and a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good quiet location, near bus and metro lines.”
Reviews.Author: Ripley-Auburn
Reviews.Content: Definately would return to this hotel. Within one block of the metro and bus lines. Many restaurants in the area. Small grocery store across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aturkinnola
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a gorgeous city and this hotel is the perfect companion. It is in a great location to walk around and right in front of a subway station and pretty close to the airport bus. Comfortable rooms, free and fast wi-fi, atmospheric cafe. Hard to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet, a little bit far from the center. Very good restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Laura-orcas
Reviews.Content: We've been only one night there but it was ok. Breakfast is the best. The restaurant is very good, I found Argentinian people working there and it was very nice. In general friendly people in the hotel. It is just a little bit far from the Rambla and you need to take the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you are not going for leisure”
Reviews.Author: OttomanCitizen
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, kind of romantic and trendy. It is near to Barcelona Sants train station. As I used the station couple of times, the location was handy for me. But if you are going to explore the city and want to hang around the beach, the hotel is a bit far away. Helpful staff, mediocre breakfast, nice rooms. There is a GSM base station right across the hotel. If you are sensitive about the electromagnetic waves, this might not be the best choice. But there are stations all over the city. 100€ is a deal for this hotel. Overall, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Shame the weather was so cold!”
Reviews.Author: thegirl123
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel to celebrate my partner's birthday. It was unfortunate that this coincided with the big freeze! Of course the hotel cannot be blamed for this. One thing the hotel offered that did make it better was the yummy pastries and coffee served in the evening. The hotel was beautiful - the pianist added to the atmosphere. The only thing I'd say that could be improved (if pushed) would be to offer more a range of food on the menu. That said, the food was nice although a bit pricey. I have recommended this hotel to friends and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to Barcelona and Villa Emilla”
Reviews.Author: NancyProvidence_RI
Reviews.Content: We loved our recent stay at Villa Emilia. It is the kind of small boutique hotel I love. Staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was small but nicely furnished and had all of the amenities we needed. The price was very reasonable. The breakfast and brunch were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: LizMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Barcelona we stayed at Villa Emilia. It is a very comfortable boutique hotel, modern and chic. There is a fantastic rooftop lounge which was great after a long day of sightseeing to have cocktails and relax. It is in a great location, quiet neighborhood, 1 block to Metro that will take you anywhere, yet a short taxi ride to just about anywhere you would want to go if you are not comfortable taking the metro. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave us a map and small guide book at arrival that we were not able to live without. They have a fabulous restaurant especially if you are to tired and just want to stay in and relax. There are a couple of wonderful bakeries in the neighborhood as well. When we return to Barcelona we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellet location”
Reviews.Author: Neil/macd5
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via good reviews from trip advisor and have to say that we were not disappointed. The hotel is very clean,modern also the staff are friendly and welcoming. Rooms to a high standard and the breakfast is also excellent with bubbly if you want it. So easy to travel as the metro is so close. For travelling around a Barcelona Card is a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Trendy, chic, clean and very helpful a great way to greet Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LorindaB
Reviews.Content: We started our stay in Barcelona as a newly engaged couple (just a few hours prior) and our stay at Emilia toppped off our excitement! The decor is very cool - luscious textures, trendy, sleek and very inviting.The interior had a relaxing mood, chillout tunes playing.The staff were very efficient and friendly (after a bit of small talk). The breakfast was INCREDIBLE - Cava (spanish bubbles) at breakfast - what can I say? Pastries, fruit, cereals etc etc. We needn't stop for lunch (more time to ponder Gaudi's creations!) Location of the hotel is just a few tube stops away (takes about 10 mins) from the main drag (La Rambla etc), then just a tiny stroll past some nice supermarkets to the hotel. It is perfect - away from the hustle and bustle and a little cheaper too. The room we had was very clean comfy and inviting- beds were fresh, soft - excellent quality linen, the bathroom was immaculate, ample space. There was a fridge and the toiletries supplied were luxury - the same as what they use in their spa!! When it came to our departure day, we made the most of sightseeing and the manager personally allowed us to hang out in the upstairs loft - free afternoon tea each day. We also were offered a glass of bubble`s! The upstairs bar is very sleek and a great place to wiund down with a drink after a long day of walking. My fiance enquired about the CD playing and the lovely girl who was working sold it to him - her last copy! So overall, our experience was FANATSTIC. I thoroughly recommend staying here - it is a great boutique hotel that is not way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Chic.Clean.Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Laura7818
Reviews.Content: This was a great pick for Barcelona. The room was small but honestly didn't really need much, I mean when in Spain how much time do you plan on being in there. Great shower head. Very modern & chic. Very friendly staff. Free computers with internet service. Cool bar area with a Piano. The location was great a 10 minute walk to the Las Ramblas & down the block from a Metro to take you to the other areas. It was centrally located but not in the heart of the action which can sometimes be noisy. I have traveled many times to Europe & the only thing that gets me are the two double beds pushed together to make a king, but they always seem to separate in the middle of the night and it's hard to cuddle with your partner. Ha! And I would say that the room service food although was delicious...there wasn't much of a selection, mainly cold tapas...actually come to think of it..only cold tapas. I would recommend going to Ibericum Restaurant - when you get out of the hotel make a left & the next street make a right - restaurant is small & sneaks right up to on you on your left. It's the place the locals go to (especially chef's) after their shift is over. Very low key but amazing service, fantastic authentic food & great vino. Highly recommend. But great hotel, great price for what you get & would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks All The Boxes”
Reviews.Author: sf004
Reviews.Content: Like so many other guests we were delighted with our experience of Hotel Emilia. This was our second stay here. Firstly as a couple, and now returning with our 4 children - ranging from 14 - 6. We had 2 rooms, though not next to each other, they were on the same floor. Each room had a very comfortable 'put you up' bed in. There was still plenty of space in each room. One room had a bath and shower, the other just a shower. Why Hotel Villa Emilia works for us.....location - it is no more than 2 minutes from the Metro (Rockfort) - We used the Metro all the time. Safe, clean and efficient (our 6 and 10 year old boys were invited to ride in the cab of one!!). The Metro will get you where you want quickly enough at a reasonable price. Breakfast included in the price - a good hearty breakfast with all the continental favourites (delicious pastries, jams, yogurts, cheeses, hams, soft boiled eggs, fruit salad, plus cereals, toast and any type of coffee you like - just ask at the kitchen). Internet Access - to check flights, look at restaurant reviews, kids to keep up with Facebook! (and with our extended stay due to the volcano, schools sending homework by email!). Happy Hour - which was 2 hours, where free coffee, water and pastries were available late afternoon. Friendly and helpful staff - we managed a late check out, and luggage store with no problem, homework was printed off at the hotel printer, The bar was reasonably priced. It felt a safe, friendly place to be after a day of touring the city. I would recommend it to anyone who was visiting Barcelona, just remember you are not in the thick of the city, so plan your dining out, as there are some lovely restaurants around - they just need a little searching. We found a great Chinese buffet and a lovely Indian restaurant very near by. There is also a supermarket only 1 minute away and a 'corner shop' opposite the hotel entrance. Other notes are - the complimentary shower gel and shampoo are lovely, no need to pack your own. The hairdryer is not that strong. There is very little English speaking TV in the rooms - and if you have children just be careful what they are watching, as there are some adult programs during the day! The rooms were really warm, and we struggled a little to keep them cool, hotel staff advised they were still on their 'winter setting'. The Roof top bar was having some work done on it, but I expect this has been completed by now. We caught the Aerobus from the airport - after much debating on the cost of a taxi - 120 Euro return we decided to catch the bus. Which worked fantastically well - At 5 Euros pp each way - and they didn't charge for our youngest two. The drop off is a 10 minute walk to the hotel, or one metro ride. We only took hand luggage and the children managed fine pulling their cases behind them. Enjoy Barcelona and stay at Villa Emilia.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: losescoces
Reviews.Content: Really nice, confortable and very well run hotel. Staff are brilliant - nothing is too much bother for them. Having been stranded in Barcelona with the volcanic ash / air space closed chaos, the hotel were great - really helpful and looked after us well. Hotel is in a good area. Road is noisy with windows open but fine with them closed. Used by both tourists and locals. Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: r0b3rtp0rt3r
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for an Easter weekend break and we were very pleased overall with the quality of our stay. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to Placa Catalunya so most sites are easily accesible by metro. However, the local area around the hotel isn't quite as elegant as L'Eixample so be prepared to go a little further afield if you want to enjoy a good restaurant. The rooms are well kept and the Zinc Bar and terrace are nice spots to enjoy a drink or snack.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: Kip
Reviews.Content: Having read the numerous excellent reviews of this hotel on this site (and booked on the strength of them) we had high hopes for the quality of Villa Emilia. And it's fair to say that we weren't disappointed. The rooms were spotless, furnished in a modern contemporary style, the bathroom was similarly modern and had an brilliant shower. The beds were firm (but not overly so). The soundproofing of the balcony doors was excellent. Traffic noise instantly disappeared as soon as you closed them. The continental breakfast was the best we have had anywhere in europe, in terms of the quality and choice of the food on offer. It's in a very good location, walking to the Plaza Catalunya took about 15 mins max or 5 on the Metro, with the station only 50 metres away. Plaza Espanya (and the Montjuic area) is 10 mins walk the other way. We really appreciated the free tea, coffee and pastries every afternoon following a hard day's sightseeing. All in all, believe everything you read about this great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TartanD
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. I liked the location (we walked from the airport bus stop at Placa de Espanya) to the hotel only took about 10 minutes. I had requested an early check-in and a quiet room but was not sure arriving at 11.30am if the room would be available. Thankfully we were checked in right away which was great and were given Room 30 (which I knew from some reviews was a quiet room at the back of the hotel). I thought the room was very clean and spacious - the bed was 2 singles pushed together - slept very well ( I know some people mentioned the hard mattress's on the beds but I did not find that a problem). I loved the complimentary coffee and cakes - so welcoming after sightseeing all day. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel - there is a lovely bakery 2 minutes away and numerous cafes (look out for the ones that do not allow smoking). We used the underground a lot to get about and being so close to Rocafort station was excellent. We found the underground very clean,bright and easy to navigate. We ate locally to the hotel most evenings - Restaurante Namaste (Indian) and Amaltea (Vegetarian), we also walked down to La Bella Napoli (Fabulous pizza) one night and got the underground back. The roof terrace was lovely but unfortunately too cold to spend any time there, we always had a drink in the hotel bar which had a piano player some evenings and the bar staff were very friendly and there was a nice atmosphere. I would not hesitate to stay at Villa Emilia on my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and nice”
Reviews.Author: V12TwinTurbo
Reviews.Content: This was a first part of our honeymoon and the best trip of my entire life! We had been staying in Villa Emilia hotel for 4 day. It is very modern, clean and comfortable hotel with friendly, warm and helpful staff. The Hotel is well placed, in small quiet, not crowded street, not far from metro station and places of interests. Breakfasts were very tasty and deliciouswith freshly squeezed juices. The Hotel have a beautiful terrace at the roof. And it was fabulous to spend evenings drinking wine and relaxing after all day sighting. It is pleasure to stay in, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel, warm helpful staff, in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler002
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in Villa Emilia, spent several days in another part of Spain, and then returned for two more nights to the hotel. The hotel is contemporary and stylish- rooms are a good size and very clean. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. Staff at the bar/ restaurant were from many spanish speaking countries around the world, which we found interesting. The contential breakfasts (complete with terrific cafe con leche) were a pleasurable way to start the day. The location was good for walking around the city or for those who prefer, had easy access to the metro (perhaps a bit far from some of the typical sight-seeing areas for those who do not enjoy long-ish walks). This hotel was recommended by friends, and we would definately recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jbp19
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Villa Emilia in Barcelona. The hotel is in a great location, less than a 2 minute walk to the Rocafort metro stop, and just 5 minutes by metro to Placa de Catalunya. The hotel is located in a quiet, residential area with several restaurants close by, and even though our room was overlooking the street, there was little noise at all. The breakfast each morning was great--good selection of breads, cereals, meats, yogurts, juices--and even cava. The Zinc bar in the hotel lobby had great service, and had a cozy ambiance that was a great way to cap off a day of seeing the city. The rooms were very stylish in decor, and had ample storage space. The floor to ceiling windows opening to the street was a nice touch. Free in room wireless internet access was a definite plus. Very modern bathroom, with enough vanity shelf space. The only con is, as others have noted, the mattresses are a little hard, but I still slept just fine. The entire hotel staff was especially friendly and helpful from checking in to helping with the laundry service to arranging taxis. Would definitely staff here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, friendly, great location, clean”
Reviews.Author: kiki1l
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed our stay at the Villa Emilia hotel. Room was well appointed and despite being on a busy intersection the rooms were very quiet. Even was able to watch an English speaking channel on TV late at night. Only suggestion is to get better mattresses, as the ones there were too hard for both my friend and myself. For folks that like a hard mattress these are the beds for you. But overall I would still stay here again and recommend it to others. It is easy to get on the metro right around the corner and only a 5 min ride to the main station where you then can walk down the Ramblas or go to the seaport

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: markjhunter
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel! Very trendy bar and restaurant area when you enter the hotel with good food and reasonable prices for Barcelona. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great choice at breakfast! Rooms are very modern and clean with nice touches - really cool bathrooms with nice powerful shower, plenty of natural light in the rooms. I agree that the beds are slightly too firm but they still do the job. Nice roof terrace and you get complimentary internet access with free coffee and pastries late each afternoon!! Location is also very good - two stops out on the metro and the local neighbourhood is very good for Barcelona - never felt threatened and you can walk into the city in around 20 minutes if you want. Also just down the road from the aerobus stop to/from the airport. You definitely will not regret staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this hotel - will definately return”
Reviews.Author: vixen1978
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, just a 15 min walk from the centre and just a 2min walk from the nearest metro (rocafort). Staff were very pleasant made us cocktails to order. We were handed oodles of maps and guides on check-in together with free internet access for the duration of our stay. The free pastries & coffee daily (17:00 - 18:00) was a real trip after lots of sightseeing. We had dinner in the hotel resturant (Zinc Bar) again amazingly attentive staff, food was outstanding to, as was the choice of wine. The roof terrace was amazing, although we were there during the freak snow storms so didn't get chance to have enjoy the outdoor space, but can imagine its quite a gem during the warmer months. Although we've only just return we've thinking about returning in the summer, and I'd definately look to stay at Villa Emilia again.

Reviews.Title: “don't look further”
Reviews.Author: PLPelletier
Reviews.Content: We 've been there for 2 nights and we didn't been disappointed. Hotel is spotless, room are big and just well decorated (just what you need to be confortable). Team is profesionnal and not only : from the reception to the bar they really take attention to their guest. Breakfast is the ultimate experience : you can't imagine a better buffet, with amazing jam and a lot of choice. Hotel is well placed, anf they also propose reduction with garage next to the hotel. What can I say : as working in hotel in Paris, I can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money - Would return”
Reviews.Author: Brucie33
Reviews.Content: A 4 star hotel in the centre of Barcelona for £90 per night inc Breakfast. Excellent Value for money. Yes the Hotel is a little away from the main centre, but is less than 5 minutes walk from Rocafort Metro and from there only 3 stops from the centre of town. The rooms were very clean with great showers in the bathroom. The Beds are quite hard, but nothing too uncomfortable. We had a room at the back so had no issues with noise, so could be worth asking for a room here - either 20, 21 or 30, 31 etc...up to 60,61. The Breakfast was great , lots of choice with good coffee, and served in a really nice breakfast room until 11am. Bar prices fairly reasonable - 4 Euros for a large glass of wine and 2.50 for a Beer Staff were friendly enough, with the Bar staff standing out as the most friendly. The Weather was fair for us , we also managed to see the snowstorms which hit on Monday , but if the weather was a little warmer then the roof terrace was fantastic. Overall would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: mrcritique
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is a boutique hotel located in the L'Eixample district of Barcelona. It has a restaurant on the ground floor and is also the area in which breakfast is served. There is an internet area and afternoon coffee/tea/pastries floor on level 1, above the entry area/restaurant, that is a nice oasis after a long day of sightseeing. There are two computers with internet access and a sitting area with 4 or 5 tables in this space. There is also a comfortable sitting area on the roof with views of the nearby area. We stayed on the 6th floor. The room and bathroom was very clean, modern, smartly decorated and efficient. The wood floors unfortunately create some noise when moving furniture or when the lightweight beds get nudged. The beds are too hard, uncomfortable and unstable for my liking. Can you find something better in Barcelona, maybe. Barcelona is a noisy city that is somewhat contained by the modernity of the hotel. The problem many people in the hotel encountered was that the rooms were very warm and needed ventilation at night. To open the door style windows meant serious noise all night long from scooters, ambulances (there were several per night), and garbage trucks. We found ourselves opening and closing the windows several times each night to get some fresh air. There is also some room to room noise, some voices and banging cabinetry. The location is not optimum for shoppers or sightseers but is three blocks to the Aerobus stop to and from the airport and one block to the metro. There are many restaurants in the area and if you like to walk a city like I do, the location is central to many points of interest and therefore not a problem to get to by walking or metro. That said, the best thing about this hotel is the breakfast, the service, and staff. The staff is friendly, efficient, and accommodating. Especially in the Zinc bar and in the morning for breakfast. The buffet breakfast served hard boiled eggs, ham, prosciutto, brie, other cheeses, salmon, fresh juices, cereals, breads, yogurt, fresh varieties of marmalade, cream and chocolate filled pastries, coffee, Cava, and cappaccino. I'm sure I have left something out, but nonetheless a fabulously, tasty spread well worth the price. The sitting area is comfortable and has a pleasant fire going as well. In total, a very good, but noisy, stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveler33
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Trip Advisor. I chose it for location - convenient for my stay and for the descriptions. I also recommended it to my colleague who also booked here. It far surpassed our expectations. It is in on a quiet street, an easy walk from the airport bus stop at Plaza Espana and close to metro lines. The rooms are very nice - large, clean, modern, well-eqiupped, the staff is incredibly helpful, the food and breakfast and bar is good, above average. I've stayed in several hotels in Europe this last year and this one was by far the best. It's not in the absolute center of the Ramblas or El Born or Gracia, but it's very convenient. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good stay but that's it!”
Reviews.Author: dorkyr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel emilia for 4 nights.We were 2 couples and we chosed it because of its great reviews.The hotel is in a very good location for those who want a little distance from the noise of the center and yet not far away from the main attractions.The good points are the staff and the fact that the hotel is very clean.They always try to find answers to any request.The weak points are its rooms amenities (nearly the basics) ,the breakfast (poor with no variety) and the restaurant(we tried it twice).Especially the restaurant needs great improvement you can try something else and with better prices.If we will return in barcelona we might choose something else.P.S.VERY HARD BEDS

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff and good management”
Reviews.Author: cseikon
Reviews.Content: Great Location less than 1 mins walk to Metro station and on the L1 Red line. ( The most important Line for Metro). If you want to go to Plaza Espana it is only less than 7 minutes walk. The finishing for the hotel is great...not only looks good but choosing good product. All the front desk and restaurant /housekeeping staff which I dealt with are very helpful. I stayed there from Dec 28-Jan1st 2010 as the hotel delivered more than I expected services so I stayed with them again (Jan 7-10th)after my trip from Madrid. The only improvement I suggest to the management is upgrade the Wifi Services speed (is free but a bit slow). There are many hotels for you to choose in Barcelona but for the service, price, location which you can get from this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: evelyn02
Reviews.Content: hote emillal villa is very pleasant helpful staff, rooms too small

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: COSTAS21
Reviews.Content: a hide gem,close to metro station Rocaford(only 30metres).the location is perfect with many good restaurants(Casanova with reasonable prices for example 4persons pay only 40 euro,Ibiricum for local cuisine and perfect sangria.)the staff are very good and friendly(hello PABLO!).if you dont want to stay in la rambla and many other tourist traps,this is your hotel!Thanks for the pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “a great barcelona experience”
Reviews.Author: DublinLouiseireland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a lovely weekend in villa emilia with my boyfriend. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the barmen were very friendly. The rooms's are lovely and great shower facilities plus hairdryer and the works.No tea or coffee making facilities however cafes nearby which was handy.It's about a 20 min(10 if ur quick walker) walk to plaza catalunya which is a very central location.We enjoyed our walks,however not for high heels wearers!Its roughly 8 euro in a taxi at most. Perfect location if you are going to camp nou!And highly recommended to attend a match as part of experience of catalonia! Overall a fantastic weekend,i would recommend villa emilia to nayone and barcelona as a great city break!!! However anyone form ireland,only fly aerlingus as ryanair use girona airport an hour and half away!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: erica210
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept 2009 for 4 nights - it is clean, modern and in a residential area of town. Metro is one stop away very convenient (great deli on the way w. pastries and fresh squeezed OJ - perfect, cheap bfast). Nice to be out of the rush of the city center and not feel cramped by loads of tourists. Hotel room was large, clean and quiet. Ate at the bbq hosted by the hotel on the rooftop one night and it was excellent. The restaurant staff were very accommodating to late night cravings. There is no concierge and when asking the front desk for dinner suggestions they had nothing to offer. Thankfully there are free computers to use and I was able to find a place on my own (which turned out to be excellent - sorry forgot the name!) I'd definitely recommend this place. Especially if you get a great rate as I did ($130/ night)

Reviews.Title: “Like Returning Home”
Reviews.Author: JasonPeligro
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visited Barcelona in the summer and stayed at the Villa Emilia on that occasion. We returned for our anniversary in January and chose the same hotel due to our good experience the previous time. We weren't disappointed; the staff were very helpful and although the room we had stayed at previously wasn't available we were given the room underneath it so that we could has the same view. The room was clean and well maintained with a large screen TV showing a range of channels (BBC News was the only English language channel freely available). The bathroom was well stocked with a large walk-in shower. We chose not to have breakfast in the restaurant and used the local cafes of which there are many within 5 minutes walking distance. The only thing you should note is that cigarettes aren't banned so the cafes can have a smoky atmosphere. The hotel is heated during the winter with thermostats set to 23-25 degrees, coming from a British winter, we decided to turn the heating down in our room. Some of the more charming aspects of the hotel aren't as amenable in the winter; the roof-top cocktail bar wasn't open and the fading evening light wouldn't make it good lounging experience. There is, however, a very nice downstairs bar, with friendly bartenders and good selection of spirits. Overall this was another enjoyable stay and Villa Emilia will be the first place I'd chose if visiting Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in local neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: rpg55
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 5 night stay at Villa Emilia. Great little hotel a block from Metro, so you can get to anyplace in the city quickly. If you like to walk, the touristy part of town is about a 15 to 20 minute walk. Staff were great and very helpful. Near many restaurants and markets.

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: shingers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for new years eve and into the new year. This small hotel was tastefully decorated for the festivities in the lobby, which stretched round open plan into the bar and dining area The room was also nicely turned out with a walk in shower and efective double glazing, the only downside was the lack of air con ( turned of for the winter!) which, as the traffic noise stopped you leaving the window open, meant for a rather warm night. Not centrally located but 100m from the metro (very effective and cheap), so sightseeing around the city was no problem. Bar closed at 1am on new years eve which seemed strange as it was busy, but never the less enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: twil0805
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Villa Emilia and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff, particularly the bar and restaurant staff, were extremely friendly. It is a very stylish hotel with roomy and well-designed rooms. The hotel is a little distance from Las Ramblas but that is not a bad thing; there is a metro station adjacent to the hotel which provides easy access to all major tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: cannes101
Reviews.Content: I heard about Villa Emilia via a friend. He likes the hotel because its dog friendly. We were 3 couples staying there over New Years last week. The hotel is very charming, trendy and has an ok location. The rooms are quite spacious and we overall enjoyed our stay. Only a couple of things that did annoy us was that the AC was not working in the room. The room was “quite hot”. An average of 25.5 Celcius as marked in the elevator. When we called Front desk to ask how can we put the AC on, they explained that the entire hotel is not able to use it since we are in winter mode. Secondly on New Years Eve we wanted to have a drink in the lobby at 9pm before heading to the restaurant. There were around 6 employees just standing there waiting for their guests. When we asked for a drink they seemed distraught. Someone from the front desk came to explain to us that the bar is closed and can only focus on the restaurant. On the way back from the restaurant at 1am, we wanted to see if we could get a last drink. We were also told no. We found it quite ridiculous. Instead the staff went out to smoke. Is it really that hard to multi task ? My friends dryer was not working, she called FD and they told her they could only change it for her tomorrow. We had bfast during our stay at the hotel. The coffee looked funny (more water than coffee) during the 2 days we were there. When we brought it to their attention they seemed annoyed. Instead we asked for coffee made by the expresso machine. I guess its an option but they don’t advertise it. The hotel is nice but they are not VERY service minded.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spelios
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at Villa Emilia and had a very pleasant stay. The room was rather large to European standards, it was nice and clean. Even though not all of the staff spoke English or French, they tried their very best to help us. The hotel might not be in the very center of town, but we still found it in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - A little far out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: NY_BlueNyc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 nights at this hotel. It is truely a wonderful hotel, very modern, with a great bar & roof deck. It is however quite a way out from most of the attractions. For the first few days this was ok, but by the last day we were fairly exhausted of getting on and off subways to get everywhere (and we live in NYC!). There are plenty of good restaurants and tapas bars within a short walk of the hotel, so a few evenings we did spend in the area. Another big bonus is the 2 supermarkets on the new block. One is dingy little place, but it has bottles of water for 10 cents, so its well worth stocking up. Immediately next door to this is a much nicer supermarket, where we bought some snacks, and it also has a decent wine selection, with prices far chepaer than in the US, so stock your suitcase before heading home. In summary wonderful spot, perfect for 1-2 nights, but any longer than that you may want to look into a hotel in the Barrio Gotic

Reviews.Title: “Personal touches by staff, wonderful breakfast, rooftop deck is great.”
Reviews.Author: Denver_ColoradoPatsy
Reviews.Content: This fairly new hotel is well appointed with very nice, modern rooms which are wi-fi accessible. They also have two computers for free use by all patrons. The breakfast is well worth the extra money. It is close to a subway stop and in a lovely part of Barcelona. We stayed 3 nights before our cruise and then booked another night when we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: Dappealman
Reviews.Content: Cannot give enough praise to this hotel. Stayed at the VE for four nights. Meticulously maintained. Rooms were immaculate and never heard noises from others on the floor. Staff was very helpful and a pleasure to deal with. Special thanks to Manager Ferran who went out of his way to help us with a credit card issue. Breakfast was included and was sensational. Multiple meats, fruits, cheeses, juices, cereals, breads. Nothing truly negative to say about this hotel. Even the stairwell was high end! Only minor drawback is location, as nothing real exciting is around within a 5 min walk. However, the hotel is literally 100 yds from the metro and you can get anywhere you want within 15 minutes (1 transfer). Have stayed in many nice and this hotel is the best I've been to in Europe for the price. Outside of shelling huge $$$ for a true 5* hotel (like casa fuster), you cannot do any better. A hotel helps make or break the experience and the VE helped make Barcelona memorable trip. Thank you for the great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy, well located boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mountainportal
Reviews.Content: Nice muted toned decor with modern rooms and bath. A twenty minute walk to the old town quarter and the Rambla. In November, Barcelona had a warm weather front. The hotels air conditioning was already off for the season so we had a window open to the street. This was a bit noisy,especially in the early morning when delivery trucks arrived. We later moved to an interior room not facing the street and it was quiet. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Anneto
Reviews.Content: Stylish, clean hotel with helpful staff. Great bed and shower. Minus for the expensive breakfast (13 Euro, go to the delicatessen next door and get it for half the price) and some traffic noise in the rooms facing the street. Good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccably clean and elegant”
Reviews.Author: bahoombie
Reviews.Content: The room was perfectly clean and seemed brand new, with a very comfortable bed and an excellent shower. It was quite quiet, though I imagine rooms on lower floors are less so (we were on the 5th floor). The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel has a nice, snazzy bar with a piano player in the evening which attracts quite a few people. Free coffee and tea are served on a mezzanine overlooking the bar from 5-7 PM every day. There is also a very nice rooftop terrace (which we did not use – it was too cold out). The hotel is three metro stops, or a 15 minute walk, from Plaça de Catalunya. The only thing I could possibly complain about is that the Wifi (free) did not work very well. If I go back to Barcelona, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Seyahat_sever
Reviews.Content: The Hotel located centrally, near to attractions, quiet, near to public transport with a high quality of service and good restaurant. Everything you would like to have during a journey are available at the hotel. I would stay again and advise to everbody looking for a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jjwwww
Reviews.Content: I had a very annoying experience here. I had booked the hotel in August and had email conversation with staff about getting a room with a good view - which was confirmed. When we arrived in October they had since then taken a group booking, overbooked the hotel and moved us to another lesser hotel for one night. It was one of the worst starts to a holiday I have had. If the replacement hotel had been nice I could have got over it, but it wasn't. So I can't recommend this place even though I have to admit is was otherwise very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a lively neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BornTooLoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days in late 2009--one day before and one day after a cruise. The room was fine, except for an extremely eccentric shower that sent water onto the bathroom floor no matter what you did. The staff were all extraordinarily helpful and generous. Free internet in business center and a wonderful free coffee hour every afternoon with pastries. Metro stop nearby makes travel to any part of Barcelona pretty easy. Plenty of restaurants, bars, cafes, and convenience stores in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel with attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelfan57
Reviews.Content: Zen-like room with a large, modern bath. The Zinc Bar in the lobby is welcoming and the rooftop bar is tropical and relaxing. Everyone who worked in Villa Emilia was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with loads of character!”
Reviews.Author: donnainnapoli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for your money! The rooms and common areas are stylishly decorated, and the bar is fantastic. Great spot for a tasty cocktail. My only complaint is that the concierge were not very helpful. When we asked for restaurant or tapas suggestions, they pushed eateries they had flyers for.... The type of places that offer a free glass of sherry with dinner, which was definitely not what we were looking for. We referenced our guide books and fared well! Aside from that, the hotel was superb and I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “It's all True”
Reviews.Author: WeeJ
Reviews.Content: I know it's all been said before - I'll say it again though, this hotel is perfect for a city break. Foyer and hotel in general - great atmosphere funky vibe. Rooms - modern clean and comfortable. Staff - very helpful and genuinely warm people. Location - nice and quiet with enough shops and cafes just steps away - not a threatening area with metro station at the end of the street (5 mins to top of La Ramblas and the madness). Breakfast - superb, all you could want for and more. We stayed with our young daughter and got a triple room by contacting the hotel as suggested on their web booking form - inc breakfast a very reasonable rate for what you get. Free wi-fi kept my Ipod touch connected to the net at all times in the room - also free safe in the room. No kettle if you fancy a cuppa so take your own. Had lunch in the Zinc restaurant, very nice - didn't use the late afternoon coffee break but sounds good, we were just too busy out and about And you might get to meet nice Australians - we did. (Hope the rest of your trip was less eventful) All in all a fantastic little hotel that comes highly recommended. While it's not related specifically to the hotel I will add that Barcelona demands that you keep on your guard - have a look at the forum for good advice and have a great break at the Villa Emilia.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault a single thing”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidaysNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this place, clean, stylish, bar staff/reception couldn't have been more helpful, the pianist in the bar several evenings was really special touch, the rooms were lovely with everything we needed, it was quiet, and just what the doctor ordered after every busy day we had in Barcelona. Don't hesitate with this one - book it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and stylish....”
Reviews.Author: Eveonholiday
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in Barcelona and our hotel was lovely. Our room was on the 5th floor which meant very little noise from the streets below. The room was stylish and comfortable with a safe and mini bar thrown in and loads of storage. No iron in the room, but we took one anyway so wasn't bothered. There is a hair dryer and a small selection of bathroom freebies. I particularly liked the towels, soft fluffy and a good size. The bathroom was without a bath, but the shower was lovely if a bit slippery when wet. My only suggestion for improvement would be a full length mirror in the room. (A must for us ladies....) Breakfast was plentiful with cava if you fancied a bucks fizz in the morning. There's a lovely terrace on the roof, where you can finish your evening in style. (We were there in late October and still managed it with a cardi on). The hotel is away from the main attractions (about 30 mins walk from Las Ramblas), but the metro is about 50 metres away, so it wasn't a problem. Get a weekly ticket, as you will definitely save money, Fares are a flat rate at 1.35 euros. We particularly enjoyed our complimentary afternoon tea with a selection of cakes and pastries. It provided a great opportunity to plan your evening's entertainment with the internet thrown in for free. All in all, a very nice place to stay, with excellent service. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is at the top of its game”
Reviews.Author: judgesully
Reviews.Content: Recently spent three nights at Villa Emilia on our first trip to Barcelona. We could not have been more pleased with our choice of Hotel Villa Emilia. We first spent a week or so touring the French Riviera and arrived in Barcelona needing a restful interlude. This place fit the bill perfectly, from the sleekly modern and well-appointed rooms to the solicitous staff who met our needs at every turn. Located in a quiet section along the Gran Via filled with young and old alike, with the right mix of residential and commercial, but close enough to the tourist sites to make traveling to them a snap. There is no question that we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a single complaint. LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aimeed821
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Villa Emilia for 5 days this month and loved every second of it. This hotel is one of the best we've stayed in - in Europe or in the US. The rooms are not huge or overly luxurious, but they are certainly spacious enough, impeccably clean and very bright and modern. It actually felt more like an apartment than a hotel room, which was so nice. The bed was comfortable, the shower was great and we especially loved the doors that opened up on to the street below. In addition to enjoying the room we also took advantage of other things the hotel had to offer- namely the beautiful rooftop terrace- great for a post sight seeing cocktail. We also enjoyed the chic hotel bar and the coffee/pastries offered to hotel guests from 5-7 on the first floor. Yum. The hotel staff was also excellent. The front desk was always very helpful with any needs we had and the bar staff was a pleasure as well. The location may not be the best for some people- it is a little out of the way from all of the touristy spots, but for us that was not a problem. The hotel is just a block away from a metro stop and three stops away from the center of Barcelona, which took no more than 10 mins to travel (probably less). Taxis were a quick trip as well. We actually enjoyed coming home in the evening to a quieter setting. I really can't say enough about this gem of a hotel. We really felt like we got a lot of bang for our buck (or Euro) and would 100% stay here should we find ourselves back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AbbieNormal4
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 5 nights while visiting Barcelona. I always prefer to stay in small, friendly boutique hotels and Villa Emilia fit the bill perfectly. The decor is sleek and modern, yet warm and inviting. Our room was on the second floor, with 3 large windows facing the street. Substantial chocolate floor to ceiling drapes could be pulled across the windows at night, completely blocking the lights and noise. We had no trouble sleeping until 10am several mornings. We requested and received a Twin room, which consisted of two twin beds adjacent to each other, but made up separately. This was quite comfortable for two people not wanting to share a single bed. The bathroom was clean and spacious. I was given a password to connect to the wireless network which worked in our room throughout our stay. The entire staff was very helpful and pleasant at all times. We did not opt for the hotel breakfast, but we did have coffee in our room several times, which was delivered promptly. After a day of sightseeing we would stop by the Zinc Bar for a cava, and the bartenders could not have been friendlier. It was warm enough in the evening to enjoy the cozy rooftop bar. We checked out the night before leaving, asking for a wakeup call at 7:30, coffee at 8, and a taxi at 8:30. All were delivered with precision. The hotel is located in a nice residential part of the city, just a block away from the Rocafort metro stop and a 10 minute walk from Plaza Cataluna. I guess it depends on what you are looking for, but I personally felt more at ease staying in this friendly neighborhood of young professionals walking their dogs and old couples strolling arm in arm to the Tango Club or out for some Tapas than in the midst of the tourist district where one is told to constantly be on guard for thieves. Most days we enjoyed the walk into town and back. It rained on our last day so we took the Metro into the Barri Gotic, which took less than 10 minutes. We walked to and ate at several nice restaurants in the neighborhood, including La Clara which is right around the corner on Gran Via Corts Catalanes and La Flauta which is 8 blocks away on Carrer D'Aribau (or 2 blocks from the Universitat metro stop). We tried to get in to the "hot spot" tapas bar Inopia which is 5 blocks away on the intersection of Rocafort and Tamarit, but they were no longer seating people when we arrived at 10:45pm. I would not hesitate to recommend this wonderful hotel to anybody looking for a great place to stay away from the crowds but convenient to everything. I will definitely choose it again when I return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Villa Emilia”
Reviews.Author: macchiozabka
Reviews.Content: i tend to prefer boutique hotels over larger corporate hotels because of the more personal service and the attention to detail. hotel villa emilia did not disappoint. the room was immaculate and the bed & linens were extremely comfortable. the decor is very modern and tastefully done. we had drinks one night on the beautiful rooftop terrace (best mojitos), don't miss it. the only downside (which isn't a big deal) was there was no internet/wifi access in the rooms, but villa emilia made up for it with free internet service in their business center.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GAB1981
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona in September and stayed at Hotel Villa Emilia for 4 Nights. As someone who is very picky about where they stay - I have to say I couldn't fault the hotel. The decor is lovely and stylish, the room was great - clean and modern, the roof terrace is an absolute must. The staff were really helpful and friendly. The only slight downside was that it is a 15 - 20 minute walk from Ramblas. However I would definitely stay here on my return to Barcelona. If you're in any doubt about staying here - don't, book now!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: hollykerry
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from the centre. Lovely peaceful great staff go out of the way to help.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, location not perfect but close enough to the sites”
Reviews.Author: JTraveler0000
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Villa Emilia. While the location isn't perfect, the hotel itself is beautiful! Amenities - They have free wifi (although it was a bit spotty, it was nice to have) and they have computers to use free of charge on the first floor if you dont want to travel with your laptop. They provide coffee, tea and pastries between 5 and 7pm, and they have an amazing rooftop bar where you can grab a drink and snack before you head out to dinner. Rooms - The rooms are nicely decorated, very clean, and a decent size. The beds were also surprisingly comfortable. And we had doors that opened to a mini balcony which provided us with some fresh air which was nice. The bathrooms were modern, but I have two complaints. 1) There is no door on the shower so water tended to get everywhere and 2) There is a sliding door to the bathroom that doesn't do much to control noise, so you can hear EVERYTHING your travel partner does in the bathroom. Location - We tend to walk everywhere and while it was only a 20-30 min walk to La Rambla, it was still a bit farther than i would have liked. Especially since the area around the hotel didn't have too much going on. But there are a couple of metro stations closeby and you can easily take a cab for very little money to where you want to go. Overall I highly recommend this place and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all regards.”
Reviews.Author: backseatflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night pre cruise. Very comfortable room, friendly helpful staff and a very good meal in the restaurant that evening. We will return for a longer stay to 'do' Barcelona before long. Oh, there is also a nice rooftop bar for balmy evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ATLWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Emilia for a week with my partner. I arrived in Barcelona from Atlanta early morning and was at the hotel around 10:00 am. At first, the girl at the front desk said it might be a few hours before they could check me in to a room. Thirty minutes later, while I was still having breakfast at the lobby restaurant, she came to me with the keys. Throughout my stay, service was that good. The staff was friendly and eager to help with advice and directions. In a city where very few people speak English, this came especially handy. My room on the 6th floor had a nice French window view of the street intersection. The room was decent size, but I would not call it spacious. Also, the phone had no markings on it, which made it a bit hard to figure out how to call front desk. And when I called for the wireless Internet password, they asked me to come down to pick it up. But honestly these are the only things that come to mind where the room and service were less than perfect. We absolutely loved the rooftop bar, which became like our own hangout in Barcelona. Also, both Catalunya and Espanya squares and the Metro were within a few minutes walking distance. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Villa Emilia”
Reviews.Author: Emappeal
Reviews.Content: Marvelous rooftop terrace; modern, romantic hotel with comfortable bed. Villa Emilia helped to make our trip to Barcelona like a dreamy honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, meticulously clean”
Reviews.Author: RestlessTourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my 12 years old daughter for a week and we enjoyed the friendly staff, its good location (close to the Rocafort metro station) and clean room. The room and bathroom were always clean and smelled fresh. Excellent toiletries (soap, shampoo...) and nice patio on the roof. Breakfast is very good as well. We stayed on a relatively hot week, and it was somewhat annoying that elevators and corridors were not air conditioned (no problem in the room and public areas like lobby and dining area), but this is probably the only issue I can recall. Also it was nice to have complementary internet connection and afternoon coffee break, although you'd better spend the time visiting Barcelona...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lollipop81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over a long weekend and I couldn't really fault it. I loved the roof terrace and the rooms were so clean!! Would definitely recommend to anyone who is thinking of going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: PDXdoug
Reviews.Content: Great location. Quiet yet close to everything. One block from Rocafort Metro stop, 12 minute walk to the Placa de Catalunya and La Rambla. Rooftop Terrace provide a pleasant refuge for 'siesta' time or a nightcap. Room was very comfortable with wireless internet and a bit of a view.

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend this hotel to anyone/any friend.”
Reviews.Author: AllanFrance
Reviews.Content: We found that the reviews for this hotel were totally accurate. We liked the friendly atmosphere and the music in the reception/bar area. The location was excellent as it was out of the noisier areas and was very close to Metro access. The room was fine and there is no problem with "water poring onto the floor from the shower" as reported by others. The staff are excellent and provide good advice for dining,etc. We recommend a visit to the Bohemic bistro accessed at bohemicbistro.com(only for reservation or info). The rooftop bar is excellent and prices are very reasonable. We avoided the expensive buffet breakfst and found that great value was to be had at "Casova's" only 2 steps away with great coffee(ask for Cafe Americano for regular coffee) and excellent pastries,etc. This place also has very nice lunches. For cheaper drinks try Cafe Luna, just down the street. For a new drink taste treat try "Pacheran", a anise flavoured liqueur. All in all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good service”
Reviews.Author: cmfc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Trip Advisor reviews and agree with most of the comments: particularly good service on the reception; clean, attractively modern rooms and public areas, good location and nice rooftop bar for evening drinks, small Spa shop opposite for basic needs and near to metro. Good and quick laundry service. Good for someone on business or sightseeing. One or two quibbles: the bathroom looked fantastic and the towels were super, but because of the design it was impossible to shower without flooding the whole room; bedside lights were too weak and low to read by. Small things but sufficiently annoying to make it uncomfortable to stay for more than one or two nights. However these were all in the design of the rooms, not in the service, which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelindan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Attentive staff, nice rooms, check out the roof after 7:00 pm for drinks and hor'derves. Within walking distance to many great attractions, restaurants, tour bus stops, and the metro. A mostly quiet location. We did hear a neighborhood disco on Saturday night only, but otherwise a quiet night and the mornings in Barcelona don't start until 8:30. Very little traffic or noise until 8:30. My wife greatly appreciated that. Great value all in all.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: gulas
Reviews.Content: Hotel was exceptionally clean and deserving of it's 4 star rating. Could not fault the food. Roof top terrace bar was an added attraction. Very quiet location but close to centre.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: tea_please
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a really nice place and your made to feel welcome as soon as you walk through the door. I really cant fault this place, look its not 5 star but it doesnt pretend to be, its really hard to place it but its like youve wrapped up malmaison, hotel de vin and a cool ibiza hotel and placed it in Barcelona. Thing is with Barcelona your not far from anything and this hotel is one minute walk down to the metro and you can get anywhere. your only a few seconds from a bug super market as well for all your water chocolate stocking, as the hotel isnt cheap on the bar but where is with the euro pound thing. the breakfast is ok and high qaulity at the hotel and not bad in price but if your a coffee in the morning - just pop across the road the cafe and its 2 euros. One thing of note is that if your offended by same sex couples this may not be the hotel for you. When on the wonderful terrace roof bar in the hotel (its a heaven up there after a day in town), my partner and i were treated to the view of a snogging session by a couple of men. No issues but like i say if your offended maybe this isnt the place for you. But the asset to this hotel is not its allright design and comfy rooms but the staff. There was a stunning girl on reception who just couldnt help you enough and a brilliant guy there who was a complete insiders guide to Barcelona. Everyone there was awesome and i will be using this hotel in the future for many trips over the football season. so try the hotel if only for a night in Barcelona you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel for a short city break.”
Reviews.Author: DavidandAnneGrimsby
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night break. The hotel is well located about half way between the Placa d'Espana and the Placa de Catalunya. There is a metro station at the end of the block but we preferred to walk and it took us a leisurely 10 minutes to the Placa de Catalunya and the top of Las Ramblas. The hotel is very well appointed - modern and very well decorated throughout. A particular feature is the roof terrace which manages to provide a peaceful oasis in the middle of the bustling city. The bar on the terrace is staffed in the evenings but there is an intercom to the bar main bar downstairs and the staff are excellent - taking orders and arriving with drinks very quickly. Another nice touch is the provision of free tea/coffee and small pastries between five and seven in the evenings on the first floor lounge. Breakfast, whilst not extensive, is of a very high standard including the usual continental fare but with the best coffee I have drunk abroad in addition to white wine or Cava. We didn't eat in the hotel apart from breakfasts, preferring to choose from the vast variety of small cafes/bistros/restaurants/bars all easily available. If you can't find somewhere to suit your tastes in Barcelona then stay at home and eat ready prepared supermarket food! Our favourite was the boat in Port Vell serving drinks and tapas (even though the meat balls lasted well into the following day!) The Villa Emilia staff we found to be very friendly and helpful. Some spoke only a limited amount of English (but why should they speak more as they speak Catalan as well as Spanish which is more than most people can manage). They are very patient and the reception staff speak English very well indeed. The whole place is sparklingly clean and appears to be very well cared for with no chipped and scuffed paintwork to be found. The bed was a little on the hard side of firm and there was only just sufficient clothes storage space. The bathroom was very well designed and the quality of the towels was very good. The double glazing is excellent - the city can be noisy even at night which we enjoyed - but when the double glazed widows are closed the noise of the city virtually disappears. Overall, the hotel is a superb location for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Blip....”
Reviews.Author: jlocko
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Hotel Emilia, I chose it based on positive reviews, it niggled me because I just don't think it was worth the money. Rooms were great but the service was far from polished. i was emailed and asked to let them know what I we would be arriving as it was our 10th wedding anniversary and they wanted to make sure the room was ready with wine etc. Which I did and arrived to vary nearly on time, so why were we kept in reception for 40 mins waiting for our room to be sorted, I dont really mind that, but would have been nice to be offered a complementory drink etc (and there was no wine waiting in the room!). We ate at the hotel that evening, not worth the money for a few kebabs of lamb!, took three attempts to get Assam tea, first got peppermint, then green.. until I took the waiter to the tin which said cunningly 'Assam' on it. Breakfasts were ok, continental style, 6 emply jam jars(no refilled), no butter (run out), differently labeled teas in a tray that were actually all the same tea!... had sort ourselves out with cutlery while the staff watched, small things these may be, but not from a 4 star boutique hotel. We actually thought, language barriers aside, that the waiter staff were a little clueless, particulary those in the mornings. Maybe it's me... but I came away with a sense of disappointment. Poor show Hotel Emilia. However, Barcelona is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel in Barcelona, great location, cordial and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LionelNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest small hotel in Barcelona. Architectural layout, bathroom fixtures and amenities in most rooms are the best for a memorable visit, and much better than I expected. Very quiet. Subway on corner, three short subway stops from main square and LaRambla which was more crowded and noisy this past Saturday than Times Square in New York City. The staff are always helpful and considerate of your needs. For Americans visiting Barcelona there are no bargains because of the Euro conversion rate. Don't contemplate shopping in Europe. The bargains and quality items are to be found for everything in the USA. Barcelona is a beautiful city because of great city planning at the end of the 19th Century. The Hop-On-Hop-Off busses cover the city in three loops (red, blue and green) costs 21 Euros for one day or 27 for two days, covering all. I was warned twice by strangers to beware of pick-pockets and chain snatchers. I fought-off one pickpocket as I entered a subway car. His hand got tangled in the wires of headphones that were in my pocket. Have a good time in Barcelona; its worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: havingfuntraveling
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay for two nights. The terrace upstairs a great place to unwind. Good location, better than stated in other comments. We love to walk, most sights within a 30 to 40 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ginmint
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was excellent! I chose it based on the glowing reviews and we were not disappointed. We'll definitely stay here again when we're in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: GaryCopford
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from Barcelona and have had such a fantastic time with Partner and Friends. I picked the Villa Emilia after as usual using Tripadvisor and was not disapointed at all. A 4 Star hotel in a great location, Rooms were perfect, Food fantastic and to top it off the roof garden was just what was required after a day trooping around. Only down side was no Tea or Coffee in room and no pool, but I am sure one of those can be fixed by the Management. When writing about a hotel all one needs to really know is " would you recommend it to your best mate"? the answer without thinking is yes. Go for it on your next trip to Barcelona, I know we will.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and comfortable in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lizzy2005
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend at the Villa Emilia and were pleased with our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were stylishly appointed, yet simple. The bathroom was spacious and clean. The location was good; just a short metro ride to all the major attractions. The hotel has a live band on the terrace during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Garnaal
Reviews.Content: Much as already been stated before but here it goes: Rooms were nice, adequate space, modern design. Really enjoyed the breakfast and the additional afternoon coffee break. Staff was very very friendly. Location was also ideal, relatively quiet urban neighbourhood, only 2 metrostops from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “"Brilliant"”
Reviews.Author: Muffty40
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 day stay at the Villa Emilia. It was an excellent experience. We found the location fine, Metro just 100 yards away, we are both 'getting on' in years but we walked everywhere without aproblem. The hotel is of the highest quality all furnishings being of top quality and the service second to none. The staff are most helpfull and courteouse at all times going out of their way to be friendly to patrons. Especially Pablo. A truly memorable experience. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and classy boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oznini
Reviews.Content: Modern design and decor and very relaxing atmosphere. Very friendly and helpful staff who speak good English. Good location only 2 minutes walk to metro station. Quiet room with good soundproof windows. Very comfortable beds and big bathroom. Nice roof terrace but without a pool it's too hot in summer. The food at the restaurant is great and the breakfast was included in our deal. Very good value for money. Next visit will go back there for sure. Only 15-20 minutes drive from airport by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Hotel off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: Navigation99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was modern and clean. The queen bed was very comfortable. Good bathroom except the walk in shower can create a small flood if you’re not careful. The street noise is minimal when the windows are closed. The rooms have a safe which is a plus. The hotel is three years old so everything is new and modern. It’s located away from the city center in a residential area. The Rocafort metro stop is only a block away. The metro system is great. I recommend buying a T-10 card (8 Euros for Zone 1) if you plan on using the metro to get around Barcelona. The hotel restaurant is expensive and the meal was small. I didn’t try the buffet breakfast. There is a place down the street that sells coffee and pastries. There are two computers with free internet access on the second floor. They serve free coffee and pastries at 5PM in the same location. The roof top terrace is a nice place to relax after sight seeing. The lobby bar is a good place to have a drink but by no means is it a “hotspot” which could be a good thing or a bad thing. Overall good experience. It’s a quiet, small, clean hotel off the beaten path with helpful staff. I expected a little more amenities with the four star rating. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Contemporary Hotel With No Hidden Extras”
Reviews.Author: oxonpaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and found the hotel easily within 20mins walk of Barcelona Sants train station. The hotel is not in the main tourist area but is only 5 mins from the nearest underground station. Being only 2-3 yrs old the hotel is very modern and immaculate with a nice ground floor bar/restaurant, a business suite on the first floor offering free coffee every day between 5 and 7pm and a beautiful rooftop terrace. Up her they do a bar-b-q every Monday and Thursday but you need to book as we arrived Thursday and they were full. The rooms are lovely and modern, we had asked for a high floor to avoid traffic noise and it was fine. Howvever you do hear the noise from the corridors and there were some very noise guests nearby. Wifi is free which is a nice touch and nothing was too much trouble. Overall an excellent choice and one which I'd totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers Of Catalunia”
Reviews.Author: halifaxbmw44
Reviews.Content: After e mails & phone calls confirming adjoining rooms(parents& kids) arrived with kids for city stay here on recommendation by tripadvisor ratings. Room request completely ignored and assurances of swift remedies complete hot air . Checked out after one night despite offer of free night which was subsequently charged for without our authorisation and is now in dispute with Visa. Our problem aside -small cramped rooms with no outlook whatsoever. Restaurant v mediocre and foyer /reception area trying to double up as a bar. When we made our points to the manager he responded by telling us that he was in the process of sacksacking the reception staff for incompetence - great to know when they just ruined a family trip! The idea of this place being described as either 4 star or 'boutique hotel ' could only exist in the minds of the proprietor ! He must have little experience of either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - lovely roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: JessieLeeds
Reviews.Content: My boyfrined and I stayed here for 4 nights for our first trip to Barca and thoroughly enjoyed our stay - lovely hotel, friendly staff, excellent spacious rooms & en suites plus the roof terrace was lovely setting for a relaxing drink at the end of a hard days sightseeing. Plus was very romantic!! Its about a 20-30 minute walk to Las Ramblas with various shops/bars nearby. Breakfast was brilliant with everything you could want from a continental breakfast and i would definitely stay in this lovely hotel again and recommend it to anyone who needed a charming base to explore Barcelona from.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: flo_london
Reviews.Content: just back from staying three nights at the Emilia. We had a 'Crazy Summer Offer' from their website which was 3 nights B&B (price descending after first night), plus a bottle of wine, which was incredibly good value. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Our room was a decent size and was nicely decorated. We loved the walk-in shower and the complimentary toiletries! We didn't eat in the restaurant, but we mainly had breakfast indoors bar the last day when we ate on the roof terrace. The food was really fresh and there was plenty to choose from. The roof terrace was also a draw! The location being out of the main 'tourist' areas of Barcelona was quiet, but we actually preferred being slightly out of the thick of it. The metro station was a short walk away as was Place D'Espanya (airport bus), so we found it really easy to get around. We would definitely come back here and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but a couple of let-downs”
Reviews.Author: Hackers1972
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, modern, clean. Bathroom was excellent with walk-in shower and modern design. The roof terrace was good, Jazz trio playing in the background. Take my advice, get a day ticket for the nearby Metro at Rockfort, just a couple of minutes away for around 6 Euros for unlimited travel, its vital to get around as you are slightly out of the centre of the city in more of a residential area. The downside was a series of gaffes by the staff who seemed overstretched. This was disappointing as they were clearly nice people and willing to help. We ate in the hotel, the portions were extremely small, overpriced and my wifes Cod was raw in the middle. On the roof terrace they could not make our chosen cocktail because a machine had broken, then they ran out of glasses to serve us a beer. All small things of course, these things happen, but it let down what was otherwise a great experience. Despite this I would recommend this Hotel and would certainly consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Mihai_Ureche
Reviews.Content: We was just married and this was are honeymoon trip. We staid there for 9 nights. The hotel is well located near a Metro station (no more then 3 min walk). It have a very nice open terrace were we served a barbeque lunch with delicious dishes that I recommend for every body that get there. The stuff was helpful every time we need it. The rooms are medium size but very nice designed inside, nice furniture, nice baths. It was grate to stay there and we will come back

Reviews.Title: “Chep boutique hotel removed from the center”
Reviews.Author: mzz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and has a modern design but is located in an area that does not look good and there is noting to do near by. It is located next to a Metro station-so if you like to use the very humid no A/C metro system in Barcelona-you will be OK. In addition, the hotel stuff were uninterested and unhelpful on several occasions..

Reviews.Title: “Chic and neat spot”
Reviews.Author: Boston_empty_nesters
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, absolutely immaculate and cared-for. Residential location with many local restaurants, metro stop at next block. Quiet location, 20 minute walk to Placa Catalyuna or a quick metro ride. Apparently quite new or newly redone, reminds me of a small W Hotel. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Neat and Tidy”
Reviews.Author: Jp_Oneill
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed for several nights over our 20th Wedding anniversary so we wanted more of a grown ups' hotel rather than one for young families. We got exactly that. The Hotel is comparitively small, i guess bijou was a word once used and is very clean and tidy furnished to a more modern design. We were on the 6th floor, the rooms were cleaned every day and done well , sound proofing seemed excellent as was the Air Con which worked well. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and as with most places you get out what you put in. The food from the restaurant was probably the best we had in Barcelona, and provided at exceptional value. So in terms of the hotel i really can't fault it. It terms of location then it depends on what you want as its not directly on top of the tourist attractions it being located a few minutes up the road from Rocafort Metro. That has its advantages as its fairly well located to some of the interesting places away from the Town Center such as Monjuic , However its going to take 15 - 20 Mins, to get to the Metro and then on to areas such as the Ramblas , Gothic Quarter or the Port areas. Personally we like walking and exploring so it was actually better to be slightly out of the mainstream areas and was a bit quieter as well. All In all for our first Visit to Barcelona it helped make a fantastic impression and i would not hesitate to recommend

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Haven in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ursie
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel 2 minutes walk from Rocafort Metro station. Spotlessly clean, excellent staff. A few people mentioned problems with air conditioning before, but ours worked perfectly. Lovely clean bathroom with great shower. Very quiet at night. Comfy bed. Mini bar in room. A few nice touches we liked were free internet on second floor, free tea/coffee and crossaints from 5pm - 8pm. Grand piano in the main bar with a pianst playing each night. Lovely roof top terrace bar over looking the city. There was nothing we could fault. We would definately stay here again & would 100 percent recommend to our friends. In fact, my sister is going there this September!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Visit Again”
Reviews.Author: seattlesb
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time during our week long stay at Villa Emillia. Large room. Great service. We plan to stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: SunSeeker13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the funkiest we have stayed at. The decor is lovely, the service impeccable, the location great. And our dinner was excellent too!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Keryn-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Very large rooms, modern, clean, quiet, what more do you need? great breakfast included in the price, 3 small blocks walk to the Metro. friendly reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pingping_pong
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. First of all, thanks for all the comments previously posted here, they were extremely helpful. Overall the hotel is stylish, clean, spacious, quiet and new. Everything was good - couple of things worth mentioning: We had no problem with the water pressure in the shower, it worked very well, probably fixed since the last complaints were filed. We also had no problem with the air-con, which as we understand, were only turned on in summer (mid june onwards). The air-con was centrally controlled, and I have doubts as to whether the individual adjustment of temperature in the room had any impact. But that wasn't a problem as the air-con was certainly cool enough for the summers. We asked for a room facing the back of the building, and had no problem with noise at all (even though I admit I am particularly sensitive to noise). There're only 3 of those rooms on each floor, so be sure you asked for one beforehand if you want a quiet night's sleep.
