There's a roof terrace on the 7th floor, so not sure if rooms on the 6/F would be affected by noise from the terrace if there are parties (our room was on 5/F which had no problem with that). But the terrace is closed from 1 AM onwards so again that shouldn’t be a problem as you're unlikely to sleep earlier than 1 AM in spain anyway. Cold breakfast was sumptuous and delicious. Location is great, we had a 3-day travel pass, and it took us everywhere around barcelona from the hotel through metro (nearest stop from hotel is Rocafort, 3 min walk) in short time (to the main tourist areas just a few stops away, very convenient). It's not situated at the most touristy areas like La Ramblas but that's a plus for us, as we want a quiet room - and in any case, the hotel is just a short distance from all the tourist destinations by metro. Staff at the counter was helpful and speaks fluent english. The room has a working safe deposit box, highly recommend you use it for holding valuable documents before roaming around barcelona. The design of the room makes it very warm - warm lighting, the light coloured and wooden furniture, the wooden floor. The H2O toiletries were very soothing, esp the shower gel. The lobby is stylishly designed, hip. There are two computers which you can use for free, again that’s a bonus. The minor drawbacks- there is no glass pane or curtain that prevents water from flooding into the bathroom floor when you shower. But that was a minor problem, compared to all the other great things about the hotel. Also, most rooms are twin-bedded rather than with double beds, and all rooms facing the back are with twin beds. Also, warning re all hotels in spain - no kettle is provided. No parking spaces. To and from airport - around 30 euros taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Adored this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: steph246
Reviews.Content: A beautifully elegant yet 'cool' hotel with perpetually happy and helpful staff. My partner speaks a little Spanish, but all the staff spoke English fluently so he didn't get the chance to try. The bed was comfortable with plenty of room around it, the bathroom was huge and everything was spotlessly clean and appeared to have been newly decorated just for us! We particularly enjoyed the complimentary early evening coffee & pastries on the mezzanine as a welcome pause between sightseeing and finding dinner. And the proximity of the Metro stop, just a few paces from the door, was ideal. I never did find out what the delicious scent in the lobby, corridors and lifts was, but it became our 'homecoming' ritual to breathe it in and relax as we entered our hotel! And do take the time to sit back and listen to the pianist of an evening if he is still there - the drinks are a bit pricey but the ambience makes them worth it. We would both definitely return to the Villa Emilia if we visited Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “High quality design and comfort and not posh!”
Reviews.Author: lucarotterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa Emilia for an extended weekend and had a very good experience during my stay. The hotel is very well taken care of and the staff is helpful. Design and products offered in the room are of excellent quality and carefully chosen. On the top of all (literally) there is the terrace with bar services and comfy lounge chairs - a nice place to stay during the "siesta" or when relaxing between touristic attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Motivated enough to recommend on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: NKT09
Reviews.Content: As per all the other reviews, Villa Emilia is a rare hotel in that it gets just about everything right. The service and rooms I wouldn't fault - one of those hotels you look forward to returning to at the end of each day. The location may turn some off, but the Metro in Barcelona is so easy to use that the rooms and service far outweigh what you might get at the 'touristy' areas...

Reviews.Title: “I Want To Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: KeptMan
Reviews.Content: Eternally smiling staff and a hip, comfortable feel that I just can't explain! I would definitely stay here again. Pros: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff, trendy but not over-done design, cozy roof-top terrace, very clean, great A/C, 1 block from metro, outside the tourist zones but still close to so much, GREAT value for money. Cons: Outside the tourist zones (a good thing for me), bar food was a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: minipenne
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and really enjoyed it - great A/C, free internet, so close to a Metro stop. There is not a ton of stuff open right around the hotel at night, so we generally took the Metro. We went to a jazz club on a Sunday night and were surprised to find the Metro had stopped running. We walked 1.5 miles back at 1 a.m. For that reason, we would probably choose to stay closer to Placa de Catalunya if we returned to Barcelona. We ordered room service once which was a bit of a disaster. I'd recommend going next door to Casanova's (a cute market) instead.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we were in a spa”
Reviews.Author: happytravels98
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia was an excellent hotel, would stay again without question!! As soon as I walked in the employees greeted me with a friendly smile and hello. The hotel is modern and boutique like. Our room was comfortable and relaxing. The rooftop lounge had a fantastic view and was relaxing while eating a pastry and enjoying the quiet after an exciting afternoon of sight seeing. The hotel is located minutes from a metro stop and very near Las Ramblas. The staff was great to us. We were trying to organize an activity and they assisted us without question. They even recommended a local restaurant when we were looking for assistance.

Reviews.Title: “perfect - as expected!”
Reviews.Author: PGV
Reviews.Content: We booked into Villa Emilia after reading the trip adviser reviews - and we were not disappointed! It is everything that the other reviews have said. Great location - at a metro stop and a walkable distance to both Placa de Catalunya and the majic fountains... Trendy boutique style. Had complimentary coffee on arrival and found the staff most helpful. Would go back again tomorrow... if only!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Boutique style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emailit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Villa Emilia in Barcelona for 4 nights in March. I would recommend it to anyone. It is a very modern and stylish hotel with a distinct boutique style abience. Good sized, light and airy clean rooms. Helpful English speaking staff were available to help us on arrival and departure. The rooftop terrace is a nice space and the small bar on the groundfloor offers the opportunity to grab a relaxing drink before hitting the pillow at the end of a busy day sightseeing in Barcelona. The complimentary afternoon refreshments are a nice touch - lovey fresh pastries available as well as tea and coffee. Although the Hotel is a little further out of town than some it can be walked comfortably in 20-30mins with plenty to see en-route. During the evenings, to save time, we found it easier to take the metro. The nearest metro stop is a 1 minute walk from the hotel which will get you into the centre of town in minutes. All considered the Hotel Villa Emilia is in a good location, and has a great deal going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: RealMcKay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in May. Excellent hotel, friendly staff and very helpful all round. Would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: Gourmetbella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Villa Emilia in Barcelona one night in May 2009. Its a modern hotel - nicely decorated and with spacious and clean rooms. The hotel has english speaking staff. They are friendly but not as serviceminded as you could wish for in a 4-star hotel. The roofterrace is a nice place, allthough without a pool. Would be nice to cool down in the heat. The hotel is pretty centric - if you have good shoes its in walking distance to Placa Catalonia. The breakfast consists of bread (also dark) , croissants, ham, cheese, spanish ham, yoghurts, cereals, freshsqueezed juice and coffee. All in all a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pha123
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this wonderful hotel during our recent stay to Barcelona. The hotel is very modern, well decorated and extremely comfortable. All of Barcelona's major sites are a short metro ride away from the hotel (accessible by the Rocafort metro stop just 2 blocks from the hotel). The rooftop patio is a great place for drinks before dinner. We would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Expected good, but not that good!”
Reviews.Author: araynsley
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to the Spanish GP and were looking for a nice hotel in Barcelona. We chose the Villa Emilia and could not have been happier with our choice. Upon the arrival the staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was exactly like in the pictures, it wasn't like they only show pictures of their best room. It was modern and clean and there was almost no road noise from the street below. It was well located for the metro service making getting to the train station for a connection to the race track and the centre of Barcelona very quick and easy. The surrounding area is typical of most Barcelona streets and we never felt vulnerable. We chose to eat in the hotel restaurant twice and on both occasions we were stunned. The food is second to none and the waiters are very good. Best steak I've ever had! After our meal we retired to the rooftop terrace which is a beautiful space to relax. I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel and would without doubt stay there again. P.S. beware pickpockets in Barcelona. I had my wallet stolen at the Jaume 1 metro station!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: liat1707
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel, intimate, very clean and the servise is realy warm. Brekfast large (more than continental) and 17-19 was coffee time and croissant. We recieved room number 48 with a street view. not all the rooms got view, you should check before. our room was comfertable and modern with shower. The hotel located between Catalonia plaza to Espania plaza, 20 min walk form the center but 3 min next to metro/ bus station. I recommened this hotel for those who looking for quiet, small and romantic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value 4 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AintNothingLike
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just came back from Barcelona where we've stayed at the Hotel Villa Emilia in L'Eixample. Villa Emilia has been proven to be a real gem! Located only 20 metres from Rocafort Metro station and 15 minutes walk from either Placa d'Espana and Placa Catalunya - The hotel is situated just in the right place. The staff was extremely hospitable and was eager to help. They were genuinely nice people who enjoyed associating with guests and helping them with every issue. The room was very clean and designed according to latest trends. There's free WIFI around the premises and complimentary afternoon coffee and pastry - exactly when you crave for them. ;-) It's a winner folks!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice/trendy hotel, I would recommend to book there”
Reviews.Author: CaroBerry
Reviews.Content: Go there, you will not be disappointed. Staff is helpful, design hotel, good size rooms, clean. If the hotel would have been located in Barceloneta, it would have been the perfect place! Good hotel choice with a roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient and quiet location... shame about the showers!”
Reviews.Author: Shogan77
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very tastefully decorated, boutique style public areas and rooms. Nice bar - with good cocktails, well stocked bar, good bar service and nice snacks. Pleasant roof top terrace with bar service (from downstairs). My only complaint is that the showers in either of our rooms were either burning hot or freezing cold. It seemed to be a pressure problem which I suspect affects the entire hotel. I like a good shower to relax so this was a bit disappointing. Hopefully the hotel will fix this, as I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villa Emilia - Good Hotel and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: rhysjon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the VE in Barcelona for five nights in March 2009. The location is excellent (two blocks from a metro station) and, being away from the main tourist areas, one feels more part of a neighborhood. Still, it's an easy walk to Placa Espanya and the Palau Nacional with its Museum of Catalonian Art. It's more challenging but walkable to get to Las Ramblas but the metro is so convenient that being a little apart just means that one can see more of he city. The VE staff are very friendly and helpful (speak Spanish, Catalan, English and probably others...), the rooms are clean and quite modern and free internet access is provided in a mezzanine area. The hotel restaurant is decent. There are a few other restaurants in the area, notably La Scarpetta for Italian. We made a point every morning of walking about six blocks east on the Gran Via to have breakfast at Escriba', an excellent bakery and high-end chocolatier with incredible pastries and desserts. Our stay at the hotel made the trip a great success. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NellC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend for our wedding anniversary. We'd been to Barcelona 4 yeasr before so we already had a list of places we wanted to cover. I can only repeat what many people have said about this hotel. The good points: Wonderfully clean, contemporary designed rooms. Very friendly staff htroughout the hotel. Free tea/coffee and croissants on the first floor from 5-7 pm. Piano-player every Fri/Sat/Sun evening in the Zinc bar. An excellent roof terrace (bar wasn't open when we were there but drinks could be taken up). Great location (right next to metro). Free Access to internet. The bad points: Zinc bar- we dined here once and found it oevrpriced, a cheeseboard for 20 euros!!!. We would definitely return to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: bluecatNottingham
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 40th birthday girls weekend away, after reading the reviews on trip advisor, and I would really struggle to find fault with it, Barcelona turned out to be one of the nicest cities I have visited. My friends' jaws dropped when we arrived at the hotel, as they obviously weren't expecting somewhere so nice for what we were paying! We got there by metro from the bus station (flew to Girona then took the Barcelona Bus). Initially I was concerned that the hotel wasn't central, but I soon realised it wasn't a problem - the Rocafort metro stop is only minutes away from the hotel & you can go anywhere from there, & there's the added bonus that it's fairly quiet round the area of the hotel & felt safe. Anyway it was only a few stops on the metro to all the main attractions of the city. Although the weather wasn't great, we took the lift up to the rooftop terrace just to be nosy, & it's really lovely up there (it wasn't open, maybe it opens later in the season). We had some nice wine in the Zinc bar downstairs, & the staff were friendly even though our attempts at Spanish were pretty pathetic. The rooms were fine, although we didn't spend much time in them as we were out enjoying ourselves, but they were modern, clean & comfortable. Overall we were delighted, & it certainly enhanced our stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smiffy1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in October 2008. This is a great little hotel, very chic and clean. Lovely breakfast and good service. The staff were friendly enough. If I went back to Barcelona, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: mx
Reviews.Content: We just returned from seven nights at this boutique hotel in Barcelona. It is an exceptional value. Rooms are good sized--small but not cramped. It is well situated a short block from the Metro which takes you (very quickly) to almost all of the major attractions. The staff is helpful and friendly. The room service to top notch. We'd return tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and loved barcelona”
Reviews.Author: woobert
Reviews.Content: Had high expectations for this place given the high ranking and good past reviews. It didn't disappoint. The hotel is in a great spot just far enough out of the mayham of the touristy Ramblas but close enough to be in the heart of the action in a 5 min tube ride. The rocafort tube station is literally a 30 second walk around teh corner. The hotel itself is lovely, the rooms are a nice size and our room looked out onto the front of the hotel - I didn't have a problem with noise. The bathroom is lovely and modern - but yes the shower did tend to soak the floor. Another potential problem is the aircon, it didn't impact us but it didn't seem to be switched on and if it was hotter it might have got uncomfortable. I didn't think they have the system working till summer hits properly. We got a great rate that included breakfast which was fab - lovely choices and all presented in a really nice way. The staff were also helpful and friendly. Overall a great choice for a weekend in barcelona and I'd definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine service; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beechmk
Reviews.Content: The price was $117/day with tax, but without breakfast on bookings.com. The room was large, with modern decoration. The front desk staff was attentive and helpful and performed beyond expectations. The hotel is a half block from the Rocofort Metro stop, and within walking distance of the Placa Catalunya and the old city. There are many small restaurants in the neighborhood for breakfast; the hotel charges 13 euros per person per night. There was a dispute with the bill which was resolved fairly and promptly. I booked the Villia Emilia because of the outstanding Trip Advisor reviews which are deserved. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay but some minor annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, spotlessly clean, modern and comfortable beds. A little on the small side although this is to be expected for a European city. Small irritations; the shower fluctuated between luke warm and scorchingly hot which certainly kept you on your toes! The toilet seemed to have a life of its own and would occasionally flush spontaneously whilst neither of us were in the bathroom. We didn't stay for breakfast as it was 13 Euro's each for continental breakfast, and for just 8 Euros between us we could get fantastic brunches in some lovely friendly local cafe's. Location: Slightly too far out for us despite the metro being next door. With hindsight we would have been happier in the Bari Gotic as this was more our scene with a higher density of bars, restaurants etc. However Eixample grew on us after strolling the streets, it's a friendly residential neighbourhood with a nice vibe to it. I was apprehensive about the trip as the majority of people I know who have visited Barcelona were mugged or pickpocketed during their stay. We were on our guard but had no problems. On the flight on the way back there were 2 groups of men who said they had been mugged around La Ramblas area at night. This area gets slightly rough towards the docks at the bottom of town, so take care in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern styling, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: BinfieldSteve
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, close to a tube stop helfway between Placa de Cataluna and Placa de Espana. Modern room, brown and cream, wooden/laminte flooring. Would classify this as a boutique hotel, small dining area for breakfast and a bar with Piano. Bar area lucks like a wine bar, so much that we almost missed the entrance. There is an open terrace bar at the top which I imagine is great in the warm months.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Elias_Casals
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well situated to visit Barcelona, not very expensive for the Barcelona standard (I do work in Barcelona and lived there for more than 30 years). The shower is nice a wide even though you finish with half the bathroom wet!! :-) I had an inner room which was very quiet. The view from the window was a typical inner part of buildings blocks in this area of the city (l'Eixample). I have choosen this hotel because it was near for a friend's place and I was leaving Barcelona very early in the morning. It did the worl. I did not expect such a good breakfast. Everything was delicious, pastries, honey, mermelades, white wine, natural orange juice, etc. Moreover, at night, there was a very nice atmosphere with someone playing a piano while visitors where having a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: suzieb246
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in late January/early February. First of all, travel: we arrived at the North station from Girona airport and took the metro from the Arc de Triomf stop (2 mins from north station) to rocafort stop. The coach was really good (costs 21 euros for return) but word of warning about travelling on metro - when we first got on metro (arc de Triomf), we saw some men attempt to mug a couple who had been on the same flight as us. Other than that, the metro was great but I think that this stop is targeted by muggers as people are arriving/leaving from airport and therefore have more valuable things with them so just be aware and don't make yourself an easy target (i.e. don't stand by doors or have your bag easily grabbable!) The hotel was absolutely brilliant. We were really impressed with how modern and stylish it was and our room (No. 68) was clean and spacious. Also our bed was a double as opposed to two singles pushed together which you often get in hotels. The service was excellent, with all staff being kind and friendly towards us. One slight complaint was that we asked the staff how we could get tickets to see Barcelona play at the Nou Camp and though they helped us get some at the reception, we later realised that we'd been charged over double what we would have paid for the tickets elsewhere so don't buy them at the hotel! Aside from this, we would seriously reccomend this hotel - it was a good price, convenient location (15 minute walk into centre/las ramblas, and right by metro) and very pleasant to stay in (they didn't even charge us for using bottles of water from ther minibar). We would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jellyfafafa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 6D/5N. We choose this hotel because of the great comments from trip advisor. The hotel room and toilet is in good size. The hotel room is 3 minutes walk from the subway station. However, the service of this hotel is just average. When we ride taxi arrived the hotel, I went into the hotel and asked for help as we have 3 huge luggages and 2 hand carry. However, the front desk said no one will able to help. In addition, the shampoo and shower gel do not change everyday. This is quite a problem for us as my husband and I take shower twice a day. The hotel is very close to subway, however the area does not look good. Its look so different from the other part of the Barcelona as it looks pretty old.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: svenwales
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just far enough away from the bedlam and tourist trap that is La Rambla. The Hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff very helpful, booking restaurants and providing knowledge of the city. The hotel is around 50 mts away from the nearest metro stop. A couple of reasonably cheap bars and restaurants are located within 100 mts of the hotel If I go back to Barcelona, then I will definitely stay here

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jodie102
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us stayed here 2nd jan till 5th Jan 2009. Our rooms were a good size and the decor was very modern. The bed was quite comfortable, although it could get quite warm in the room as the air con didnt go below 20 degrees! Most nights we slept with the window open, it could be quite noisy for some people. We didnt eat at the hotel so cannot comment on that. Hotel was a 10/15 min walk to la Ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Wish to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Malteser65
Reviews.Content: Although we only spent one night, we were really favourably impressed with this hotel. The room was fantastically spacious and comfortable. The shower was out of this world!! Breakfast was superb. The hotel is slightly far from the city centre, however this did not cause any problems because a Metro stop is only a couple of minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: theweemaw
Reviews.Content: First time visitors to Barcelona, we stayed at the Villa Emilia for 3 nights. We found the hotel to be extremely comfortable, clean, friendly and good value for money. We received a welcome drink, plus complementary breakfast ( excellent) which included "champagne", and cakes and coffee from 5-7 p.m, plus tickets to the Dali exhibition. It is in an excellent location minutes from the metro. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel and would love to go back in the summer. The only thing that spoiled our stay was the theft of our video camera from the Hard Rock Cafe. We were warned beforehand that Barcelona is notorious for thefts but were still caught out. Fortunately we were lucky enough to get it back , thanks to the staff at the Hard Rock, but be do be aware of pickpockets and thieves.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Chic”
Reviews.Author: Bubblesdevere
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Barcelona we booked the Emilia on the back of the reviews posted here as they've never let us down yet, and nor did they on this occasion. A taxi from the north coach station cost around 10 Euros. On check in at the hotel we were given lots of useful information about what to see in Barcelona and then went to find our room. Like some of the other guests mentioned earlier we found the heat in the hotel to be unbearable at times which made it difficult to sleep. There is air conditioning but pressing the on/off button and changing the temperature didn't seem to make a difference. We were on the 6th floor and could have opened the full length window, but the room faced out onto a fairly busy street. Our twin room came as two single beds pushed together. Not being used to single beds we found them quite small and what with that and the heat we didn't get a good night's sleep. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel although it was not included in the room rate. It's not cheap at 13 Euros each but the choice was excellent: cheese, salmon, meats, fresh fruit, cereals, yoghurts, various types of gorgeous fresh bread, pastries, eggs, a selection of wonderful preserves, juices - and a glass or two of cava! Things did run out but the staff were very helpful and at no time did we feel there wasn't enough. It was just the perfect way to start a day. A special mention must be made of the selection of teas on offer as they were absolutely delicious and so different from anything I've had before. There is a bar and small restaurant area on the ground floor. Prices for drinks are cheap compared to the UK, around 4 Euros for a glass of decent Rioja. On the first floor mezzanine is what the hotel calls its business area with free internet access and complimentary coffee/tea and pastries between 5 and 7 each evening. The nearest metro station is Rocafort, about 1 minute from the hotel. Playa de Catalunya square is about a 20 minute amble and from here you can visit Las Ramblas or Passieg de Gracia. The Hard Rock cafe Barcelona is in the square and well worth a visit! All in all we were pleased with our choice of hotel: not so far out as to make Barcelona inaccessible but far enough out to be a little quieter.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bristlehound
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four night break at this wonderful Hotel. The staff were all very friendly. The bar staff especially couldn't do enough. The Hotel is very modern and contemporary. It is very very clean. The corridors and all the public areas being as clean as your room! The patisserie next door but one to the Hotel was especially welcoming. Eating in the Hotel seems to be quite expensive - 13 euros + 7% tax per person for breakfast and a table d'ote menu in an evening for 30 euro's per person. To be fare however we never ate in the Hotel so I can't comment on the food. When you book I would try and avoid rooms 10.11 & 12. I could imagine these being especially noisy as they are on the first floor mezanine. The rooms to go for all in end 5 or 8. Eg 25, 38, 45 etc. Theses are the corner rooms which are bigger than the normal one's. The taxi from the airport to the Hotel is around 20 euro's. Las Ramblas is about a 20 minute walk away. At the bottom of Las Ramblas is Port Vell which is a large shopping complex. Don't miss St. Joseph food market about 1/2 way down Las Ramblas on the right. Not to be missed! Considering it is a large city we were a little disappointed at the restaurants in Barcelona. Not as much choice as we expected. The Rocafort tram stop is 2 minutes walk from the Hotel if you want to go further. A great hotel a little way out of the centre but no worse for it!

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve #4 Rank on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: IvanhP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here post cruise for only one evening and I have to say, i was very disappointed. My wife and I travel a considerable amount worldwide and often use tripadvisor to aid in our decisions. We chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and rankings... and they are not well deserved. We disembarked our ship early in the morning and requested an early check-in. Upon arrival I asked teh front desk if we could check in early and without even checking, they denied our request and said not til after 12 noon. So we left our bags with them and walked around Barcelona. The location of this hotel is 5-10 minutes walking from La Ramblas and Pl Catalunya and there are very few restaurants or shopping in the area. Upon our return, the hotel was unable to give us a key to our room, because heir system was down. But they did allow us to bring our bags up. The front desk attendant showed us to our room and using his master key he opened up our room and then left us w/o a key. He promised he'd see what he could do, but after 15 minutes waiting in our room, we never heard from him. The room key is NEEDED to activate the lights and power, so this didn't do us any good. That meant we had to shower in the dark and my wife could not use her hair dryer. Upon leaving i checked with the front desk when i could have a key to my room and they said it would be around 3pm. I also had to correct them before leaving... they assigned us one room and gave us a notecard with a room number on it, but they put us in a different room on the same floor. While we were gone, i didn't want them letting someone else into our room b/c of a mismatch. We left for lunch and came back later in the afternoon to get ready for dinner. While my wife was getting ready, i asked the front desk if they could give me access to the free Wi Fi. But they didn'y know how to set it ip on my Mac. In the US, my Mac just finds wireless network available, you select it, and enter the password... i guess their process was different. So unable to use my laptop, i used their computers in their business center. But all their computers were set up in Italian. I asked the front desk attendant if she could show me how to change the lanugage on the cpu, but she didn't know how to do that either. The hotel was clean and decoration was modern... but the overall experience was sub par. The showers look cool but they flood the entire bathroom floor... We were never offered any apology for our inconvenience or anything. RIDICULOUS At $200 a night i'm sure you can find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: exploremore10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Emilia is located on a side street, off a main road and is a 1 minute walk away from Rocafort Metro station which makes travelling around the city a piece of cake, it takes about 5 mins. to get to La Rambla metro station and for 7.20euros you get 10 metro trips. It is a 15 minute walk from montjuic - the very impressive national art gallery with the magic fountains and quite possibly the finest view over Barcelona. The olympic stadium is located just behind montjuic. Even though this hotel is not directly in the centre of Barcelona there are some great restaurants, patisseries and cafes located near by, which are much more reasonably priced than some of the restaurants on La Rambla-one of which tried to charge us 10euros for a beer. Next door to the restaurant is a superb cafe/deli/wine shop, and a craking little authentic mexican restaurant is just around the corner. The hotel staff were very helpful, freindly and spoke excellent english. The hotel is immaculately clean with good sized rooms, queen size beds and full length windows which slide open like a patio door. The roof terrace was a real suprise when we first saw it, with sophisticated furniture providing a very relaxed atmosphere. The breakfast was lovely, with a good selection of breads, baguettes, salami, proscuitto, cheeses, cereals, drinks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: MikiSMLA
Reviews.Content: Everything good about this hotel is true - clean (the hallway and rooms smell fresh and new), modern furnishings, comfortable bed, great breakfast spread, close to the metro. The stay was going well, until towards the end of the trip where the hotel ran out of water. To be fair, this was not their fault but the city's. However, the way Villa Emilia HANDLED the situation was less to be desired. I noticed the water pressure that night to be low, so I called the reception to ask what the problem was. She sounded incredulous and insisted there was no problem, that perhaps I wasn't flushing properly (which I disputed since we have been there for the past few days and knew how to flush their toilets). When I asked if we can be moved to another room, she said she cannot (which surprised me how she said that so quickly) and had to wait in the morning. As I woke up, there was no water at all. Calling up reception (this time, it was a different person), he quickly reminded me that this was not the "hotel's fault but the city's fault" and we had to wait for a couple of hours. I've been traveling a lot, both for work and for leisure, and this was the first time I've encountered a situation wherein a service oriented facility offered no... service. At one point, he even asked, "What would you like me to do, madam? Call city hall?" I replied (regrettably in my head), "Yes, and while you're at it, get me a gallon of water to wash my face with". The price of this hotel is not cheap, so if you can afford to stay in chain hotels near the city centre, do so. I believe they can readily and professionally address issues like these instead of small places like Villa Emilia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: KeithRHooper
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa Emilia is a great modernist boutique hotel. The rooms are of a good size and although the large than queen bed is two singles pushed together this did not cause a problem. The bed is a little hard for our tastes however we had no trouble sleeping in the quiet atmosphere. We liked the idea of being able to open the windows as you could let the sounds of the city in and to be able to close them to enjoy the air conditioning. The nearest railway station (Rocafort) is literally two minute walk from the front door. The Hub station Espanya is one station further up the line or ten minutes walk up the Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes. From Espanya it is possible to catch trains all over Barcelona and importantly to Montserrat (which is must). The Hotel staff was very friendly. The reception staff was very helpful and had a very good grasp of English (which was great considering my very poor Latin American Spanish) and helped us out with all manner of enquires even arranging a taxi for us on our departure. The roof top bar was hit (although a little chilly as the evening wore on), service was great via an intercom to the Zinc Bar. The breakfast bar was good an honest self serve buffet that was well serviced with no problems with food or drink running out. Over all the Hotel Villa Emilia is a very comfortable hotel that is well located away from the hurley burly with an excellent train service. Montjuic is a longish walk away, however by using the railway system (including the funicular and the cable car) a visit to the castle where there is fabulous view of the harbour and city. It is then long but leisurely stroll down hill to the old Olympic area, the National Art Museum and the Magic Fountains. There are great number of cafes and bars in the surrounding streets to keep the most adventurous happy. The attentive staff ensured that we had a no fuss seven day stay. A very good no fuss holiday with great staff in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt by heat!”
Reviews.Author: JackieCowan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel- tasteful decor throughout. Very good breakfast. Our visit was spoilt by the heat level particularly in our bedroom. Due to one cold day last week the airconditioning had been swapped to heat and the hotel refused to switch it back. They didn't have a portable fan either.We were so hot that we had to sleep with window open and rain blowing onto the wooden floor.The noise from outside was awful And we had tthe worst 4 nights sleep we've ever had in a hotel. It was such a shame as the hotel was perfect in every other way. I would only stay there again if I was certain the AC would be on.

Reviews.Title: “fab & relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grans1
Reviews.Content: Headed away with 3 other girls for a weekend break. Didn't mind where we stayed, just happy to have a hotel book before we arrived. It was just a brilliant place to stay. I will certainly return to this hotel in the near future (already planning the return trip) it truely was an amazing hotel. Very clean and modern, staff very professional and helpful (only good looking people may apply). Very central location. The hotel also had live music in the bar and the Zinc bar on the rooftop is open to the public. We also had breakfast, which is served until 11.00am, which was great. You also did not have to vacate the room until 12.00pm on the last day, again this was really useful. All in all a great hotel in a great city. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: trevlind
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a suitable hotel in Barcelona that was a little different to the normal chain hotels that you get. The Emilia seemed to fit the bill given the previous reviews and turned out to be a really good choice. Far enough away from all the busy and noisy areas but close enough to walk or get the metro at the bottom of the road. Simply put It's a really nice hotel with very informative and pleasant staff and a rooftop terrace to have a romantic drink that either starts or finishes your evening in Barcelona. Only one little gripe...........on our last day the rooftop terrace wasa closed to guests because of private function - take your photo's up there while you have the chance!!

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself. Just an above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: metou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Emilia for four days while on holiday with friends. The hotel is stylish and brand new . Very modern , super clean , excellent service . Helpful stuff . The rooms are very spacious and beds very comfortable . The breakfast (included in price ) was phenomenal .Cheeses , sausages, , breads, pastries and hams , juices , and coffee . Also - caviar and champagne - need I say more ?? There is a good bar as well in the hotel . Zinc bar which is very good and also has a resident pianist . We booked through the hotel website which worked out cheaper . I would recommend this hotel to everyone going to Barcelona .

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Style”
Reviews.Author: JandJTucson
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on TripAdvisor but booked our stay directly with the hotel. We spent three nights at Emilia before taking a cruise. This is a great little hotel. The rooms, while not large by U.S. standards are beautiful with a very contemporary style. The tile and marble bathroom was one of the most interesting designs I've seen. You absolutely don't want to miss the outdoor, rooftop bar and sitting area. Terrific views of the city and they serve some very nice spanish wines. This hotel is a little farther away from the La Rambla and other tourist sites so it's a bit more quiet but the metro station is just around the corner so you are never more than ten to twenty minutes from most of the must see spots in Barcelona. The metro is inexpensive and very easy to use. We used the metro to get from the Barcelona airport to the hotel. The connections were easy but be aware, their are stairs to negotiate with your bags are many of the metro stations. The staff at Emilia was very friendly and helpful with the exception on one fellow at the front desk. We only saw him one time during our stay. The lobby bar and small restaurant is very contemporary and stylish but it comes with a price. It's very expensive. There's a great little bakery/pastry shop just a few doors away for coffee and pastry as well as lunch items. If you are interested in the hotel, you might watch the "specials" link on their website. We were lucky enough to book a package that included the buffet breakfast which was very good. The items are typical of a European breakfast so don't expect to find scarmbled eggs and hashbrowns. In a city with a lot of hotels, I think this one is a great find. It's only been open a couple of years so some of the travel guides don't list it. Finally, we found a great, reasonably priced restaurant just about three blocks away on the Grand Via. It's called La Clara and has a great tapas bar on the street level and a very nice, full menu restaurant in the underground wine cellar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisletrek
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at this fantastic hotel. The rooms were spotless and very comfortable. We walked everywhere and the hotel is within 30 minutes walking distance from most places. The Ramblas, The Port and The Beech. We even walked to the Nou Camp to watch Barcelona Play. Barcelona has lots to offer and is a great city break. The hotel has a rooftop terrace, which is an amazing addition to this hotel. You can sit out after a long days walking and enjoy a cool beer (or 2). The hotel also had local entertainers playing cool latin music at night as the Zinc bar is open to the public. We also had breakfast, which is served until 11.00am, which was great. You also did not have to vacate the room until 12.00pm on the last day, again this was really useful. All in all a great hotel in a great city. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Villa Emilia”
Reviews.Author: Fission_Chips
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a splendid 4 night stay at the Hotel Villa Emilia (16 Sep 08 to 20 Sep). This establishment is thoroughly deserving of the excellent reports that have been posted in many of the reviews. The bedroom and bathroom were both modern and chic & kept immaculately cleaned. With the bedroom double glazed windows closed you could hardly hear the traffic noise outside. The A/C was silent and did its job – all in all a fantastic hotel throughout. We didn't take breakfast in the Hotel preferring instead to sample a croissant and coffee from one of the numerous cafes dotted around the Villa Emilia; besides it left us extra Euros to spend at the Hotels rooftop ‘Zinc Bar’ which was a magnificent haven to quaff a beer/wine or two. All of the hotel staff, without exception, were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is away from the centre in the Raval area and a two minute (probably less actually) from the Rocafort Metro station. We aren’t youngsters but walked the whole length of the Rambla (twice) and to the Port Vell, L‘Aquarium, Museum Nacional d’Art de Catalunya, Olympic Stadium, Casa Mila and many other sites too numerous to mention from the Hotel and return without using a taxi or the metro system, although I did buy a T10 metro ticket as a standby just in case!! I wasn’t sure at first what transport to use from the airport to the hotel but from comments on this site I decided that a taxi might be the best bet. The taxi’s are all metered so what you see on the meter is what you pay. It cost us 20 Euros to the hotel but the return leg to the airport on a Saturday came to about 27 Euros – but worth every cent for the comfort and sheer convenience. We will return to Barcelona again and will definitely use the Hotel Villa Amelia again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of August (Bank Hols weekend) for my husbands 40th Birthday and we paid a good price through Last Min.com. We got 4 nights for the price of three (room only). First time to Barcelona and we found the staff in the hotel very helpful and friendly. The room was modern and the hotel was really clean and smelt fresh and clean at all times. The H2O spa products they provide for you are fab. Even though we took our own we used these products to try, the salt/sea body wash was to die for. We didnt eat at the hotel but the roof top bar is fantastic to chill out after a day sightseeing or in the evening. In the 3 days we were there we only saw a couple of people in the afternoon it was bliss. The hotel is a two minute walk to the metro but if you don’t want to take the metro at night and want to eat down at the port/beach you are looking at about £20 for a round trip in a taxi. We loved this hotel and felt safe in this area. The metro we found very good in the day for sightseeing we purchased a T10 ticket and this was value for money, it cost about 7 euros each and it lasted us 3 days. We have been to a lot of hotels all over the world and this hotel for a short break in Barcelona was really nice and we would recommend it. It doesn’t have a pool but for a short break you don’t need it and the weather in August was just right to walk about without being too hot. The surrounding area outside the hotel was ok if you fancy a take away pizza, if like us you are arriving after 11pm at night when the hotel restuarant is closed. There is a nice ice cream shop round the corner and a supermarket which is handy if you want drinks to put in the fridge in your room but the nice tapas restaurants and bars etc with some atmosphere are a metro or taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Unrepeatable quality! Profound excellence!”
Reviews.Author: CAPTAINCURRY
Reviews.Content: After the collapse of excel airways we were in need of a break to replace out egypt holiday, so we went to Barcelona, and stayed at the Emilia. It was very nice indeed, friendly staff, very nice breakfast, not the usual cheap items. All very high quality. The staff were verry accomodating when leaving our bags after we had checked out. The drinks costs were reasnoble as was the room service. Cant praise the hotel enough, and their website! Also iff you go through need a hotel or laterooms, it may say theres no availability, check emilias website, as you may get a surprise! And its norm cheaper or equal cost Little tips!! Taxis..., if you order a taxi from the hotel when you get tin the car, it starts at 5 euros. But if you flag one outside, or round the corner, it starts at 1 euro 50 therefore saving you a few euros! Barcelona bus tour..... Myself and my partner paid 20 euros each for a hop on hop off bus tour, it was rubbish! We waited for around an hour at one stop to get on a bus as they would keep arriving full, when you get on you have to start down stairs where you cant see much out of the heavy signwritten windows, Not recommended, i would say the best bet is to grab a 3 day pass on the tube, 14 euros! Dont forget to see the "fountains" they are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: MMuldowney
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona and had a lovely stay. The hotel was quite trendy and the staff were lovely, however were very dissappointed with the fact that I searched for a hotel on the internet that advertised a double room, and with added caution entered the request for a double room on the special request line... still received a twin room with an apology... the basic double bed was a simple basic request that could not be provided....

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eu55
Reviews.Content: I would rate this as one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. It is set in the Ravel District of Barcelona and is a 1 minute walk from the Rocafort Metro station. This is two stops from Placa Catunlya and Las Ramblas. Various tickets are available from the stations such as two day passes and these are bought from electronic machines which can be set to various languages. Two day pass for unlimited journeys was 10 euros. the hotel itself is a modern boutique style with very helpful and attentive staff. The food was excellent and the roof top terrace bar a must do after a day enjoying the city. The room was a good size and very well equipped. My wife and I would definately recommend both the hotel and city for a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Must try”
Reviews.Author: Danidive
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the center of Barcellona. Nice rooms wonderful service and atmosfere. Is not the first time in Barcellona, but if we go back we will go to Villa Emilia. Thanks to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cimbalon
Reviews.Content: I can add very little to the previous positive reviews. This is an excellent hotel, imaculately presented, competitively priced with friendly and helpful staff. It is extremely easy to commute to the city centre using the metro (London eat your heart out).

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Eclectic and fun”
Reviews.Author: lytebrite
Reviews.Content: We used the Emilia as a transit hotel before we left for an extended stay outside of Barcelona. I really enjoyed the hotel. Not as close to the Ramblas as other locations, but made up for it in the size of the room and the calm of the environment. Super close to Placa Catalunya, and the museums there, and the Metro, so getting around is not a problem. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jessicaindc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon and were very happy. Perfectly located far enough away from the hustle of Las Ramblas but close enough to the Rocafort metro station, we were quite content. The upstairs hotel bar is like a dream and the food was delicious. We found the hotel staff very polite and patient, even with our poor Spanish. The only (very minor) complaint is that the hair dryer overheated a few times. Overall, an excellent experience and we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Holllly
Reviews.Content: 18.08 - 20.08.08 – My stay was a business purpose but I enjoyed every single minute! Charming hotel - the moment you enter the hotel you feel relaxed and "on vacation". Very friendly staff; easy & quick check in - rooms are comfortable and also big enough for a longer stay. Very nice bathroom - walk in shower and spacious layout – very modern and clean. Flat screen TV could offer some more "international" programs but then I wasn’t there to watch TV; adjustable air-condition is a big plus! Very comfortable bed - lots of cushions if you prefer more than one. Double room for single use. My room was "off street" and so calm that I was able to sleep with open windows, which is awesome. Yummy breakfast buffet with fresh ingredients – variety of bread, toast, fresh fruit salad and fresh juices, cheese, salami, ham/jambon, various jams/marmalades and honey as well as yoghurt, cereals, fresh milk, tea, coffee, etc. – great start for a busy day! During day the hotel offers (for their guests) a complementary coffee/tea break - from 5-7pm. 1st Level gallery you find enough fresh hot (steaming!) coffee and hot water for tea - additional cake or sweet bread rolls as well as bottled water for free. Absolutely spectacular is the roof top area – fresh air, cool drinks, relaxing lounges – nicest way to end your day and start your evening! Not to mention the location – everything you need is easy to access: Metro station "Rocafort" just around the corner – taxi/cab service outside the door (reception calls a cab if you need one for a certain time) or you walk (less than 2 mins) to "Gran Via" and grab a taxi/cab there. My colleague and I chose to walk a lot, as it's just great to discover a city by feet, specially with such a convenient location. Over all this hotel left a smile on my face and I will surely book it again for my next trip to Barcelona in a few weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and clean”
Reviews.Author: laxgeezer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 2 years old. It is ideally situated within an 8- 10 minute walk from Plaza Espanya and 2 minutes to the subway. Villa Emilia is in a quiet neighborhood about a 15 minute walk from Las Ramblas but it is much quieter, less touristy and (I'm told) far safer. The English speaking staff was extremely polite and helpful. The hotel itself is very modern and chic. Perhaps too chic for this American hick. But the boutique size of the hotel makes it warm and welcoming. Very nice terrace bar with a cool view on the roof. Very highly recommended for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SimonPJ007
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the hotel was great. We booked directly with the hotel and found the rate to be very good. We payed 110 euros for a double room. We stayed in room 43, and it was very well decorated, very clean, and had superb furnishings. The toileteries were replaced daily and were very good quality. The shower was also excellent. The air conditioning was very good and fully controllable. We found the room to be very quiet and bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was not included in our rate, and was a little bit pricey for what you get - it is self service. We did however try Casanovas a couple of doors down for breakfast which was only about 7 or 8 euros for 2 coffees, a couple of bocadillos and a couple of pastries. The roof top bar is also excellent - we went up there every night for a couple of pre dinner drinks - very reasonable prices, good measures of wine, and great service. Staff in general were very helpful, and would ring taxis for you and make reservations at restaurants. One of the staff recommended an excellent Argentinian steak restaurant to us - San Telmo, we had probably the best steak I have ever eaten here. The hotel is in a nice area, fairly quiet, and about 20 mins walk to Las Ramblas, 8 mins walk to Placa Espania. If you like dogs, look out for the lovely black cocker spaniel called 'Black' that lives just round the corner from the hotel - the owner doesnt like you to touch or stroke him though. Overall, we thought the hotel was in a great location, and represented excellent value for money. We will return

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with great access to city sights.”
Reviews.Author: Liz_Hodges
Reviews.Content: The hotel made a really good impact from the moment we got there. In terms of the downstairs it is really nicely put together with a bar and sit down area for coffee etc. The coffee there is fantastic and the staff were really friendly. The room itself was really clean and nice, with a good view. The only downside was not having enough shelves for the surplus of clothing that I took with me! In terms of getting into the centre of Barcelona, it is walkable in about 15 mins, but to be honest taxis were frequent and cheap enough that there was no need. Overall I loved my stay here and would gladly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: Watfordfcgirl
Reviews.Content: Very easy to get to hotel. We took the airport bus (A1) to a stop called Urgell, it's only 5 mins from there. The hotel is lovely. Rooms have air-con and a free safe. We didn't have breakfast. The metro is at the end of the road (called Rocafort), but you can walk to Placa Catalunya in 20 mins (turn left at the end of the hotel rd then carry on along the main road) The rooftop bar was excellent. Very relaxing day and night, comfy sofas and good food - not too expensive (decent bottle of cava 18euros)

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel in any way...”
Reviews.Author: JonHarris
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay here and I can honestly say that the hotel excels in every way. Everything from the room to the service was immaculate. The roof terrace is stunning and a real gem and the continental breakfast buffet was the best one I have ever come across. Smoked Salmon and even Cava for those who like a tipple in the morning... All the staff were extremely helpful and the room was spotless and very modern. The maid service was excellent and the location is ideal for escaping the craziness of the central city and is just 140 steps from Rocafort metro station. I highly recommend Casanovas Deli/Restaurant a couple of doors down for take away snacks and they also have a really nice little restaurant/bistro tucked away round the back with a very helpful english speaking waiter. Yet another great Barca experience...

Reviews.Title: “Roof terrace magic”
Reviews.Author: MrsFfromtheUK
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Villa Emilia last weekend (July) and were really delighted with our choice. It's a modern and sleek hotel, spotlessly clean and comfortable and without the pretentious atmosphere sometimes encountered at 'trendy' hotels. When we arrived at 10.30pm on Friday straight from work in the UK, the roof terrace was like an oasis of calm. Cocktails, comfy sofas, a gentle breeze a flickering candles - bliss! We liked: - The Roof Terrace (actually, I LOVED that!) - The interior design - Free afternoon tea - Quiet location Not quite so keen on: - The noisy plumbing from the room upstairs - The squeaky door on the room opposite us which woke us up at 7am!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in a quiet place”
Reviews.Author: kipling008
Reviews.Content: we stay 4 nights in this hotel and it was really a great experience. Very modern furnitures, in a quiet place but near metro rocafort and friendly employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a safe neighbourhood - Good value for money in Barca”
Reviews.Author: Matt72
Reviews.Content: I try to keep my reviews short as like a lot of people you don’t read the war and peace ones…So I hope this helps you… We booked the Emilia for a 40th birthday party of 7 people, we didn’t want to pay the earth, which, being a city, you invariably end up doing, but we loved this place and found it immaculate, with minimalist modern furniture, good sized rooms, aircon and contrary to some other reviews, staff that fell over themselves to help, with advice on restaurants, where to go, getting taxi’s for you. Once you’ve unpacked and want 2mins to take it all in, catch the lift to the rooftop terrace for a cold beer – not to be missed…. I sort off agree with some reviewers on the location, this hotel isn’t bang on-top of everything, however its only 15mins nice walk from the La Rablas or 5Euros in a taxi. The Ramblas is nice for a walk, the shops on it are naff, however if you walk of into the side streets of the Gothic side, you’ll love it. Don’t miss the harbour, its beautiful, full of bars, restaurants, perfect for people watching whether day or night to eat, its just something you need to do… Final points: Open top tourist bus 20Euros - good fun – short walk from Emilia. Tapas in Placa Reial (Gothic area) – Not to be missed. Taxi from the Airport takes 20/25Mins…They’re all metered, so don’t worry about being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful staff and average location”
Reviews.Author: breakfast4two
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Villa Emilia for 3 nights in April. It was our first stop of a 4 week tour of Spain. On first impressions it seemed like a lovely designer hotel. Unfortunately, these initial impressions did not last long. While the decor and ambience were inviting, the rooms very modern and clean, the roof top terrace a lovely way to chill and soak up the Barcelona sun (many hotels in Barcelona have these), the biggest let down for this hotel were the uninterested, unhelpful and arrogant staff. Location wise, we found the hotel just that little bit out of the way although it was a quite, safe neighbourhood and the hotel was close to a metro stop. We wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to travel and be in the heart of things - and that by no way means staying on the La Ramblas! As we spent 10 days in Barcelona we had the opportunity to stay at 2 other hotels - one in the Barri Gothic and the standout hotel - Hotel Granados 83, in the Eixample district - a fabulous hotel in a wonderful neighbourhood within easy reach to all the main attractions, and if you enjoy good food, you'll find some of the best (not necessarily expensive) restaurants in Barcelona within easy walking distance. .

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our Europe tour”
Reviews.Author: TheRoadtoMajastres
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. It's in a quiet location but only a block away from the subway and close to restaurants of all sorts, from corner tapas places to some fine dining. It's about a 15 euro taxi ride from the train station. The room was lovely -- modern but still tasteful. Very quiet, even when the soccer championships were on. Twin beds but they fit together nicely. No bath but a lovely shower — and full mirror to watch yourself shower if you're in to that kind of thing. The only drawback to our room was the bathroom had a sliding door that didn't quite close all the way. So you had best be comfortable with each other -- or use the restrooms in the basement, which were also very tasteful. The room had a safe, which is nice. We never ate at the hotel, but we had coffee there and it was lovely coffee -- perfect, in fact. There is also a very nice open-air lounge on the roof. The staff was lovely -- young but very friendly and very competent. You can easily walk to the main tourist areas from here in about 15-20 minutes. Great place -- I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristof1
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is certainly the finest hotel I have ever stayed in. All the reviews I have read on Trip Advisor have been entirely accurate. The rooms are a good size and quiet, with everything you'd expect. The air con worked like a dream. The breakfast is lovely (wine included if early boozing is your thing). The staff were very friendly and accommodated all my requests. The roof terrace is another major plus point which serves great drinks for only a few euros. It was so attractive that we met many locals up there too. One point i would mention is that it is a good 20 minute walk into the main tourist areas which if your not a good walker could be difficult. However, there is a metro stop (Rocafort) less than 50 metres from the Hotel so you can get anywhere in the city in no time at all. We used the metro all the time and found it really easy to use and quick (get a T-10 card as it's really good value and more than one person can use it at a time). We didn't notice any crime issues at all on the metro or in the city as a whole, in fact it felt much safer than any other city i've been to, even late at night. If your travelling from the airport to the hotel the airport bus stops at placa espanya and urgell metro stop both of which are only four blocks either side of the hotel so unless you've got some seriously heavy baggage this is by far the cheapest and easiest option. Tickets cost 4.10 euros compared to at least 25 euros for a taxi. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and i'm already waiting for a chance to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: UkWisetraveller
Reviews.Content: There are cheaper hotels but Villa Emilia is worth the extra. It's located on a small quiet square just off the Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, a main avenue that cuts across the city. A very clean room with a designer look, it had a flat screen TV and a large and comfortable bed.The room had a safe and mini-bar. The bathroom, with black slate tiles and white fittings, was spotless, with a very good power shower. Hairdryer provided and good quality shampoo. The hotel is well worth its 4 star rating. Breakfast, if you have it, is continental buffet style - not the biggest I've seen but personally, adequate with sufficient choice. The hotel is away from the main tourist area. There's a metro station (Rocafort) at the end of the street (approx 50 metres) with good access across the city. It is a 20 minute walk from the hotel to Place de Catalunya (5 minutes on metro), one of the city's main squares. Off this square runs the well known but noisy (and sometimes tacky) street La Rambla. Ten minutes walk in the other direction is Place Espana from where you can get a train to the mountain-top monastery of Monsterrat (easy to reach and not to be missed). Place Espana is also one of the stops for the tourist buses that travel the city on three separate loops (buy a two day ticket -26 euros - there's much to see and the city is large). Could not see many restaurants immediately around the hotel - mainly cafes, but there are probably some in other streets. The hotel does have a restaurant on the ground floor (didn't eat there) and a bar. There's also a rooftop terrace bar (very nice on a warm summer evening). Ate in restaurants near Universitat square (10 minutes walk) and in the streets around Place de Catalunya. Quality and price varied.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: rd76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly as portrayed in the other reviews. Small, modern, clean, on the minimalist side, with young and friendly staff. The rooms have a fair size - for my wife and I it was perfect. For American standards rather small. Our room faced a not very busy junction, so we could hear the cars, but the windows were so good that the this did not disturb us, although we are extremely sensitive to noise. I assume that the rooms facing the back of the hotel are completely quiet. Very unusual for city hotels: we could not hear a thing from next door. The bath was also modern and simple. The only minor complaint we had was that the maid was really saving on toiletries. On Sunday, there was only one staff attending to the breakfast buffet, so they had troubles filling back the plates. On the following days the service was excellent. The selection is continental/European, so people from the US may miss their rich breakfast. The hotel is not in the heart of the city, which is good. It is not a rip-off and it is quiet. During the day we moved around by metro - one of the best services we have seen in the world. The Rocafort station was just down the block, so within 15 minutes we could be anywhere we wanted in Barcelona. The service stops at midnight, so for returning to the hotel we used to catch a cab, which cost a ridiculous 7-8 euros per ride

Reviews.Title: “classy!!”
Reviews.Author: alok
Reviews.Content: thank u trip advisor.what a great find.lovely hotel and very welcoming.150 euros inclusive of breakfast for all three of us.and extra bed for my 7 year old.good rate barcelona is one expensive city!found it very difficult to get hotels in my budget.decent location not perfect if u like to walk everywhere like us.we had to walk for 20to 30 min to reach catulunya square to take for the bus turistic.though wiyh the great weather it wasn;t difficult.the rooms were really nice.bathroom toileteries were simply wonderfulvery lively in the evenings the bar is very popular.there is a supermarket opposite the hotel,and some nice eateries and nice gelato too right next door.they didnt even charge us when once we called india from the reception.must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LouSi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing the great reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is gorgeous! The rooms were cosy and modern and the bathroom was fab - with a power shower that was perfect after a long day sightseeing in the sun! The bar was really nice and very reasonable, we stayed in one night and had about 6 large glasses of red wine and 2 sandwiches and it was only about 20 euros! The terrace was amazing; the only problem was that it wasn't very busy when we were there. In the height of summer, I can imagine that it would be gorgeous up there and a great atmosphere. The afternoon tea was a lovely touch too, served on the 1st floor at about 5pm. The location of the hotel was great, the metro station is just down the road and you can be anywhere in the city in a matter of minutes, invest in a saver ticket. The city is amazing, we loved it! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: kathyjobaum
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor to find a hotel in Barcelona and decided on Hotel Villa Emilia based on recommendations of others. We stayed two nights and were very satisfied with the location, our room, and the staff. The room was large and clean. The staff was helpful and their restaurant was excellent. We were close by La Rambla and the hop on/hop off bus line. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villa Emilia made Barcelona even that more special”
Reviews.Author: bklynguy
Reviews.Content: After being out 10 hours a day sightseeing, it was such a joy coming back to the Villa Emilia in the L'Eixample neighborhood of Barcelona. We didn't want to be in the heart of the city with all the noise and hustle of the areas such as the Ramblas. This hotel is in the perfect location: quiet area with local shops and restaurants. A 20 minute walk to the Placa Catalunya and a 10 minute walk from the A1 airport bus from Placa d'Espana. The Rocafort train station is just down the block. We walked everywhere from the location of this property - even to the beaches of the Barceloneta in just over an hour (or you could be there in less than 15 minutes with the easy metro) The hotel played wonderful music the 6 days we were there. Very relaxing music, appropriate music no matter what country you are coming from. You could listen to the music on the roof terrace, on one their comfortable couches, drinking a glass of CAVA. (which we did every night after being out all day). So relaxing and peaceful. And at 3.50 euros a glass of Cava (Spanish champagne), it's a bargain. They even have a live piano player by the lobby bar (who was great!) Rooms are modern, VERY quiet (we heard no noises from other rooms the 6 nights we were there). Flat panel TV with a couple of stations in English, one in French, German, Spanish and some with subtitles. You control the temp of the room, they have windows that open that are soundproofed when closed. We faced the back and had no outdoor noise disturbances. Room was an adequate size for 2 people. I read in one review about the square shapes of their pillows. I had a concern with that being I have neck problems. Best sleep I had in 6 nights. Don't let the shape of the pillows be of any concern. Breakfast was from 7:30 am till 11:00. Teas, coffee, hard boiled eggs, cheeses, hams, cereals, yogurt, salami, fresh fruit, fresh orange and grapefruit juices, assorted pastries and fresh bread Afternoons from 5:00-7:00 they put out coffee and teas and some snacks. One computer for free internet use. Staff: unbelievably friendly, helpful and really make an effort to make your experience special. The Catalan people are genuinely wonderful and EVERY staff person there made our stay even more special. I got sick one day, and the woman behind the desk researched a place for me to see a doctor. First thing she asked me the next day was if I was better and if I found the doctor's office. I'm mentioning this only because it shows the quality of the staff. All in all, we were so glad we picked the Villa Emilla. We had walked by other hotels that we were thinking of staying at and realized we would not have been happier staying at those other properties (basically because of the location or price) If you want a quiet, wonderful place to come back to after being out all day, this is the place. If you are a big walker, you can walk to anywhere from the hotel. If you're not a walker, having the train station a block away can get you anywhere from 2 minutes to 15 minutes. Bus to Parc Guell (a must if you love Gaudi, took 30 minutes) My advice: stay away from hotels on the Gran Via, Las Rablas, and any of the big placa's if you're sensitive to noise. Drink the cava at the Hotel Villa Emilia. We loved it so much, we bought a bottle to take home (you cannot buy that brand at duty free in PRAT) nor did I find it at any liquor store. Hotel also sells local wines at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: portygirl
Reviews.Content: Villa Emilia is a beautiful modern hotel which although not quite central in Barcelona has a convenient Metro station nearby. The room was immaculate, tasteful & modern with great firm beds & a wonderful power shower in the bathroom. The bar was lovely to return to after an exhausting day. Breakfast was great quality & I enjoyed a lovely Bucks Fizz on my birthday with freshly squeezed orange juice & Cava. The reception staff were efficient, let us have our room early & kept our luggage securely on our last day. On future Barcelona visits I will definately return to Villa Emilia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: NiksW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villa Emilia for 3 nights in April with my friend and her parents. Every day we had a lovely breakfast, fantastic selection. There was also tea and coffee available in the afternoon and free internet use. Hotel is in a good location, ok its out of the centre a bit but very close to the tube and easy to get the tour bus. Close to the magic fountains also. The staff in the hotel were all very friendly and helpful - especially Eddie, the barman. Full of helpful tips. If I ever retuen to Barca I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One night only....”
Reviews.Author: I-hate-ironing
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotelopia, and got 10% discount! Great start! Thoroughly enjoyed this lovely hotel. Unfortunately, we only stayed one night pre-cruise, and it was pouring with rain!!! We arrived at about 9pm, and had a few drinks in the bar. The restaurant looked quite busy, which was a good sign. There is also a rooftop bar, which looked amazing, but it was closed due to the rain. Really really nice modern room with lovely slate bathroom. Cost €25 from airport in taxi Cost €15 to cruise terminal in taxi Just a shame we didn't have time to see any sights, but we'll definitely return for a longer holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Villa Emilia”
Reviews.Author: KentMrMark
Reviews.Content: Have justed returned from 3 nights at the Villa Emilia and this hotel is a fabulous place to stay. The hotel is very clean, quiet and I really cant recommend it enough. The hotel is about 20 mins walk away from the main square but we didnt mind this as the hotel is quiet and you will not be disturbed by traffic noise or people. plus its only 5 euros in cab or the metro station is 30 seconds walk away. The staff are very friendly and speak good english and will always treat you like royalty If your going to Barcelona and want to stay in a lovely hotel, which is quiet, clean and out of the main square then this is the hotel for you and you will not find any better...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Gelada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Emilia for 3 nights in April. The staff is very helpfull - we asked for an early check in and they did it. We had a spacious room with bath. The hotel gives coffee and croissants in the afternoon as part of your rate. The roof is nicely decorated and very pleasant. The hotel is not exactly in the center but it is close - 20 minutes walk. There is a metro very close. The overall experience was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel- Awesome”
Reviews.Author: sbranker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect... for either the family or a couple. My wife and I stayed there after a cruise that ended up in Barcelona and couldn't be happier. Modern, comfortable, classy, great piano bar, roof top deck that was nice, but closed. 15 minute walk to all the shopping and restaurants. Great service..let me check in early. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie-Jos
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel out from the hustle and bustle but only three tube stops away from the centre. Recommend buying the 10 journey tube ticket for convenience. Very nice small neat hotel with very friendly staff. It serves continental breakfast which is an adequate start to the day and the bar is very cosy after a long day.We booked directly with the hotel which was the same price as other web sites but they included the continental breakfast in their price. Some rooms only have a shower so if baths are your thing book a room with a bath in advance. Recommend the Blue and Red bus tours which leave fom Catalonya Square every 15 minutes and if you buy the two day pass you will more than save the additional costs by using the discount vouchers given. All the main attractions and food outlets take them. Avoid Las Ramblas restaurants as they are only there to serivce the tourists. There are plenty of nice ,better value restaurants on the side streets.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Kacer99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 8th April for 3 nights and had a very enjoyable stay. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The ooms were nice if a tad smaller than we are used to and the absence of a bath was a disappointment having said that the were nicely decorated with modern furnishings and a flat screen TV. The hotel is in a quiet location about 15 minutes walk to the Placa Catalunya or 2 minutes to the Rocaforte Metro stop (and then 5 minutes on the L3 line to the Pl. Catalunya) We did find the breakfast room a bit of a crush but the food was adequate and frequently replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely disappointed, very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: cmmiller
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews about this property I was looking forward to my stay. I arrived late Friday night, was warmly greeted and given my room key. It was then that I realised that this was going to be a less than stellar stay.
