Despite booking directly with the hotel over a month in advance, we were given a room that was located directly above the restaurant and bar. There was someone playing the piano upon my arrival and the bar was in full swing, and I could hear every word being said despite being in my room. When I asked about another room given how noisy it was, I was told the property was booked and once the piano stopped, it wouldn't be that bad. And it wasn't, until 7am when the restaurant started setting up for breakfast and I could hear every chair being moved and glass being placed. Needless to say, we got very little sleep despite trying! Do not stay in rooms 10 or 12!!! When I voiced my disappointment at check out, they were not surprised about the complaint and in all honesty, seemed to expect it, so they are aware of the problem. Given the price of the room, this sort of service is not acceptable. Too bad, the hotel was lovely, good breakfast, but that doesn't offset not getting any sleep. Bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: NancyBG
Reviews.Content: Clean, very comfortable. Helpful staff. If you want to be right in the thick of things, this may not be the location for you, as it is not right in the tourist area of town. But it was a great, safe neighborhood, within 20 - 30 minutes' walk of most sights, and 1 block from a very convenient Metro stop. The breakfast was really good, too!

Reviews.Title: “just great!”
Reviews.Author: snorkel-luvin
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive reviews of this hotel. Clean, attractive, comfortable and with very friendly staff. The breakfast was the best we had on our trip, inc. self-serve coffee, hot and cold dishes, served near the little fireplace in the lobby bar area. Be sure to enjoy the rooftop bar. We went up and had a great conversation with a lovely elderly couple--the man had grown up in the building (before renovation!) and told us stories. Villa Emilia was named after his mother. That just added to the charm of our stay. On the map, this looks far from Ramblas and the Gaudis, but it was actually an easy walk. Metro is good and quick for getting to Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: jayne64
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from a three night stay at this fabulous hotel. The hotel was fantastic. The staff were extremely helpful even down to letting us print off our boarding passes at the reception printer. It is immaculately clean and as my family would tell you i'm extremely fussy! The breakfasts are plentiful with a good choice. To my husband it was like being a child in a sweetie shop! Upon the recommendation of the barman/ manager, we bought a 2 day tourist bus ticket. It was well worth the 26 Euros. There are three routes and you can get on and off as many times as you like to explore. It gives you a chance to see places and decide if you want to go back there later or the next day to visit them. The metro is clean and safe. Not once did we feel threatened. I would recommend buying a 10 trip ticket as we both shared it, hence saving quite a few Euros. We will definately go back to this hotel, its worth every Euro!

Reviews.Title: “modern, clean,great staff bkft and lobby bar, plus excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vairolaw
Reviews.Content: I agree with all other posts. This is a great hotel and allows you to get away from the action and chaos of the Rambla and Gotic. Hotel is a short walk to the MAgic Fountains, which is a must see at Plaza Espanya, 5 min walk. Also, nice Mexican Rst down the srteet on Grand Via Catalyuna. Had a great stay despite cost of Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Uber Cool”
Reviews.Author: Ali37
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this amazing hotel. Spent the Easter weekeng at this hotel. What can I say, this hotel was a truly amazing experience. The breakfast is a must and worth paying the extra. The hotel staff were excellent. Overall this was a fabulous experience and I would certainly book here again. The hotel is in a good location and is a 1 minute walk to the metro. 10 out of 10 The only negative would be the lighting in the room is low (if I am being really picky!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellen hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elmer&Lizette
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms. Spacious, modern and clean. Breakfast is great. Well assorted and with some local products. Good location near the subway, you 'll be on the ramblas in 10 minutes. Staff is friendly. The hotel has nice deck on the roof that I expect to be very pleasant on warm evenings. Truly an excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SEFDPH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for what was my first trip to Barcelona and have nothing to complain about. The hotel is friendly, clean and modern with a completely relaxed atmosphere. The rooms were lovely, the shower powerful and the buffet breakfast a lovely way to start the day. Staying here helped contribute towards a fantastic trip and the location is perfect to see all the treats Barcelona has to offer. It is close enough if you fancy a nice walk to the Las Ramblas area but a stones through from the (extremely efficient) underground system if you would rather travel that way. All in all a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “a discovery”
Reviews.Author: gemo
Reviews.Content: villa emilia is a great new property in barcelona, run by a couple of very welcoming young (fourty something) hoteliers. its modern, yet very comfortable, a few blocks from la rumbla and the placa espana (excuse the mistakes). staff is very professionnal and friendly. the bar at groundlevel, offers an all day dining (sort of) made of tapas and small cold and warm dishes. dont forget to hit the rooftop for a very nice terrace/bar, very enjoyable at sunset. voila an excellent property, reasonably priced, with wounderfull hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the Trip Advisor reviews on hotels, I decided to try the Villa Emilla. We were in Barcelona for only two nights before taking a cruise to celebrate my Aunt's 80th birthday. Not only was I selecting a hotel for my husband and myself but 12 other members of my family!! A bit nervous indeed. I can not tell you how fantastic a choice I made and all agreed. The first evening, my Aunt experienced a fall and by the time we got back to the hotel she was faint and decided to go to the hospital. Nothing serious, just too much travel. She returned to the hotel very late in the evening so no food was available at the hotel. Without even being asked to, a staff member went to a nearby cafe and brought her back soup and bread! The hotel is very near the Metro which is easy to use and takes you all over the city. We were always happy to return to the hotel as it was such a warm and inviting place to be. Loved the breakfast, must try the rooftop, staff was like family. Thank you for making my decision perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Modern in a traditional setting”
Reviews.Author: jamesandmartha
Reviews.Content: Near Rocafort metro station, at the intersection of Disputacio and Callabria. Both are busy streets but our sixth floor room was well clear of the traffic noise. The immediate area has all the bustle of downtown, with small shops and cafes. The hotel contrasts with this in its sleek, modern design and relaxed atmosphere. On the first floor is a 'mezzanine' sitting area overlooking Reception. Here there is a computer with internet access and each day in the early evening there is a complimentary snack of coffee/tea/pastries. Up to date international newspapers come free. We spent three very pleasant nights at the hotel but since we were tourists we did not try out all the amenities (such as room service). The room was very comfortable and clean. The staff were very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Well Recommended”
Reviews.Author: magpieranger
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Villa Emilia for 3 days in Jan 2008, wish it could have been longer. 3 couples all had a great stay, hotel facilities were superb, staff friendly and helpful most spoke excellent english (well, better than mine). Breakfast was good and my wife loved the free coffee on the mezzanine floor between 5 and 7. The hotel is close enough to walk to most of the main attractions and far enough away to be peaceful at night. Loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Bargain price!”
Reviews.Author: katem2203
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Emilia for 4 nights in November for a girly getaway with a friend and absolutely loved it! I booked through lastminute.com & managed to book 4 nights for the bargain price of £285... that worked out at only £142.50 each for my friend & I so obviously we were very pleased we'd found a bargain! We flew with Ryanair to Girona airport & got the Barcelona Bus into the city. It was all very easy except that we came out of the wrong exit of the bus station & got a bit lost trying to find the metro stop! We discovered later that if we had just turned left instead of right we would've found a metro stop in about 30 seconds!! Once we found the metro it was very simple to reach the Villa Emilia... Rocafort metro on the red line is about 200m from the hotel entrance. On arriving at the hotel, my friend thought the hotel was actually a swanky bar before we walked past the entrance & realised it was our hotel... needless to say we were very impressed with the overall appearance of the place. The staff were very friendly throughout the duration of our stay & spoke very good english. The room was lovely & the maids ensured that it was spotless every day when we returned from a long day of sight-seeing. The Villa Emilia is about a 10-15 minute walk from Placa Catalunya & La Rambla where the real tourist centre is. We found lots of nice restaurants in the area, although the nightlife wasn't to our taste... maybe we were looking in the wrong places but the hotel bar was definately our preferred location after eating out in the city..... especially since draft beer was only 2 euros a glass!! A bargain price considering the posh appearance of the hotel! Another thing to note is that on the thursday, friday & saturday night the hotel had a piano player playing live music in the bar, which made for a very nice, relaxing atmosphere. The villa emilia definately made our stay in Barcelona wonderful! Oh and a final point.... the bathroom was lush!! The toiletries were even gorgeous... I'd say it was the nicest hotel bathroom I've ever seen! Definately more than worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulmarbella
Reviews.Content: Simply a wonderful hotel perfectly located just far enough from the very busy parts of Barcelona but close enough to access by foot or public transport. We were a group of 11 celebrating my 50th birthday for a weekend visit to the city. Everything is total quality from the cleaniness of the hotel to the staff working there. Was a little disappointed on arrival with the slowness of the male receptionist but after that everything was perfect. The staff cannot do enough to help you enjoy your stay. Would certainly recommend the hotel and use again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel i've ever stayed in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: frequent_traveller6
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very friendly and helpful. They went out of there way to help us. The bar downstairs is lovely to sit in and have a few drinks by the fire before heading out. The room was massive and very luxurious. Bed was nice, room had good climate control and a lovely bathroom. The hotel had a lovely terrace bar which was closed when we were there due to poor weather but we went up and had a look anyway and it would be gorgeous in the summer. A 1 minute walk to Rocafort Metro and a 20 min walk to Placa de Catalunya the main area or 5 min metro journey. Shame the hotel had no restaurant. (only gripe)

Reviews.Title: “A great stay but keep a copy of your original booking details ..”
Reviews.Author: Janet2008
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel which lived up to its photographs - those taken by other travellers are exactly our experience. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is superb and metro travel is very cheap. We also walked around the local area and had some very reasonable and tasty meals in the surrounding area. The deli next door is super. We really recommend the Turistica bus as well - buy for 2 days - almost the same cost as one - and we spent half the day riding around looking where we wanted to go back to for the rest of the trip. it is worthwhile waiting to get on the roof top - in the end it was very quick even though the queues seemed very long, but if sunny make sure you have a hat! We loved all about Gaudi and even the queues went down very quickly so don't be put off by them. Park Gaudi great, we also did one organised trip through the tourist bureau and went to a vineyard, the monastery (wonderful views) and then short trip to Sitges. We were exhaused at the end of the 5 days, and still had loads to see. There is free internet access - but only one computer - so the downside of this was that there was a family with 2 teenage children staying who were constantly on 'myface'/'youtube' or similar - and they did not follow the concept that if people are waiting you limit your access to 30 minutes......Our only disappointment was the breakfast. After reading other reviews I used the Spainbookers web-site to book 3 nights for the price of 2, although we stayed 4 nights in total.When booking through spainbookers I booked and paid for the breakfast to be included, but when we got to the hotel they said this was not an option unless you book through the hotel's own web-site. Unfortunately, when booking through spainboookers your receipt only confirms the booking and not what was included and so although we had paid for the breakfast - which was very nice - we had to pay again. We did ask to speak to the manager - who we met with the next day - but he again said they did not include breakfast through e-bookers but did give us a free drink at the bar. So - if booking through spainbookers - which had a great rate- make sure you print off each page as you go through the booking so that you have proof.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice hotel, though it may not look very Spanish”
Reviews.Author: mika_berry2009
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews and for Expedia's discount deal (stay for three nights and get one night's stay for free). The check-in was smooth, the staff was friendly. The room was, as expected, quite minimalist. Very spacious room with two single beds, what really charmed me was a box in which sample perfumes from Bulgari and two mini bottles of martini on the desk as a compliment for the guest. The bathroom was very clean and there's a very good tub (if you are used to the shallow American-style tub, this hotel's tub is going to be a treat). They provide one big bath towel and a mid-size one, if you like using the small washcloth-sized towel, bring your own. I decided to book with Expedia, although the hotel website also had a good deal that included their renowned buffet breakfast with Cava. I went for the Room-only deal with the Expedia because I wanted to expolre the breakfast scene in the neighborhood, and it was going to be cheaper to do so. The buffet breakfast at the hotel looked very nice (and indeed you can help yourself to glasses of Cava in the morning, what a treat), but it does not start until 7:30. We got up at around six (jet-lag?) and got pretty hungry so we went to look for breakfast in the neighborhood. There's a bakery between the hotel and the Metro Station Rocafort, called Pan something (sorry lost the exact name), but you'll see locals flocking to this bakery from about 6:30 so you won't miss it. Their pastries are very big, and they obviously used high quality wheat. Their sandwiches (with omelettes and jamon) were so good we went back every morning for more. You need to queue a little because there are loyal fans from the neighborhood claiming their morning fix of their pastries with cafe con leche. Back to the room. The TV, like in many European hotels, many channels didn't have any sound, or if at all, only very faint sound. The hotel staff didn't know how to fix it, so we were not able to watch too much TV, which is not very necessary anyway given you are in Barcelona. The only thing about the room is that because it is rather generically minimalist, it may remind many from the UK of a generic "luxury flats" in any city in England. It did certainly remind me of my previous flat. In other words, it did not feel very Spanish or Catalan, but it was comforting in a way, to have guaranteed cleanliness and convenience of modern flat living. I may try to stay in a place with a little stronger character next time, but I might also end up choosing Villa Emilia again because for this good price, I don't know if you can get much better service of comfort. The staff was all very kind and friendly, which was I guess very Spanish. Overall a very very nice hotel, I won't hesitate to recommend it to a good friend or family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler8888
Reviews.Content: Hotel was more than we expected. Wonderful location--nice walk to tourist spots but far from the crowds. Friendly staff with excellent suggestions for restaurants. Free internet in location where you can hear piano bar. Clean rooms. Refreshing shower. Lovely rooftop area for sitting and seeing the view. Convenient stores nearby to pick up snacks for picnics/take-out.

Reviews.Title: “Echoes of qua1's experience”
Reviews.Author: Browneire
Reviews.Content: Location wise this hotel is great, its a 2 min walk to the Metro. Then again, Barcelona has over 200 metro stops so few hotels are >5 mins from any one them. I booked a double room through the hotel website. I checked in and was handed my keycard with mediocre welcome and no warning of the twin room that awaited. Upon discovery and subsequent complaint I was told that if I got down early the next day I could probably switch room. On requesting a manager I got the clichéd 'mañana' response. The twin room was equipped with LCD tv, for no other reason other than a larger tv simply wouldn't fit into the room. Even though my tv watching was only for 5 mins at a time, it was further curtailed by the channels being out of tune. The bathroom had a sliding door which on closing leaves 30-40mm of a gap into the bedroom. On the second day I got my room changed but again was able to speak with a manager 'mañana'. The double room was far more spacious and closer to the 4star standard. On checking out I they tried to charge me an extra €10 on what my booking form read, implying that I had changed the form myself. I have would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as a good 3star if it were at a 3star price... but it eint!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel but with some issues”
Reviews.Author: blinkin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at this hotel. It is a very smart and modern hotel with plush rooms, smart bathrooms, chic bar area called the Zinc Bar. The location of the hotel was also ideal. Close to a metro station, or easy to get a taxi. We found a few issues, that might not necessarily bother some people. For example, the hotel advertises air conditioning in the rooms, however this is not on in the winter ( It was quite hot on the 6th floor) You couldnt sleep with the window open, as it was noisy. We also found the breakfast disappointing. Little choice, horrible tasting orange juice. The bar staff were very friendly. The last issue we had, which really spoilt our stay was at the end when settling the bill. We were not given the choice to pay in euros rather than pounds, so we were given a bad rate. We asked them to change this and they said it was too late, yet on the receipt it states that we were given a choice. Make sure you check this.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed ...”
Reviews.Author: buffy01
Reviews.Content: Having read the great reviews about the hotel villa emilia on this website I was really looking forward to staying in the hotel almost as much as my trip to Barcelona, unfortunately I left after my three day stay feeling a bit disappointed. The hotel IS in a great location , far enough away from the noise of the centre but with good public transport links. My main gripe was with my room, even though I had requested a room on one of the higher floors we were put into a room on the first floor , the first floor is a mezzanine overlooking the lobby and bar area ie there is no wall so therefore from inside the room we could hear the noise of people in the bar, piano playing until 1.00am and the night porter having conversations with people coming in from their nights out, also in the morning you could hear the staff getting the bar set up for breakfast. I did ask to be moved to another room but apparently the hotel was full so no joy. So my advice is request that you dont get allocated rooms 10,11 or 12 . Breakfast was fine, staff worked well to keep everything replenished and in general the staff were efficient and friendly. So overall my stay was not as good as I had expected , I'm sure if I had been staying in another room my experence would have been much more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: Poosie50
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel away from the biz but Metro just along the road. Taxi's very reasonable. Roof top bar a must! Pianist in main bar lovely as was the cava served at breakfast. If you can't face cava for breakfast then just have wine!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: mbruce28
Reviews.Content: "The city that never sleeps" Just had a great weekend in Barcelona. Thought the hotel was very clean/comfortable and the staff were very friendly. The Hotel it's self was about 20 minutes walk from the centre but after a few days there and hearing how much noice and people there was around the centre we were glad of the peace and quite we retreated to each night. If you don't like walking there is a metro station at the bottom of the road(Rocafort) which you can take quite easily to any of the other attractions. Most places were closed on a Sunday but it gave you a great change to just stroll around the city at your leisure. The square around the cathedral in the Barri Gotic seemed to be a great meeting place with the locals round about mid-day where they all danced along to tradition Catalunyan music.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, contemporary hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Pam67
Reviews.Content: I booked Villa Emilia after reading the reviews on the Tripadvisor website and was definitely not disappointed. My husband was at a conference in Barcelona and I joined him for the weekend. I loved the interior design of the hotel. it was extremely clean and we had a lovely corner room with three full height windows which made the room lovely and bright. We had a tub with a shower over it and the strength of the shower certainly wakened us up in the morning. The mattress was firmer than most hotels but I liked that and I loved the big square pillows on the bed. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is just around the corner from the metro and has got lots of lovely looking restaurants nearby. We did not try any out though as we ate in the centre on both nights. On our return to the hotel on our first evening there was a pianist playing and we sat and enjoyed the ambience whilst having a glass of bubby. There is a really nice roof terrace where you can chill out and have coffee or a drink and something to eat. The breakfast is very good too - continental style with lots of pastries, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, bread, cereals. We ate in the hotel for lunch and had a really tasty mozzarella, tomato and avocado salad with our sandwiches. I found the hotel food and drink to be very reasonably priced, I actually found most of Barcelona to be that way too. On our second evening we ate at Taller de Tapas in the Born District next to the Santa Maria del Mar Church. We had to wait 30 minutes or so for a table but it was worth it. The atmosphere is buzzing and the food was delicious. We had 8 good sized tapas dishes with a side of tomato bread followed by Crema Calatana (which we shared!) and two soft drinks was around 50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, but can be a bit too minimalist for some”
Reviews.Author: thebeatle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barca from our 1st anniversary wkend away trip and stayed 3 nights at this place. 1st impressions were that it looks great, nice Zinc Bar in foyer, smallish reception area but its not a problem. Welcome was too the point, business like but no complaints. Room was nicely decorated and very chic, but bathroom extractor fan didnt work leaving the bathroom a bit smelly and if reading this Hotel Villa Emilia, please change the type and content of bleach used in bathroom and towels, its very strong smelling, and the 2 single beds joined together is a no no (especially with the easy slipage apart on a wooden floor). Not ideal for a couple on a anniversary trip ;-) Now my point about being minimalist. The toiletteries were very limited (no shower cap for misuss, no cotton buds etc etc), no alarm clock (or clock even), not a single English TV/news/music channel (although that might be a plus point to get out and see the city for longer). No kettle or complimentry water (would be nice not to have to pay 3 euros every time for the water in the minibar, also would be nice for the maid not to remove a 3/4 full bottle of paid for water left on the desk and restock the minibar with a new bottle (which would have to be paid for again) every time we get back to room at night. Now for some plus points. The free fast wireless internet connection is good and a large safe to accomodate a laptop is perfect. The breakfast and staff serving it were excellent, Zinc bar staff friendly as well. The hotel settings and location is nice quiet, safe, clean and close to the Metro station L1 (Rocafort). Would I recommend and/or come back here, yes certainly if they started furnishing rooms with proper double beds, oh and the prices remain reasonable :)
